title: Sustainable urban mobility - development of low-emission public transport in Lublin.
description: The aim of the project is to improve the environment in the Lublin Metropolitan Area through the development of a modern, ecological public transport system based on electric trolleybuses. The investment consists in the construction of a service building for MPK vehicles with a car wash and social and economic facilities and the installation of a reversing loop for buses, commutes and parking spaces as part of the expansion of the depot for the needs of the trolleybus base for alternatively powered vehicles. The investment will be carried out in Lublin, on plots no. 78/1, 79,78/3 (area 9, sheet 11 and road lane - plot 2/3 ul. Głuska, district road) at ul. Głuska 2,4,6 in Lublin. It is also planned to expand the depot with parking spaces for buses and rebuild the exit from ul. The Deaf (Jn. 2/3, zone 1 – Abramowice) per sec. 79, division 9 – Tenth II in Lublin (outside the project). As part of the investment, it is planned to build an administrative building – where rooms such as: cloakrooms, showers, utility room, social room, toilet, car wash with car wash technical room, vehicle inspection hall. The following installations will be carried out in the building: • Hot and cold water • Heating and air conditioning • Mechanical ventilation • Sanitary sewerage • Rain sewerage • Electrical • Refrigeration • Compressed air There will be a change in the course of the external networks of the installation: water and sewage, gas (outside the project). Water supply by converting the water supply connection dn 50 PE to a connection with a diameter of dn 90 PE (water supply connection and rainwater drainage outside the project). Lighthouses illuminating the depot square will be built. In addition, it is planned to make acoustic fences that will reduce the possibility of impact of the investment on the neighboring buildings in terms of sound emission. In addition, the project will purchase 20 12 m zero-emission trolleybuses with an additional drive powered by batteries. In order to ensure proper service and operation of the delivered Trolleybuses, the Contractor shall train at the seat or place indicated by the Ordering Party 40 drivers indicated by the Ordering Party in the field of driving rules and 20 employees of technical facilities in the field of periodic maintenance and repair of Trolleybuses, including 5 employees of technical facilities in the field enabling specialist repairs along with assigning access codes to diagnostic software. The project also includes educational activities promoting the use of low-emission public transport. 1. Conducting a total of 30 educational meetings (1h each) with a zero-emission bus/trolleybus ride for preschool and school children. 2. Presentation of the purchased trolleybuses to a wider audience during the Communication Picnic organized as part of the annual celebrations of the European Mobility Week The purchased rolling stock will be stationed at the Bus Depot at ul. A. Grygowa 56 in Lublin. The city of Lublin strives for zero-emission mobility and the use of renewable energy sources for transport as much as possible. As part of the project, lighting installations with LED luminaires are planned. The LED lighting installation used as part of the project brings many environmental benefits compared to traditional light sources. This translates into savings in energy consumption. LEDs do not contain mercury, which occurs e.g. in fluorescent lamps and sodium lamps, which eliminates the risk of environmental contamination during their disposal. Traditional light bulbs convert a large part of energy into heat, while LEDs emit much less heat, which reduces the impact on the climate in enclosed spaces.

title: Integrated Communication Center for Lublin Functional Area
description: The project consists of the construction of a fully functional integrated communication.publ. node serving LOF and entire voivodeships, integrating transp.wew Lublina and LOF with regional and long-distance transp. The tasks planned in the project, such as the building, departure platforms, P+R car parks, R & D, K+R, access roads. will allow to achieve the goal of the heads, i.e. development and improvement of the system of communication.publ. integrating various types of transp.collect.in the LOF area. The implementation of the project will increase the competitiveness of the collection transport compared to the individual in terms of reduced travel time, comfort, safety and accessibility for people with disabilities. The project will increase the attractiveness of low-carbon sys.transp.publ, promote its alternatives, ecologist.forms, increase its availability, which will translate into an increase in the number of uses.communication.collect. As a result of the implementation of the project, the number of transports by public transport will be 3 939 016 units per year, use the bikers.from the parking places – 6 114 units of vehicles use. from the parking spaces – 31 755 units. The improvement.transp.pub. will reduce CO2 emissions. Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions.(CI34)- 170,35 tonnes equivalent.CO2/year. The products of the project will be: construction of transfer node – 1 pcs, objects B&R-4 pcs, number of states.post. in the object.B&R- 67 pcs, length infr.bike – 1.3 km, construction.objects P&R-1pcs, staging places. R- 6 pcs, facilities adapted to the needs of the subject: 4 pcs, energy-saving light points.-140 pcs, new/reconstruction. communication.miejsk.- 6.04 km, in tym:autobus.- 1.85 km, trolleybus. – 4.19 km. Tasks in the project: purchase of land, dokum.tech., SW, investor supervision, authorship, construction works, promotion. The results of the project will benefit residents of the city and LOF and people coming to Lublin, including students, residents of the province and the region, tourists and investors. A detailed description of the scope of the project can be found in Annex 22 to the WoD.

title: Development of zero-emission public transport in Lublin through the purchase of 20 plug-in hybrid buses and 2 chargers.
description: As part of the project, 20 plug-in hybrid buses (articulated 18m vehicles) and 2 mobile chargers will be purchased. The purchased vehicles will replace old and worn-out buses with EURO IV combustion standards. They will be used to operate the public transport network in Lublin. The purchased rolling stock will be stationed in the Bus Depot at ul. A. Grygowa 56 in Lublin. Since the 1950s, the city of Lublin has been operating zero-emission trolleybuses as one of three cities in Poland. For several years, the city has been consistently developing trolleybus communication (modernization and extension of the overhead contact line, replacement of rolling stock), replacing worn-out buses with ecological vehicles that meet the highest combustion standards, and currently introducing electric and hybrid buses to public transport in order to extend the service of the city with zero-emission rolling stock to sections without overhead contact line, and preparing charging infrastructure. The planned investment will complement the activities of the transport organizer, ZTM, in the development of electromobility in Lublin and aims to reduce emissions of harmful exhaust components into the atmosphere and reduce the operating costs of bus rolling stock by developing a zero-emission transport system, thanks to which the implementation of the project will enable the achievement of zero-emission and sustainable mobility. The purchase of new hybrid vehicles and the development of charging infrastructure is a step towards reducing CO2 emissions.

title: Development of sustainable public transport in the city of Lublin through the purchase of 9 buses
description: As part of the project, 9 plug-in hybrid buses (articulated 18m vehicles) and 2 mobile chargers will be purchased. The purchased vehicles will be used to operate the public transport network in Lublin. The purchased vehicles will replace the old and worn-out buses (on selected routes) from 2012 with EURO V combustion standards. The purchased rolling stock will be stationed in the Bus Depot at ul. A. Grygowa 56 in Lublin. Since the 1950s, the city of Lublin has been operating zero-emission trolleybuses as one of three cities in Poland. For several years, the city has been consistently developing trolleybus communication (modernization and extension of the overhead contact line, replacement of rolling stock), replacing worn-out buses with ecological vehicles meeting the highest combustion standards, and currently introducing electric and hybrid buses to public transport in order to extend the service of the city with zero-emission rolling stock to sections without overhead contact line, and preparing infrastructure for their charging. The planned investment will complement the activities of the transport organizer - IDTiM - in the development of electromobility in Lublin and aims to reduce emissions of harmful exhaust components into the atmosphere and reduce the operating costs of bus rolling stock by developing a zero-emission transport system, thanks to which the implementation of the project will enable the achievement of zero-emission and sustainable mobility. The purchase of new hybrid vehicles and the development of charging infrastructure is a step towards reducing CO2 emissions. In addition, Lublin is implementing the Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan (SUMP) for the Lublin Metropolitan Area, which aims to improve the mobility process of residents by developing a coherent cycling infrastructure and investing in low- and zero-emission public transport. The chargers will be powered by electricity from a standard 3x400 VAC socket. The traction batteries of hybrid buses will be recharged during the night break of the buses at the depot, depending on the needs and the degree of their discharge, so that on the next day of operation of the buses the operation of the hybrid system will be the most effective and ecological. The connected charger will be moved on its wheels across the depot area so that it can handle parked buses

title: Purchase of electric traction units
description: The main objective of the project is to improve the internal communication of the region by purchasing 8 modern electric rail transport units (the so-called electric traction units). The project is aimed mainly at railway passengers (both residents of the voivodship, as well as persons outside the Lublin region, using transport for family, tourism or business purposes), who form the target group of the project. The scope of the project will include the following tasks: — Feasibility study – Project management – Purchase of rolling stock – Promotion of the project Purchase of modern rolling stock will help to solve the following problems: — low quality and attractiveness of services provided in public rail collective transport in Lubelskie voivodship and the associated reduced transport accessibility of the voivodship; — decrease in the number of passengers using regional rail transport in the voivodship; — the increase in environmental damage resulting from increased use of individual transport; — the existence of barriers to travel of people with reduced mobility. The project is part of the “Strategic Development Programme for the Development of the Lublin Voivodship”, which serves to implement the Lublin Voivodship Development Strategy, in particular in the area of action 2.2 above. The programme shall: Modernising and improving the functioning of regional rail links. Chapter 7.3 of the Programme indicates the purchase of modern rolling stock for regional passenger services as one of the proposed lines of intervention. The ‘Number of persons using the purchased non-urban passenger fleet per year (persons/year) was selected as the result indicator’.

title: Construction of integrated interchange nodes with the construction of bicycle roads in the communes of Lublin County – Herby Municipality
description: In the municipality of Herby the investment includes the towns of Lisów, Chwostek, Herby and Pietrzaki. The project is located within the national road No 46 (from the west to the eastern border of the municipality of Herby), ul. It’s Košęcińska. The area of investment is characterised mainly by low housing, agricultural fields, undeveloped areas and wooded and disturbed areas, as well as within the centres of towns of multi-manufacturing, service and commercial and public utility. The investment consists mainly of the construction and reconstruction of bicycle paths and cycle tracks, as well as the construction of interchange points and their equipment, as well as the reconstruction and construction of the transport system in Herby together with the construction of the "Bike&Ride" car park. The planned investment includes part of the first stage of the described PFU, i.e. from the transfer centre in Herbach Street. Dworcowa to the village of Lisów ul. Transverse – a total of 5.92 km of bicycle road – according to the graph.

title: Development of an intelligent power grid at the Lublin Branch of PGE Dystrybucja S.A.
description: The subject of the project is the development of an intelligent power grid in Lublin PGE Dystrybucja S.A. The project includes (material description: ‘Tasks’ section and feasibility study (hereafter SW), 3.2): Task 1 Reconstruction of the 110 kV line between Radzyń and Łuków; -Task 2 Design and construction of SN Węglinek network switchgear; -Task 3 Design and expansion of 110/15 kV Piszczac station; -Task 4 Indirect costs. The measures already taken to implement the project and the state of progress in obtaining building permits are described in SW 2.2.5. All tasks are included in the document entitled ‘LIST OF INDICATIVE FEPW PROJECTS’, which was established as a result of consultations with the Lublin Provincial Government. This list has been updated on an ongoing basis in consultation with the local government. Task 1 Reconstruction of the 110 kV Radzyń - Łuków line has a set of accepted applications for reconstruction. The project is an independent unit of analysis and includes all investment tasks necessary to ensure the functionality and operability of the infrastructure immediately after the completion of the material scope. The project responds to the needs of rational energy management through the development of smart electricity grids (distribution systems) of the smart grid type, in order to increase the possibilities of RES connection, the development of zero-emission transport, as well as to ensure the stability of energy supply to customers. The Applicant, Investor and Beneficiary of the project is PGE Dystrybucja S.A. (hereinafter referred to as PGE) as the Distribution System Operator within the meaning of Art. 25 of the Energy Law Act of 10 April 1997, distributing electricity, Dz. Journal of Laws 2022, item 1385 I.e.). The applicant has adequate technical and human resources to implement the project and experience in implementing projects co-financed by the EU in the field of energy investments. The project will implement the following functionalities of the intelligent electricity distribution network, supporting the development of RES or electrification of transport: -monitoring and visualization of the load in real time; -automatic control of the voltage level and reactive power level on the bus -planning distribution networks taking into account the flexibility of distributed energy resources -dynamic network reconfiguration for optimizing the functioning of the network -automatic delivery of system services (including voltage, frequency and reactive power control) -real-time load measurement along with visualization -control of active and reactive power flow (including control of distributed sources and reactive power compensators). The implementation of the functionality is described in SW, r. 3.2. The implementation of the project will contribute to the development of electromobility by creating opportunities and potential for the development of high-voltage and low-voltage networks in the areas covered by the project. The implementation of the project, which will result in the further development of the power grid, will allow the connection to the network of elements and devices related to electromobility - such as, for example, charging stations for vehicles. In addition, the implementation of the project will allow the development of electric public transport in the provincial city of Lublin, as well as in other cities in which electric collective passenger transport operates (see "Additional information", para. ‘Does the project contribute to the development of electromobility?’). The project contributes to the development of entrepreneurship, because it will increase the available capacity, which will translate into the possibility of arming areas intended for business activity in Lublin, Piszczac, Łuków or Radzyń Podlaski. The project is in line with the principle of sustainable development and the ‘do no significant harm’ principle – SW, r. 3.5 It is planned, inter alia, to design, build, deliver and assemble 3 information boards and cost-free forms of promotion, i.e. on the Applicant’s website and to mark the documentation related to the project.

title: Construction of a cycle road on the Chwostek - Hadra section - stage II
description: The project includes the construction of the second stage of the cycle path on the Chwostek-Hadra section. The investment includes the construction of a bicycle road 1.5 km wide 2m with a 2m wide pavement connecting to the existing transfer center in Lisów. The planned right-hand cycle path will run along the district road from the last buildings in Chwostek to the intersection with district roads No.: 2327S and 2328S. The main goal of the project is to ensure the availability and integration of various forms of transport by building a bicycle path to the existing transfer center in the Herby Commune in Lisów. As part of the project, a promotional campaign will be carried out to promote the use of low-emission public transport and non-motorised traffic. The project is integrated at the level of use, which means that it will have an impact on more than one commune, improving the mobility of residents not only of the Herba commune, but also of neighbouring communes of the Central Subregion of the Silesian Voivodship, and especially of the Lublin poviat. The beneficiaries of the project undertake to inform the public about the co-financing of the implementation of the project by the European Union in accordance with the requirements of the General Regulation, the Guidelines on information and promotion of cohesion policy operational programmes for 2021-2027, the Manual of the applicant and beneficiary of European Funds for 2021-2027 in the field of information and promotion and in accordance with the Visual Identity Book of the European Funds 2021-2027 brand. Information and promotion activities within the project: 1. placing in a visible place the European Funds mark, the colour mark of the Republic of Poland, the EU mark and the figurative mark of the Silesian Voivodeship on all: a) information and promotion activities related to the project, e.g. information board, websites, b) documents and materials (including printed and digital products) made available to the public, e.g. from the environmental campaign, 2. placing a permanent information/memorial board about co-operation with the EU in a visible place of the project implementation; 3. placing a description of the project on the websites of the Project Beneficiaries; 4. documenting the infor.-prom. activities in the project, including by: keeping project-related documentation in paper and digital form. Activities will comply with accessibility standards, including: information, promotion and digital. Expenditure related to these actions will be financed through indirect costs. The project is promoted on the website of the municipality. The project complies with the principles of Article 50 of Regulation 2021/1060. https://www.herby.pl/

title: Reducing municipal pollutant emissions by modernising street lighting in Sitno Municipality
description: The main objective of the project is clearly linked and directly follows from Strategic Objective 2 of the Low-Emission Management Plan of Sitno, which is to “reduce transport pollutant emissions”. This will be achieved through the achievement of operational objective 2.2 of the above-mentioned document, i.e. Construction, reconstruction and renovation of street lighting and road safety equipment. The project in question involves the installation and replacement of luminaires on local roads for energy-saving devices. The project will be implemented throughout the municipality of Sitno. The result of the activities will be the modernisation of 550 light points (existing sodium luminaires for LED luminaires together with a comprehensive energy management system on the basis of a built-in module to reduce the intensity of light during the night). It will also generate measurable environmental and environmental effects in the form of reductions in greenhouse gas emissions – 96.87 CO2/year. Residents of the entire municipality of Sitno will use the installation directly. In accordance with the ‘Air Quality Programme for the Lublin Zone’, the analysis of the contribution of different types of sources to the height of PM10 concentrations showed a significant impact of fuel combustion sources in individual heating systems, so-called. “low Emissions”. In the municipality of Sitno it was not found that at least one limit or target level was exceeded for substances subject to an air quality assessment. However, according to the current Low-Emission Management Plan of Sitno Municipality for 2016-2023, corrective actions must be taken, which are mainly targeted at those types of emission sources associated with the so-called. “low emission.” This project can be classified as the corrective measures referred to in the above mentioned documents, as it will to some extent allow the reduction of "low emissions" by limiting the combustion of conventional fuels for the purpose of electricity production.”

title: YOUR OWN COMPANY -FERENING OF DREAMS
description: The aim of the project is to increase the number of start-ups by developing entrepreneurship among 70 people aged 30 and over who live in the Lublin Voivodeship, who remain unemployed (including registered as unemployed at the employment office), excluding persons registered in the National Court Register, CEiIDG or operating under separate regulations (including, among others, legal, bailary or educational activities) during the 12 months preceding the date of joining at least one of the following groups: —people aged over 50 (15 %), women (55 %), people with disabilities (10 %), long-term unemployed(10 %), low-skilled people(60 %), as a result of comprehensive support in the form of: training and advice (individual and group) enabling you to obtain the knowledge and skills necessary to start up and run a business, support in the form of one-off grants for starting a business, training and advisory bridge support, financial bridging support, in the period from 06.2017 to 01.2019. At least 91 % i.e. 64 people will open their own operations and lead it through the min.18 months in the Lublin Voivodeship. In addition, at least 20 % of UP will create additional workplaces (prem cover). The project envisages the creation of additional jobs by project participants who, through ESF funds, will set up their own business and create additional jobs for other people in the sectors: — white economy (i.e. sectors related to the treatment, health, pharmaceuticals, medical and care services and the medical products industry) and/or the green economy (except agriculture), i.e. sectors related to collective transport, renewable energy sources, construction and waste management (crit. prem.)(min.1). The project prefers the creation of social enterprises (recruitment).

title: Development of a Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan for MOF Kraśnik
description: The main objective of the project is to develop a Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan for MOF Kraśnik (hereinafter referred to as SUMP). In accordance with the Lublin Voivodship Development Strategy until 2030, Kraśnik's MOF consists of: City of Krasnik – as a core centre, rural municipalities: Kraśnik and Dzierzkowice and the urban-rural commune of the Offices. The SUMP will be a long-term strategy, focused on ensuring good access to travel and services, including an implementation plan. In line with the Commission's position expressed in the Guidelines on the development and implementation of a sustainable urban mobility plan, the main features of SUMPs are: • long-term vision and transparent implementation plan, • participatory approach, • balanced and integrated development of all modes of transport, • horizontal and vertical integration, • evaluation of current and future effectiveness, • regular monitoring, review and reporting • taking into account external costs for all modes of transport, Main objectives of the SUMP: • providing all citizens with transport options that allow access to travel and services, • improving safety, • contributing to the reduction of air and noise pollution, greenhouse gas emissions and energy consumption, • improving the efficiency and cost-effectiveness of the transport of people and goods, • a positive impact on the attractiveness and quality of the urban environment for the benefit of residents, the economy and the community as a whole. Stages of SUMP preparation: 1 Preparatory work • traffic surveys, • analysis of the accessibility of public transport for specific areas, • analysis of the emission performance of public transport rolling stock (current and planned) • road safety statistics • surveys 2. Developing a SUMP • identifying the potential for success of the SUMP • defining the development process and scope of the plan, • analysing the mobility situation and developing scenarios, • formulating a common vision, • setting priorities and measurable objectives, • developing effective sets of measures, • agreeing clear responsibilities and allocating budgets, • embedding monitoring and evaluation systems in the plan, • adopting the SUMP in accordance with the Kraśnik SUMP MOF agreement will include a package of actions on: • promoting green transport • urban logistics, delivery of goods and services • mobility management and intelligent transport systems (SUMPs) will include solutions: • technical and technological measures to reduce the environmental impact of the project (meeting the highest existing standards at European level). • Technical and technological efficient use of less raw materials and resources, including materials, energy. • ICT innovation leading to reduced pollution, reduced congestion, increased safety for road users, reduced noise, reduced time and reduced travel costs. • enabling people with special needs to use the transport system beyond the applicable legal requirements In accordance with Regulation (EU) No 1315/2013 of the PEU and of the Council of 11 December 2013, the SUMP will include, inter alia: • accessibility of refuelling and recharging infrastructure for alternative fuels, • measures to integrate different modes of transport, • deployment and use of telematic applications, • promoting effective zero-emission mobility, including sustainable and zero-emission urban logistics, • reducing air and noise pollution, improving or maintaining the quality of infrastructure in terms of safety of accessibility for all users, including older people, persons with reduced mobility and passengers with disabilities, as well as ensuring the quality of services • taking into account trans-European long-distance transport flows, • measures to reduce the exposure of urban areas to the negative impact of transport

title: Services in a foreign language
description: The aim of the project is to acquire/increase to V.2018 key competences in the field of knowledge of foreigners in the labour market in Lublin, at least 628 people (min.90 % of participants) with low-skilled age 25+ (min.440K) including 30 % of people aged 50+, i.e. 189 (133K) – English or German at A1 levels (max 30 %) and A2 (min 70 %) compatible with ESOKJ. Key RESULTS AND PRODUCTS: — Number of low-skilled persons aged 25+ who will be qualified or qualified after leaving the programme: 628 (440K), of which: age 50+ 189 (133K). — Number of low-skilled people aged 25+ supported in the programme: 696 (488K), of which: aged 50 + 209 (147K); — Number of unemployed, including the long-term unemployed supported by the 70 programme (49K); — Number of inactive persons supported by the programme 30 (21K); — Number of persons with disabilities supported in the programme 140 (98K). The project provides support for 696 people (min. 488K) of ter.lubelski voivodship (KC) who, on their own initiative, are interested in acquiring, supplementing or increasing language competences, with a maximum education of ISCED3, including at least 20 % of them are disabled (rewarding criteria) and 30 % at the age of 50+ (recipient cover). Due to the situation of women on the labour market, it was specified that 70 % of the doc group will be K. Due to the difficult financial situation and lack of opportunities alone. fin. language training. the project will cover min. 70 people unemployed (49K) and 30 inactive incl. IT’S 21K. Training will be carried out (in several towns in the voivodship) in groups of max 12 persons at levels A1 and A2 (according to ESOKJ) from the language: English – 46 groups, German – 12 groups, ending with a call exam. “Toeic Bridge” (WiDaF Basic) and the issue of internar. certification confirming comp. language according to ESOKJ. Topics focus on service industries including tourism, transport, logistics, construction, trade, etc.

title: Active in the labour market
description: OBJECTIVE: professional activation and adaptation of professional skills and qualifications to the needs of the labour market in accordance with the individual needs of 108 persons (60K/48M) of adults living in the project area in the voivodeship of Lublin employed on short-term contracts, civil law contracts, working poor through tailored labour market instruments and services based on the IPD, including professional development workshops, vocational and computer training, job placement implemented in the period 1.03.2025- 31.05.2026. The main problem of people employed on short-term contracts, civil-law contracts, working poor is the inadequacy of skills and professional qualifiers for the needs of the labour market and low activity in order to improve the situation of the labour market, which was diagnosed in the FELU Programme 2021-2027 and supported by an analysis of studies / research on the labour market. The partners want to minimise the problem by implementing the following ACTIONS (each PA will receive an offer of support, including forms of assistance that will be identified as necessary in order to change/improve the situation on the labour market): 1) Identification of needs with the Individual Action Plan - a mandatory action defining the scope of further support and tailored labour market instruments and services based on the IPD depending on the needs: 2) Vocational training in line with the Smart Specializations of the War. Lublin, i.e. IS GREEN ECONOMY/ IS HEALTHY SOCIETY/ IS DIGITAL SOCIETY, tailored to the individual needs of each UP (predisposition, potential and opportunities) and responding to the demand of the labour market, 3) Computer training (primarily addressed to young people in accordance with the recommendations of the Youth Guarantee), allowing to supplement the digital competences required in many professions / workplaces 4) Vocational development workshops developing soft skills necessary in the modern labour market; 5) Job placement to support you in finding a stable, better paid job. The project will contribute to the achievement of the ESF+ specific objective 4(a) indicated in the FE for Lublin 2021-2027 programme "Improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, in particular through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups on the labour market, as well as for passive workers, as well as through the promotion of self-employment and the social economy" thanks to the comprehensive support of Project Participants (POs) in the field of vocational activation and improvement of qualifications and competences/skills in accordance with individual needs, which will improve their situation on the labour market. The RESULT will be obtained by at least 98 persons (54K/44M). INFORMATION AND PROMOTIONAL ACTIVITIES: will be carried out in the area of project implementation using tools/methods tailored to the recipients: *website and social media (according to the WCAG 2.1 standard) with information about the project, including dokum.rekrut.to download; *posters (non-stereotypical images of K/M/OzN; materials recruit.readable, described in simple language, language sensitive to gender) distributed to OPS, PCPR, UG, PFRON, in public places (advertising boards / public transport); *mailing the institutions/org.supporting the OzN with a request for information; *Information meetings. Information about meetings provided, among others, to local authorities, e.g. spouses, mayors in order to disseminate.Meetings at different hours enabling reconciliation of professional and private life; * informing about the project in the Design Office (BP). Office and meetings in places accessible to OzN; *all materials/products produced in the project (documentation, recruitment, promotional, training materials) will bear information about EU co-financing.

title: A new profession – new opportunities
description: The aim of the project is in the period 01.03.2019-28.02.2022 to obtain professional qualifications in out-of-school forms by 133 persons, through participation in qualifying vocational courses and gaining the possibility of confirming the qualification in the profession through participation in external executions by 150 adults (75K, 75M), on their own initiative interested in acquiring, raising or supplementing qualified persons and eligible to join the profession, who reside in Lublin Voivodeships. All participants in the project will be given the opportunity after the courses to pass external enforcement at the Regional Examination Commissions. Up will be given the opportunity to gain new qualifications in the professions of intelligent specialisations and sectors of rapid growth of the region: —low carbon energy: KKZ1 Renewable energy equipment and systems technology – Creative industries: KKZ2 Digital graphics process technology – transport and logistics: KKZ3 Logistics technology – tourism: KKZ4 Rural tourism technology In addition, the project provides for the implementation of KKZ5 Cosmetic services technology The courses last for 2 years in a mixed form: stationary classes, on-line lectures, practical classes in employers working with the Applicant. title: Priority programme "Clean Air" implemented in Lubelskie Voivodship
description: As part of the project, a nationwide priority program will be implemented. ‘Clean Air’ (hereinafter: Programme or PPCP) in the form of a grant project in accordance with Article 41 of the Implementation Act of 28 April 2022 in the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The aim of the PPCP is to improve air quality and reduce greenhouse gas emissions by replacing inefficient heat sources with solid fuel and improving the energy efficiency of single-family residential buildings (hereinafter: bmj). The grantees are natural persons - owners/co-owners of bmj or a dwelling separated in this building with a separate land and mortgage register (KW). Projects implemented under PPCP may concern the exchange of heat sources, including heating systems powered by natural gas. Projects combining the exchange of heat sources with thermal modernisation are preferred through higher financial support, but this is not a necessary requirement. The project includes solutions for energy efficiency and RES.The scope of the grantees is indicated in point I (Scope of the project). As a result of the implementation of the project, at least the threshold of saving primary energy will be reached. 30% at the level of the project and the entire PPCP. Energy audits. are eligible but non-mandatory – a simplified tool for calculating energy savings will be used. The project fits directly into the objectives of FEnIKS in the area of PRIORITY. And, Goal detail. 2.1. Improving energy efficiency, including at home, is an essential activity within the above-mentioned objective and will reduce energy demand and, consequently, greenhouse gas emissions. The programme is a key project of the Renovation Wave strategy, i.e. the Europ initiative. The Green Deal. The project fits directly into the type of project indicated in the SOP and the Recruitment Regulations, i.e. Improvement of the energy effect in residential buildings (including RES installation) – contribution to the Clean Air Programme (Measure FENX.01.01) and type of beneficiaries – wfośigw. The scope of intervention includes code 041 and code 056. The indicators indicated in point C correspond to specific codes, taking into account their definition and the specificity of the project. The project will be implemented in the Lubelskie voivodship, including the OSI indicated in the NSRF 2030: medium-sized cities losing their economic functions and areas at risk of permanent marginalisation. The project management system, including inter-sectoral cooperation with municipalities, is described in section H1. The Programme cooperates with the World Bank – analytical support in shaping PPCP and implementation conditions. The project under the PPCP assumes cooperation, including the exchange of knowledge and experience and consultations with partners from other Member States, thanks to cooperation with WB experts from, among others, Lithuania and the Czech Republic. The investment scope includes projects implemented by grantees. The non-investment scope includes: -direct costs: info-promo and educational activities, -indirect costs: expenditure on the management and operation of PPCP incurred by the WFOŚiGW in Lublin. The implementation of the project in the field of investment is in line with the objectives and assumptions of the EU Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region. The implemented projects will contribute to the achievement of indicators for the ENERGY thematic area, including activities in the field of energy effects and RES, and will have an impact on the achievement of the specific objective: climate change adaptation, prevention and risk management. The project is in line with the New European Bauhaus values: beauty, sustainability and community and will contribute to the achievement of objectives through the implementation of projects changing the homogeneous construction sector in order to improve the quality of life towards sustainable development and decarbonisation. The project is not complementary to supra-local development strategies, strategic and/or planning documents created as part of local government cooperation (cd point I).

title: Renewable energy sources in the municipality of Nielisz
description: The main objective of the project is to improve energy efficiency through the use of a renewable energy system in the area of Nielisz Municipality. Improving air quality in the Nielisz Commune will contribute to minimising epidemiological threats and reducing environmental pollution. Achieving this priority is planned by carrying out measures related to the reduction of emissions of pollutants into the air, e.g. particulate matter, sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides. The target group of the project, which will benefit directly from the implementation of the project at the level of its implementation, are the residents of the municipality of Nielisz, the benefits of the project will also be noticeable at the natural level. The project implements the provisions of the “Lublin zone air protection programme” enabling the reduction of “low emissions”, by reducing fuel combustion in conventional heating systems as well as the project fits into the strategic objective of the Low Emission Economy Plan for Nielisz Municipality: “transformation of the municipality of Nielisz towards a low-carbon economy by reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving energy efficiency, increasing the use of energy from renewable sources and improving air quality”. The expected result of the measures taken will be the construction of installations supporting renewable energy sources, i.e.: installation of solar collectors 182 pcs. and photovoltaic panels 325 pcs. for residents of the Nielisz Commune.The key results of this project will be: — Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) — 1.5810 MW — Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) -857.7040 t/year — Production of electricity from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations — 902.33600 MWhe/year — Heat generation from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations — 190.8400 MWhe/year.

title: Reconstruction and expansion of the building at ul. Narutowicza 32, 32b for the needs of the District Prosecutor’s Office Lublin – Północ in Lublin
description: The investment is located in Lublin, Lublin Voivodeship at ul. Narutowicza 32, 32b. The building has 3 floors above ground and is completely cellared. It was built in traditional technology of full brick. Part was originally built, built in 1925, and the rest was added in 1965. The building is under conservation protection. The facility was previously the seat of the Centre for Culture, and its current technical state requires investment to improve energy efficiency, reduce energy demand or obtain energy from renewable sources.

title: Renewable energy sources in the Big Niedoor
description: The main objective is to fulfil the tasks that contribute to meeting the obligations arising from the EU’s energy and climate package and the Europe 2020 Strategy. The project pursues its objectives, i.e. Improving air quality in the municipality, Improving the economic efficiency of the heat production system by increasing the number of people covered by RES installations, Improving investment attractiveness. The project also covers and complies with the activities included in the ‘Air Protection Programme for the Lublin Zone’. The project is located in area VII Modern Village according to SRWL. The municipality belongs to the Lubelskie Voivodeship and the Lubelskie county. Results of the project: Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) Mg/year – 113 in 2018, Project products: Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) – 3.393 MW, Number of built units of thermal energy from RES – 657 units. The material scope includes the installation of 60 kilns with a total power of 1500 kW (cares have a capacity of 25 kW each) and 597 vacuum manifold installations with a total power of 1893.92 KW (the power of individual installations are 175 of 2.72 kW and 422 per 3.36 kW), heat meters with (5 % remote reading), and services launched within the framework of ICT 2: 1 portal will be to: reporting accidents, asking questions, information, transactions, concluding and changing contracts. 2 The portal will have functionalities related to monitoring customer satisfaction by providing data on monitored energy as well as participation in electronic public consultations. As a result of the project, there will be a place of work for a disabled person reading, providing current information, feeding portals into the data, carrying out surveys. The project is aimed at individual households. The investment results from PGN Municipality Niedrzwica Duża – Strategic Target – str. 65 and Action No 2.1 p. 68 Reducing emissions of pollutants resulting from the production of heat.

description: The aim of the project is to thermally modernise the building of the Postal School – Medical Vocational Study in Lublin, expectations related to the implementation of the project will therefore involve modernisation of infrastructure and reducing emissions of pollutants into the atmosphere, which will contribute to improving the natural environment and increase the quality of life of residents. The implementation of the project will contribute to reducing costs related to the maintenance of buildings and infrastructure in the city, thereby improving the city’s air condition and reducing CO2 and other harmful substances resulting from energy efficiency. The implementation of the project will primarily improve the quality of the atmosphere, which will contribute to counteracting the degradation of the natural environment and improve the living conditions of residents. The socio-economic benefits of the project are primarily: * improving the quality of ambient air, * improving the quality of life and health of inhabitants of the region, * reducing the operating costs of the building used, * improving the image and attractiveness of the region, * improving environmental education and its protection, * addressing social inequalities and social exclusion. title: Launching the production of innovative melting furnaces for aluminium and other non-ferrous metals
description: The project submitted by “NORGPOL” Czerwiński Public Company (NORGPOL) consists of launching a new production plant. The construction of the new plant will enable the launch of a new innovative solution, such as the energy-efficient melting furnaces of aluminium and other non-ferrous metals developed by the company. • improve furnace insulation, • reduce electricity consumption, • prolong the crucible life, • improve the efficiency and efficiency of the furnace, • improve maintenance safety, • reduce kiln operating costs. The investment will consist of the construction of a new production hall and the purchase of modern machinery and equipment forming a complete line of production of kilns. The investment will be located in the Lublin Voivodeship in Ryki. The project will be implemented in the period 09.2018-03.2020 and will include the construction of a production and storage hall and its equipment with machinery and equipment necessary to start production of kilns. SA 42799(2015/X), Article 13, 651/2014

title: Research Centre for the recovery of energy and raw materials from waste
description: The aim of the project is to create a modern research center that will study the recovery of energy and raw materials from waste, thus supporting activities for the sustainable development of the Lublin region. The search for advanced ways of converting waste into useful products and the recovery of water from wastewater are among the priority directions of action in the situation of depletion of natural resources, shrinking of water supplies, soil depletion in organic matter, as well as the need to reduce the pressure of human activity on the environment. As part of the project (sections 1-6), 4 research posts are planned to be created: - calorific value of waste (which includes a calorimeter with a bomb calorimeter., CHNS analyzer, muffle furnace with forced flow), - anaerobic transformations in liquid media, - removal of contaminants from sewage and water, - water retention, and purchase of 2 devices: - a mass spectrometer with a reaction flow chamber - an optical profilometer. All the above-mentioned equipment will be located in the building of the Faculty of Environmental Engineering of the Lublin University of Technology (PL), a detailed description is given in Annex II. 12. In addition, it is planned to carry out adaptation works in the rooms, consisting in painting walls and connecting devices to the existing internal water and sewerage network (the scope of work for individual stations is given in the Tasks section). One of the tasks of the project is also to carry out activities aimed at supporting the development of the competences of people managing the apparatus, leading to an increase in the level of its use in R&D activities. The Centre's activities will focus on intensifying the use of waste and biomass, reducing the energy intensity and carbon footprint of processing processes, as well as improving the efficiency of energy and valuable raw materials recovery from wastewater, mineral and organic waste. The study will also assess the possibility of creating new materials based on waste and by-products, including those that increase soil water retention. The purchase of the above-mentioned equipment will enable the following objectives to be achieved: 1.Assessment of the impact of the conditions of conducting the anaerobic decomposition process on the composition and properties of the main and by-products, taking into account various technological parameters. 2.Assessment of the possibility of recovering domestic water from wastewater and its application, with emphasis on the processes of purification and material recovery. 3.Assessment of the energy parameters of waste and the properties of products resulting from its treatment, in order to indicate the most advantageous method of energy use of waste. 4.Determination of concentrations of strategic elements in selected types of waste and assessment of the cost-effectiveness of their recovery. The planned infrastructure does not duplicate existing research capabilities, but expands them with new areas, including research on the energy potential of waste, water recovery from wastewater, biogas production in reactors with a granular deposit, physical changes in the surface of waste undergoing processing. The project assumes the development of innovative solutions in the field of effective recovery of nutrients, organic compounds from solid waste and wastewater, water from wastewater or metals from mineral waste. The expected effects of the project will concern raising the level of scientific research of teams using the purchased equipment, strengthening R&D activities and developing cooperation with entrepreneurs from the region. Extending the scope of services for external entities will therefore have a positive impact on the economy of the Lublin region, increasing the competitiveness of products and services in the field of waste management, which is particularly important in the situation of the transformation of the linear economy into a circular economy. The project fits in with the strategic objectives of the Lublin region, supporting the innovative development of the economy based on the region's resources and increasing the ecological awareness of the inhabitants.

title: “Reduction of pollutant emissions in Susiec by using solar energy”
description: The main objective of the project is to improve energy efficiency through the application of a renewable energy system in the municipality of Susiec. Improving air quality in the municipality of Susiec to reduce environmental pollution. This priority is to be achieved by means of measures to reduce emissions of pollutants into the air, including particulate matter, sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides. The target group of the project, which will directly benefit from the implementation of the project at the level of its implementation, are residents of the municipality of Susiec. The benefits of the project will also be noticeable at the natural level. This project implements the provisions of the “Air Protection Programme for the Lublin Zone” allowing for a reduction of “low emissions”, by reducing the combustion of fuels in conventional heating systems, as well as the project is in line with the priority of the Low-Emission Management Plan in the municipality of Susiec: “Improving air quality by reducing carbon emissions and increasing energy efficiency in the Municipality and contributing to the achievement of the targets set out in the 2020 climate and energy package. The expected result of the measures will be the construction of facilities supporting renewable energy sources, i.e.: installation of solar collectors – 244 pcs. and photovoltaic panels 45 pcs. for residents of the municipality of Susiec. The key results of this project will be: — Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) -1,1155 MW – Estimated annual reduction in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) – 324,2980 t/year – Electricity production from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations115,6200 MWhe/year – Heat production from newly built/new RES installations 252,8400 MWhe/year

title: Thermal modernisation of public buildings in Zamość Municipality – SP Mokre, SP Pniówek, SP Leipzig, SP Borowina Sitaniecka.
description: The main objective of the project is to reduce low emissions, improve energy efficiency and use of renewable energy sources in public buildings, i.e.: Primary school in Sitaniecka boron, Leipzig Primary School, Wekrem Primary School and Primary School in Pniówek. The scope of construction works planned in the project includes a deep thermal modernisation of the above mentioned buildings. The project will improve air quality, reduce emissions of pollutants into the atmosphere by replacing old heating systems with low energy efficiency and installation of equipment using renewable energy sources (PV panels). By replacing the heating system, warming the external walls and replacing leaky doors and windows, emissions from combustion to the atmosphere, including CO2, will be reduced and the technical condition of the facilities will be reduced. The target group of the project, which will benefit directly from the implementation of the project at the level of its implementation, consists of pupils and employees of educational institutions, officials, as well as residents of the Zamość Municipality, and then the entire Lublin Voivodeship, who will experience a real improvement in air quality. This will definitely improve the quality of life of residents and the reduction of pollutants supplied to the air will improve their health condition. The benefits of the project will also be visible at the natural level. The expected result of the measures taken will be a reduction in the demand for heat and electricity in 4 public buildings. The key results of this project will be: — The amount of heat energy saved: 3202,22 GJ/year, Number of energy upgraded buildings – 4 units, Number of built units of electricity generation from RES – 4 pieces.

description: The main objective of the planned investment is to improve the quality of social services provided by improving energy efficiency in the public utility building, which remains in the resources of the University of Life Sciences in Lublin. The target group are students and employees of the University of Warsaw and other residents of Lublin. The project will carry out the following tasks: Thermal modernisation of the building – the task includes the following elements: Energy-efficient lighting, Photovoltaic installation, Sanitary industry: energy management system, modernisation of the central heating system, construction industry – insulation of external walls, – warming of ventilated stropods, – insulation of external ceilings, – window replacement, – Replacement of existing doors, – Making new treatments of sheet metal cornices and drain pipes (under the cost of ineligible repair of chimneys and lightning systems); Promotion of the project – creation of an information and memory board; Investor supervision; Technical documentation; Energy audits; A feasibility study; It’s project management. A photovoltaic installation on the roof of the building with a power of 0.049 MW will be performed. The following result indicators will be achieved under the investment: Additional capacity to generate electricity from renewable sources [0,049MWe]; Additional generation capacity from renewable sources (CI30) [0,049 MW]; The amount of thermal energy saved [3522GJ/year]; The amount of electricity saved [68 MWh/year]; Production of electricity from newly built RES installations [54,17MWhe/year]; Electricity generation from newly built/new RES installations [54,17MWhe/year]; Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) [52tonnes of CO2/year]; Reduction of annual primary energy consumption in public buildings (CI32) [203880 kWh/year]

description: The main objective of the project is to increase the energy efficiency of two buildings located in the MPK Lublin depot. MPK Lublin Sp. z o.o. and protection and improvement of the environment through a deep thermal modernisation with the use of renewable energy sources. The tasks planned in the project are: 1.Main building: — modernisation of central heating system, – replacement of built-in lighting for energy-saving, – warming of ceilings, – replacement of windows and skylights, – replacement of doors/gates, – execution of photovoltaic installation – performance of energy audit 2. Auxiliary building with workshop facilities: — modernisation of central heating installations – modernisation of central heating installations – warming of ceilings – replacement of windows and skylights – replacement of doors/gates – replacement of built-in lighting for energy efficient – insulation of external walls – production of photovoltaic installation – implementation of energy management system – performance of energy audit. The results of the project expressed by indicators are: The amount of heat savings 7210,38 GJ/year; The amount of electricity saved 85,44 MWh/year; Electricity generation from newly built/new RES installations 27,78 MWhe/year; Production of electricity from newly built installations using RES 27,78 MWhe/year; An estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions of 753.12 tonnes of CO2 equivalent/year; Reduction of final energy consumption as a result of projects 7517.97 GJ/year; Additional generation capacity from renewable sources of 0,04 MW; Additional capacity to generate electricity from renewable sources of 0.04 MWe. The target group of the project is the enterprise MPK Lublin sp. z o.o., its employees and Customers, as well as indirectly, thanks to the improvement of air quality surrounding residents.

Increase the energy from RES. Target group. investment residents of Międzyrzec Podlaski commune. The scope of the project.assembly of a total of 100 units, heat sources (RES and gas): pellet boilers: 16 kW-28 pcs;24 kW-21 pcs; gas boilers: 16 kW-27 pcs; 24 kW-20 pcs; 33 kW-4 pcs.
