title: Extension of provincial road No 747 from the intersection with national road No 9 in Iłża to the intersection with national road No 79 in Lipsko
description: The scope of the project includes the extension of provincial road No 747 from the junction with national road No 9 in Iłża to the junction with national road No 79 in Leipzig. In particular, the following projects are planned under the project: - Extension of the main route of the class G provincial road with a length of more than 29 km, - construction of additional carriageways providing service to the area adjacent to the investment, - reconstruction of existing public roads - construction of intersections - construction and extension of individual and public exits - construction of a system of pavements and bicycle paths - construction of bus bays and bus platforms - construction of pedestrian crossings and bicycle crossings - construction of viaducts and bridges within the projected provincial road No 747 - construction and demolition of the electricity network - demolition of light signalling devices - construction and demolition of the telecommunications network - construction and demolition of the water supply network - construction of the sewage (rain) network - construction and demolition of the sewage network - construction and demolition of the gas network - demolition of existing buildings colliding with the investment Projected route of the provincial road DW747 only on a section. 3.3 km coincides with the current mileage. Details of point. 5.1 SW. The implementation of the project will contribute to the following outputs and results: Construction of a provincial road with a length of 26,046 km. Modernization/reconstruction of the provincial road for a length of 3.3 km, Construction of a system of sidewalks and bicycle paths. Including cycling infrastructure (cycle paths of 0,876). Achieve time savings through improved road infrastructure - result indicator set at 9 098 person-days/year. The annual number of users of newly built, rebuilt, extended or upgraded roads under the project was estimated at 42 998 929 passenger-kilometre/year. The main users of the project will be: residents of the municipalities of Iłża, Rzeczniów, Sienno, Lipsko, entrepreneurs operating in this area, employees, suppliers, customers, as well as other road users from the Mazowieckie Voivodeship, and in particular its southern part. Road 747 (including the section covered by the project) connects directly (via the Lublin ring road) to the TEN-T network (S19-Via Carpatia, S17). The project will improve the connection to the TEN-T network (S17, S19-Via Carpatia), the border crossing points in Dorohusk (UA) and Hrebenne (UA) and the network of national (79, 9) and provincial roads. The implementation of the project will improve the quality of transport connection with Radom, including the Warsaw-Radom Airport. It will establish a link with the public transport subsystem. It will improve access to logistics centres in Radom and Leipzig districts. This project: - co-creates comprehensive area solutions - the project is the final element filling the last gap in the existing infrastructure in a given area (the last stage of expansion/reconstruction of the entire 93 km of the DW 747 route), - directly uses the products or results of other projects in the field of road infrastructure expansion (extension of DW 747 on the section Lipsko - Lublin bypass with the bridge over the Vistula), - performs together with other complementary projects the same function, thanks to which the capabilities of the existing infrastructure are fully used, - together with other projects it is used by the same users. The project aims to ensure faster and safer connections between central centres and other areas of the voivodship, better access to the network of national roads, regional economic centres, existing and planned industrial and service facilities and investment areas. The road in question will constitute a public infrastructure for the use of which users will not be charged. There will be no discriminatory factors.

title: “ Improving transport accessibility of the city of Białystok from Warsaw ( national departure road from Białystok – access to S8 ) ” ( title from the Transport Plan POPW – Reconstruction of DK8 on the section from the border of the town of Białystok to the Poros junction ( DK8 ) and reconstruction of DW676 on the section from the junction al. John Paul II from St. National Armed Forces in
description: The planned project includes a comprehensive reconstruction of DK8 at the entrance to Białystok from the direction of Warsaw. The project fragments DK8, DW676 and DW669 constitute the only connection of Podlaskie voivodship with the central and south-western regions of Poland, as well as an element of the urban bypass that leads both to the mid-city bypass and to transit roads towards Warsaw, Ełku, Augustów, Bobrownik and Lublin. This project is an integrated project. Integration of the project involves the implementation of road investments related to the reconstruction of the S8 road. The scope of the project was divided into two tasks, i.e. the construction of a road junction in Porosłay: ul. F. Kleeberg – DK8 – DW 676 – Al. John Paul II along with the viaduct above railway line No. 38 in the street. It’s a gene. F. Kleeberg and construction of the intersection Al. John Paul II – Al. Independence – ul. National Armed Forces. As a result of the project, products will be created: — length of national roads rebuilt in the TEN-T network – 1,79 km; — length of reconstructed voivodship roads – 2.8 km. Direct beneficiaries of the Project will be: — residents of Białystok and its functional area commuting to work, for commercial purposes or using health care or public administration offices located in the city of Białystok; — potential and present investors and their counterparties using industrial infrastructure located in the Bialystok Functional Area; — all road users with particular regard to transit crossings through the voivodship; — tourists visiting the region.

title: Construction/reconstruction of voivodship road No. 835 Lublin — Przeworsk — Grabownica Starzeńska on the section from DK 94 to the city of Kańczuga — stage I
description: The main objective of the project is to increase transport and transport accessibility to high-speed roads in the region and to improve the safety of users of provincial road No. 835. The subject of this project is: construction of a new section of the provincial road with a length of about 2.12 km from the junction with DK94 in m. Gwizdaj to the junction with DW835 in m. Przeworsk — extension of the existing section DW 835 in length approx. 4.00 km from km 150+ 600 m. Przeworsk to km 154 + 600 m. Urzejowice. Parameters of the road being built/developed: class G, load capacity: 115 kN/axis. The project provides, inter alia, for: — necessary preparatory works (including demolition), earthworks, reinforcement of weak ground, implementation of road embankment reinforcement, construction of pavement construction, — construction/extension/reconstruction of crossings with public roads (province, district and communal) — 6 pcs. — geometry correction and replacement of road surface construction of public roads of other categories in the field of crossroad extension — construction of engineering facilities — MD-1 bridge and culverts (load class A, load capacity 50 tonnes) along with adaptation of the MD-1 bridge to perform the function of transition for medium-sized animals and strengthening of the bottom and creek slope; — construction/redevelopment of pedestrian pavements, — construction of bus bays, — construction/reconstruction of individual and public exits; — construction/reconstruction of road ditches and surface drainage system, — construction of gravitational rainwater drainage, — construction of staple street lighting, — reconstruction/protection of technical infrastructure conflicting with the investment, — removal of conflicting trees and shrubs and making the required plantings, — execution of vertical, horizontal and traffic safety devices — execution of rescue archaeological research on the site of archaeological site No. 1 Studzians.

title: Infrastructure for non-motorised road users in Lublin
description: The aim of the project is to develop and strengthen sustainable urban mobility by developing infrastructure for non-motorised traffic and public transport. The project consists in the expansion of the bicycle and pedestrian road system with pedestrian crossings, bicycle crossings, bus bays, street lighting and a technological channel. The scope of the project includes, among others: - construction of a pavement in Osmolicka Street, - reconstruction of a pavement in Kazimierza Wielki Street, - construction of a bicycle path in Abramowicka Street, - construction of a bus bay, a bicycle path, a walking and cycling path, construction / reconstruction of pavements along Warsaw Al., - construction of a bicycle road and reconstruction of a pedestrian road at Nałęczowska Street, - construction of a pavement along Lower Virgin Mary Street, - construction of a bicycle road with crossings and reconstruction of a pedestrian road and crossings in the vicinity of junctions at: Lwowska, Podzamcze, Ronda Mohyły, - construction of a road for bicycles and pedestrians between ul.Kryształowa and ul.Berylowa, - construction/reconstruction of pavements, pedestrian crossings, street lighting in ul.Montażowa, - construction/reconstruction of pavements, pedestrian crossings, street lighting in ul.Sławinek, - construction of a pavement, bicycle path, street lighting, pedestrian crossings in ul.Raszyńska and Tarninowa, - construction of a bicycle path, pavements, bus bays, pedestrian crossings and street lighting in ul.Zorza, - information and promotional and educational activities. Part of the scope of the project has been implemented or is in the process of being implemented. The project will create cycle paths and pavements that will complement the missing elements of the already existing bicycle and pedestrian road system in the city and build/rebuild public transport infrastructure to better integrate with, inter alia, walking and cycling and adapt to the needs of people with special needs. The implementation of the investment concerns infrastructure for non-motorized traffic and the elimination of obstacles and threats in pedestrian and bicycle traffic and the creation of possibly collision-free, continuous and safe pedestrian and bicycle routes. The beneficiary has approved architectural and construction documentation, a feasibility study and permits for the implementation of the investment. Contractors for construction works and information, promotion and education activities have been/will be selected as a result of public procurement procedures. The need to implement projects stems from the need to increase the broadly understood attractiveness of the public transport system and related to individual means of transport in Lublin and LOM through its further expansion. Implementation of the activities planned in the project will contribute to increasing the use and improvement of infrastructure for non-motorized traffic and public transport infrastructure in the city of Lublin and LOM. New cycle paths, walking and cycling routes and pavements in connection with public transport, whose services are used by residents of the entire LOM (and are provided, on the basis of appropriate agreements, in ten municipalities outside the city of Lublin) will contribute to the wider use of more efficient public transport and non-motorized individual transport. The implementation of the investment will reduce individual motorized traffic, and consequently promote and increase pedestrian and bicycle traffic in city centers and their functional areas, and will contribute to the reduction of exhaust emissions and thus improve air quality and the natural environment in the city and LOM. The project is also a response to residents' expectations regarding the development of broadly understood public transport and individual forms of urban mobility and also fits into the broader concept of using the Lublin City Bike as another urban means of transport.

title: Strengthening the health system through comprehensive support of a public blood service unit
description: The material scope of the project includes: Purchase of real estate – purchase of land for the construction of the new headquarters of RCKiK in Lublin. Construction works consisting of: construction of a new facility of the RCKiK headquarters in Lublin in a new location with the necessary facilities, garages, land development, access roads, parking, media delivery; reconstruction and renovation of buildings in the Land Branches in Tomaszów Lubelski, Zamość, Kraśnik. Scope of works: demolition, masonry, plastering, painting, flooring, sanitary installations, electrical installations. Medical equipment – purchase of equipment necessary for carrying out statutory activities for RCKiK in Lublin and Branches. Task partially implemented in 2020 and 2021 – Non-medical equipment – purchase of non-medical equipment, including: computer, laboratory. Task partially completed in 2020 and 2021 – Purchase of means of transport – purchase of 3 vehicles for the transport of blood and its components.

title: Construction of integrated interchange hubs together with the construction of bicycle roads in the communes of Lublin County in Kochanowice Commune
description: The subject of the project is the construction of an integrated interchange hub in Kochanowice and two sections of the bicycle road in Kochanowice and Jawornica and in Lubecko. The interchange node will be located in the centre of Kochanowice. It will include a bus bay, bicycle stands and nearby parking spaces for cars. The construction of the node will connect public transport (bus, rail) with the main transport routes within the commune and the built bicycle roads. The project will complement a broader investment project related to the construction of integrated interchange nodes and bicycle roads in Lublin County. The investment will be implemented in the “design and build” formula.

title: Revitalization of part of the Tatar district in Lublin
description: The aim of the project is to reduce socio-economic inequalities in Lublin in the territorial dimension by revitalizing degraded urban areas in the part of the Tatar district including the expansion and reconstruction of the amphitheatre and the construction and reconstruction of the square at ul. It's an assembler. The project will be implemented in the revitalisation area designated in the GPR – sub-area Osiedle Tatary (project No 32). The scope of the project includes, among others: 1) expansion and reconstruction of the amphitheatre and its immediate surroundings in the scope of, among others: areas of the auditorium, stage, stairs, roofing, outdoor installations (including lighting, monitoring with the telecommunication line, power line nN), pedestrian routes, small architecture objects, walls and retaining walls. In addition: demolition/dismantling (inter alia: demolition of the existing structure of the auditorium, pavement of pedestrian tracks, staircases, terrain.) ordering of the existing greenery, new plantings; 2) construction and reconstruction of the square at ul. Installation in the scope of, among others: pedestrian routes, a paved square, retaining walls, field stairs, slipways, rainwater drainage, lighting installations, teletechnical installations with monitoring, architectural objects. In addition: demolition works/disassemblies (e.g. fragments of existing retaining walls, pergola columns), ordering of existing greenery, new plantings. The following tasks are foreseen: 1) KW costs: works, k. indirect; 2) NKW costs: design documentation, author's supervision. The beneficiary has approved architectural and construction documentation, a feasibility study and final building permits. The contractor for the works will be selected in a public procurement procedure.The revitalised area is part of a larger green area, the recreation centre of the Tatara district. Its formation dates back to the 1960s-70s. The central part is an amphitheater - a theatre building with a characteristic round form, which has been destroying for many years. The area is neglected and needs modernization, as well as public housing estates and transport routes. The project was consulted with the local community and their representatives - the Tatar District Council and the Bronowice District Cultural Centre. In accordance with the residents' demands, a friendly public space will be created, adapted to the needs of users, which will constitute a new quality in the Tatar district. As part of the project, it is planned to introduce coherent architectural and construction solutions, solutions inspired by nature, including elements of small architecture made of wood, as well as saving resources by using, for example, energy-saving Led lamps. In addition, the construction of monitoring and lighting will increase the sense of security of residents and public order. There will also be an increase in accessibility and elimination of architectural and spatial barriers (e.g. by redesigning the existing field stairs to be comfortable and safe, facilities for people with disabilities - ramp and profiled slope). The new development of the area will enable the organization of outdoor cultural and educational events during the project's durability period, while encouraging residents to undertake various activities. In this way, it will play the role of activating and integrating the local community.

title: Comprehensive home care
description: The goal of the project is to increase the availability of high-quality social services of public utility, in particular in de-institutional forms, for wasps to exclude or threaten poverty and exclude society in the region and integration of the community 150 persons K and M exclude or threaten poverty and exclude society in M. Lbn, including, among others, the elderly, wasp with disabilities (in t from mental disorders), wasted. The project will be implemented by providing services in the local community in an individualised way (access to the needs and capabilities of a given person, enabling recipients of services to control their lives and decisions that concern them, in a way that ensures that the recipients of the services are not isolated from the general community or are not forced to live together, as well as ensuring that organizational requirements do not have primacy against the individual needs of residents. The offered wsp is home-made breathing care (daily/night), home support services and innovative support services (i.e. hairdresser, beautician, “golden handle” and “transport service”). The results that will be achieved through a personalised and holistic approach to project beneficiaries will be: developing or strengthening activity and independent lives and society, increasing the ability and readiness to integrate with local Wednesdays, which in the long run will prevent the phenomenon of social dependence, inheritance of poverty and unfavourable attitudes, and consequently reduce the number of people at risk of poverty and exclude society in Lublin. The applicant undertakes to inform the territorially competent OPS and PCPR about the project being implemented and the forms of support received by the participants.A social contract or equivalent document will be concluded with each participant. The applicant undertakes to inform the territorially competent social assistance centres and the regional and local partner organisations referred to in the OP, about the recruitment for projects implemented under PI 9i and PI 9iv, as well as to:

title: Extension of DW 988 from Czudec to Zaborów
description: The project includes the extension of the provincial road No. 988 with accompanying infrastructure on the section between Czudec and Zaborów. The beginning of the expansion is in km approx. 5+533 in Zaborów and the end in km approx. 8+622 in Zaborów. In addition, it is planned to replace the wear surface on the existing bridge over the Wisłok River from approx. 5+416 to km approx. 5+533. The scope of the project includes, among others: - extension of the section of provincial road No 988 with a length of 3,089 km to the following parameters: road class G, load capacity: 115 kN/axle, roadway with a width of 7.0m (2x3.5) with bitumen and aggregate sides, - extension of intersections with other public roads (municipal and district), - reconstruction of the viaduct over railway line No 106 Rzeszów Główny - Jasło, - construction of 7 small bridges, - modernisation of the bridge over the Wisłok River, - construction/reconstruction of pedestrian walkways, - reconstruction/construction of bus bays, - extension of the drainage system, including, among others: construction and reconstruction of grassy open ditches, construction of covered ditches (rain sewerage), reconstruction/extension of culverts, - reconstruction/construction of individual and public exits and entries/exits to the road lane for maintenance purposes - construction of an additional provincial roadway for connecting plots, - construction/reconstruction of road lighting, - construction of a technological channel, - protection of a landslide, - construction of acoustic protection devices - acoustic screens, quiet surface, - reconstruction of collisions and protection of existing land-weapon networks (networks: teletechnical, electricity, gas pipeline, water supply, sanitary sewerage). - execution of vertical and horizontal markings and road safety components. The main objective of the project is to develop and improve sustainable, climate-resilient, intelligent and intermodal mobility at national, regional and local level, including improving access to TEN-T and cross-border mobility. The direct objective of the project is to develop the infrastructure of provincial roads and improve transport links in the region, including in mountain areas. The section of road 988 in question is in poor technical condition, with permanent visco-plastic and structural deformations, cracks, defects in binders and grains in the surface, patches, bumps, mesh cracks, broken edges, numerous irregularities in the cross-section and longitudinal section and inflated groundsides. This, in conjunction with the very high volume of traffic occurring on the road in question, causes great difficulties, slowdowns and lack of traffic flow, as well as negatively affects safety. The implementation of the Project will improve the quality of transport infrastructure and optimise connections with the Małopolskie Voivodship from the direction of Gorlice to the S19 expressway in Babica and south to Barwinek and north towards Lublin. It will also lead to: improving the links between the regional road network of the voivodship and the national road network and the trans-European transport network TEN-T, improving the internal and external accessibility of the district of Strzyżów and surrounding towns, improving the social and economic cohesion of the Rzeszów Functional Area and increasing the prospects for its development, as well as improving the comfort and safety of travel DW 988. The implementation will reduce the negative impact of transport on the environment and living conditions of residents by reducing the impact of noise and exhaust gases and reducing the inconvenience associated with the congestion of the transport system. The investment will ensure a smooth connection of the local road system with the roads of the higher government and at the same time will affect the spatial and economic development of the surrounding area. A measurable effect after the completion of the investment will be a reduction in travel time, a reduction in the number of accidents and a reduction in traffic nuisance for the surrounding areas.

title: Construction of the Dynów bypass within the voivodship road no. 835 Lublin – Przeworsk – Grabownica Starzeńska
description: The scope of the investment “Construction of the ring road of Dynów m. within the voivodship road no. 835 Lublin – Przeworsk – Grabownica Starzeńska” includes:- Construction of a single road G-class road as bypass of the city of Dynów within the voivodship road no. 835, with a total length of 3.95 km (with connections to further route of the existing provincial road no.835).- Construction of 5 road junctions connecting the design road with the existing junctions, in the vicinity of the existing junction no. existing provincial roads 884 and 835 (ul. Piłsudskiego), district road No. 2321R (ul. Sanova) and 2316R (ul. Łazienna) and municipal road No. 108003R (ul. Membrane).- Construction of the equipment elements of the above roads to the extent necessary for its operation: the layout of the drainage, lighting.- Construction of the elements of the above-mentioned roads to the extent necessary from the point of view of public transport, pedestrian and bicycle traffic (partial walkways and cycle tracks).- Construction of the equipment of the above roads to the extent necessary from the point of view of impact on the environment (acoustic curtains, fences of the roads, planting of greenery, crossing for animals).- Construction of additional roads or grooves of public bridges and individual to ensure the availability of communication facilities.

title: Trust Fund of the Lubelskie Voivodeship
description: The subject of the Project, which will be implemented under Measure 2.6, is the establishment and management of the Trust Fund by BGK on the terms and conditions set out in the Agreement, including entrusting the Financing Partners with the establishment and management of the Specific Fund with the aim of providing support to final recipients in the form of financial instruments (loans and loans with a grant within one operation of the financial instrument). The aim of the project is to support the competitiveness and increase the level of digitalisation of SMEs in the Lubelskie voivodship. The implementation of the support will increase the productivity of enterprises, increase the intensity of the use of technology and knowledge in the economy, increase the ability of enterprises to adapt and adapt to the market situation, support enterprises at an early stage of development, including enterprises returning to the market after the prior liquidation of their activities. The implementation of the support will also contribute to the digital maturity of SMEs. Loans will be granted to SMEs carrying out initial investments related to equipping/retrofitting the enterprise to market new/improved products/services/technologies. As an additional element of the projects, it will be possible to support the use of modern IT technologies. Support will focus primarily on productive investments of SMEs, introducing product, process, marketing or organisational innovations. The project will also support SMEs at an early stage of development, including investments in infrastructure and modern IT technologies for the introduction of new products/services/technologies. The project will be implemented in an intermediate model, in accordance with Art. Article 3(c) of the General Regulation. Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego (BGK) will act as the Entity Implementing the Trust Fund and will select Financing Partners (PF). Funding Partners will provide support in their own and possibly also partner sales networks covering the area of the Lubelskie voivodship. Planning the task: 1. Management of the project 2. Implementation of financial instruments – payments to final recipients in the form of loans 3. Implementation of financial instruments – payments to final recipients in the form of grants under financial instrument operations (loan with grant) Project stages: 1. Conclusion of the financing agreement 2. Launch of the procedure for selecting Financing Partners 3. Selection of PF and conclusion of operational agreements 4. Information and publicity 5. Launch of the Loan Facility on Market 6. Continuation of promotional, monitoring, control and reporting activities As a result of the implementation of the Project, there will be an increase in competitiveness and the development of innovation and digitalisation of SMEs in the Lubelskie voivodship. The most commonly used abbreviations in the content of the application: OO – Final Recipients, IF – Financial Instruments, FEL – European Funds for Lublin 2021-2027, BGK – Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego, PF – Financing Partners.

title: Digitalisation of Charger sp. z o.o.
description: The scope of the project, which includes the implementation of investment activities in the field of intangible assets (purchase of licences and obtaining specialist advisory services), the aim of which is to develop the computerisation of processes carried out by the Applicant, is consistent with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union. The scope of the project includes investment activities in intangible assets aimed at digital transformation of the Applicant in the following areas of business activity: consulting and training processes (presentation and e-learning wizard), provision of mailing services and organization management processes (ERP class system). The indicated IT systems will be adapted to the requirements of the Applicant, i.e.: digital technologies (intangible assets) will be purchased, which will be adapted to the needs and specificities of the Applicant through the provision of advisory services. As a result of the implementation of the project, the applicant will implement in its activity a product innovation called: ‘Interactive Presentation and E-learning Wizard with Mailing Integration and Advanced User Analytics’. The implementation of the project will lead to: - increasing the applicant's digital maturity and the transition towards digitisation, - eliminating paper turnover (reducing the negative impact on the environment), - introducing ICT-based services, - expanding the scope of recipients of advisory and training services and removing barriers to accessing services for people at risk of exclusion (persons with disabilities, the elderly), - increasing the security of personal data protection. The main objective of the project is to increase the use of digital solutions in the activities of the Applicant, which will lead to the digital transformation of all processes implemented in Charger sp. z o.o. The indicated objective of the project is in line with the specific objective of Measure 2.4 Digitalisation of Lublin SMEs of the FELU programme, i.e.: reaping the benefits of digitalisation for citizens, businesses, research organisations and public institutions FEL 2021-2027. Therefore, the project is in line with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, among others in the scope of Article 8 Protection of personal data, Article 14 Right to education, Article 21 Non-discrimination The material scope of the project, which aims to digitize the applicant's basic processes in the provision of training services, focuses on the IT system and includes the following tasks: 1) purchase of intangible assets: -platform for the management and implementation of multimedia courses - 1 piece, - ERP class system - 1 piece, - IT system for creating educational multimedia presentations - 1 piece. 2) purchase of 2220 rh advisory services related to the adaptation of purchased digital solutions (intangible assets) to the needs and specificity of the company and the development of digital competences: - Advisory services related to the implementation and creation of training and marketing content - estimated time 240 rh - Advisory services related to the implementation - Course management module - estimated time 480 rh - Advisory services related to the implementation - user management module - estimated time 480 rh - Advisory services related to the implementation of ERP - Company management module - estimated time 480 rh - Advisory services related to the implementation - system for creating multimedia and educational presentations - estimated time 240 rh - Advisory services related to the implementation - cloud services - estimated time 300 rh The total value of the project is PLN 794 000,00 net and constitutes the eligible cost of the project. The implementation of the tasks to be carried out under this project will lead to the elimination of the problems identified, mainly in the provision of consulting and training services, as well as organisational and procedural issues.

title: New Employment Perspectives
description: The main objective of the project is to enable 120 participants (80 women and 40 men) living in the Lubelskie Voivodeship to improve their professional situation by acquiring new skills, increasing qualifications and improving professional competences. Project activities will be tailored to the individual needs and potential of participants - people employed on civil-law contracts, short-term contracts and working poor in order to effectively respond to the requirements of the local labour market of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The project effect. - improving the situation in the Republic of Poland by raising qualifiers/competencies in support of the green transition in order to adapt the skills/competences of project participants to the new ecological requirements related to the circular economy and the ambition of zero pollution. Improvement of the situation in the Republic of Poland through the implementation of high-quality training aimed at acquiring, changing or improving qualifications (confirmed by an appropriate document) necessary to improve the situation on the labour market aimed at increasing access to stable employment. - minimum 80% of UP Training will be tailored to the needs of UP when defining the reintegration path, as well as in accordance with the needs of the local labour market, with preference being given to training courses consistent with the green transition and the development strategy of the Lubelskie voivodship. The objective of the project will be achieved through the implementation of the specific objective : Improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, to be achieved through indicators: 1. Number of persons in employment, including self-employment, supported by the programme - 120 UP 2.Number of persons aged 18-29 supported by the programme - 12 UP 3.Number of persons aged 55 and over supported by the programme - 12 UP 4. Number of persons with disabilities supported in the program - 12 UP 5 .Number of persons who obtained qualifications after leaving the program - 80% Implementation of the project goal through comprehensive implementation of the developed support path: Task 1. Individual Action Plan (IPD) for each participant - the first stage of participation in the project aimed at verifying UP's needs, opportunities and expectations. On this basis, the further support path is implemented. - 120 UP Task 2. Individual career guidance - 120 UP Task 3. Group Vocational Consulting - Workshop Classes - 120 UP Task 4. Vocational training - 120 UP Task 5. Digital skills training - 120 UP Task 6. Workshops: Workshops: E-Circulation of Documents in the Context of Green Transformation 80 UP on average 8 groups of 10 people Task 7. Workshops raising awareness and competences in the field of renewable energy sources - 40 UP on average 4 groups of 10 people W. of the project: 1 594 080,00 PLN Dof.: 1 434 280,00 PLN Consolidated text: 159 800,00 PLN

title: Climate consultancy in the Bialskie District
description: The main objective of the project is to support climate change adaptation and disaster risk prevention, as well as resilience, taking into account an ecosystem-based approach. The European Union's climate policy assumes the achievement of targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing the share of renewable energy sources in total energy consumption and increasing energy efficiency. Both individual local governments and the whole country are obliged to take actions contributing to the achievement of these goals. In response to the identified challenges related to national commitments for a low-carbon economy and the needs and barriers at local level, a capacity-building action has been defined at this level: creating an office of climate advisors. These actions are a response to the general vision of improving air quality in the Lubelskie Voivodship. The main idea behind the functioning of climate advisors should be to focus on the final beneficiaries, i.e. residents of the district, entrepreneurs from the district, as well as cooperatives, housing communities and TBS. The project envisages hiring 2 climate advisors in the District Office in Biała Podlaska and training them in order to obtain the required competences in the field of advice on the rational use of environmental resources, protection and counteracting the effects of climate change and extreme weather phenomena, including rational water management and raising awareness about the need to reduce rainwater runoff and its storage, implementation of the circular economy (CEE), energy efficiency, storage and use of energy from renewable sources. As part of their duties, climate advisors will provide individual consultations at a point created within the District Office in Biała Podlaska, as well as at mobile points, which will be created as part of events organized in the district. The project assumes building public awareness of climate neutrality through the use of local media or information in public space (e.g. the website of the District Office in Biała Podlaska, as well as social media, which are eagerly used by the younger generation). In addition, in each commune located in the Bialystok district, 2 meetings will be organized in the form of educational workshops promoting new patterns of conduct in order to achieve climate neutrality. The workshops will be addressed to all interested groups (residents, entrepreneurs, housing communities and cooperatives, etc., as well as representatives of individual local government units from the district). An educational competition for children and young people will also be organised. The start of the activity of the climate advisory point is planned within 8 months from the start of the project.

An educational competition for children and young people will also be organised. The start of the activity of the climate advisory point is planned within 8 months from the start of the project.

title: Climate consultancy in Radzyński County
description: The main objective of the project is to support climate change adaptation and disaster risk prevention, as well as resilience, taking into account an ecosystem-based approach. The European Union's climate policy assumes the achievement of targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing the share of renewable energy sources in total energy consumption and increasing energy efficiency. Both individual local governments and the whole country are obliged to take actions contributing to the achievement of these goals. In response to the identified challenges related to the commitments and national low-carbon economy and the needs and barriers at local level, a capacity building action has been defined at this level: creating an office of climate advisors. These actions are a response to the general vision of improving air quality in the Lubelskie Voivodship. The main idea behind the functioning of climate advisors should be to focus on the final beneficiaries, i.e. residents of the district, entrepreneurs from the district, as well as cooperatives, housing communities and TBS. The project envisages hiring 2 climate advisors in the District Office in Radzyń Podlaski and training them to obtain the required competences in the field of advice on the rational use of environmental resources, protection and prevention of the effects of climate change and extreme weather phenomena, including rational water management and raising awareness of the need to reduce rainwater runoff and its storage, e implementation of the circular economy (CEE), energy efficiency, storage and use of energy from renewable sources. As part of their duties, climate advisors will provide individual consultations at a point created within the District Office in Radzyń Podlaski, as well as at mobile points, which will be created as part of events organized in the district. The project assumes building public awareness of climate neutrality through the use of local media or information in public space (e.g. the website of the District Office in Radzyń Podlaski, as well as social media, which are eagerly used by the younger generation). In addition, two educational workshops will be organised in each commune located in the Radzyń poviat to promote new best practices in order to achieve climate neutrality. The workshops will be addressed to all interested groups (residents, entrepreneurs, housing communities and cooperatives, etc., as well as representatives of individual local government units from the district). An educational competition for children and young people will also be organised. The start of the activity of the climate advisory point is planned within 8 months from the start of the project.

title: New Competences - Better Employment
description: The main objective of the project is to enable 60 participants (32 women and 28 men) living in the Lubelskie Voivodeship to improve their professional situation by acquiring new skills, increasing qualifications and improving professional competences. Project activities will be tailored to the individual needs and potential of participants - people employed on civil-law contracts, short-term contracts and working poor in order to effectively respond to the requirements of the local labour market of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The project effect. - improving the situation in the Republic of Poland by raising qualifiers/competencies in support of the green transition in order to adapt the skills/competences of project participants to the new ecological requirements related to the circular economy and the ambition of zero pollution. Improvement of the situation in the Republic of Poland through the implementation of high-quality training aimed at acquiring, changing or improving qualifications (confirmed by an appropriate document) necessary to improve the situation on the labour market aimed at increasing access to stable employment. - minimum 80% of UP Training will be tailored to the needs of UP when defining the reintegration path, as well as in accordance with the needs of the local labour market, with preference being given to training courses consistent with the green transition and the development strategy of the Lubelskie voivodship. The objective of the project will be achieved through the implementation of the specific objective : Improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, to be achieved through indicators: 1. Number of persons in employment, including self-employment, supported by the programme - 60 UP 2.Number of persons aged 18-29 supported by the programme - 6 UP 3.Number of persons aged 55 and over supported by the programme - 6 UP 4. Number of persons with disabilities supported in the program - 6 UP 5 .Number of persons who obtained qualifications after leaving the program - 80% Implementation of the project goal through comprehensive implementation of the developed support path: Task 1. Individual Action Plan (IPD) for each participant - the first stage of participation in the project aimed at verifying UP's needs, opportunities and expectations. On this basis, the further support path is implemented. - 60 UP Task 2. Individual career guidance - 60 UP Task 3. Group Vocational Consulting - Workshop Classes - 60 UP Task 4. Vocational training - 60 UP Task 5. Digital skills training - 60 UP Task 6. Workshops: Workshops: E-Circulation of Documents in the Context of Green Transformation 30 UP on average 3 groups of 10-person Task 7. Workshops raising awareness and competences in the field of renewable energy sources - 30 UP on average 3 groups of 10 people W. of the project: 830 250,00 PLN Dof.: 747 050,00 PLN Incl. 83 200,00 PLN

title: Development of R&D infrastructure in FAGUM-STOMIL dedicated to the expansion of research activities and the introduction of commercial R&D services in the field of environmental engineering
description: OBJECTIVE AND SCOPE OF THE PROJECT: The project assumes the expansion of the FAGUM-STOMIL R&D infrastructure through the creation of a Center for Prototyping and Environmental Engineering, whose aim will be to conduct advanced industrial research and development works in the field of environmental engineering and material technologies. The implementation of the project will allow the expansion of the company's R&D activities and the introduction of new, commercial research and development services addressed to entities operating in the footwear industry and related sectors. The key assumption is to create a modern research space that will enable research on ecological materials, recycling of raw materials, optimisation of footwear construction and development of production automation technology in line with the policy of sustainable development. The newly created infrastructure will include two research laboratories: 1. Specialized Footwear Prototyping and Modeling Laboratory, which will be dedicated to the design and rapid prototyping of footwear and its components using 3D technology, 3D printing and CNC machining, 2. Laboratory of Environmental Engineering and Ecological Materials, which will focus on research on polymeric and recycling materials, analysis of their performance parameters and development of new ecological solutions in the footwear industry. STAGES AND WAYS OF PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION: 1.Adaptation works involving adaptation of the laboratory space to the requirements of advanced research and installation of modern research equipment, which do not require a building permit or a construction notification in accordance with the decision of the Mayor of Łukowski of 17 February 2025. As part of these activities, dismantling works are provided for without disturbing the structure, installation of an internal aluminum joinery, location of floor, wall and ceiling cladding, painting works and installation of electrical and sanitary installations. Purchase of modern research equipment, including 3D scanners, 3D printers, CNC milling machines, spectrophotometers, strength machines and material analysis systems. Thanks to this, it will be possible to conduct advanced research on materials, simulate real conditions of use of products and test new production technologies. 3.Development of research and development competences, including the implementation of new methods of testing, modelling and digital simulations, which will increase the efficiency of the research process and shorten the time of developing new product solutions. 4.The launch of external R&D services, which will be provided to entities from the footwear industry and related sectors. These services will include, among others, material research, testing of new shoe designs, analysis of ecological parameters and implementation of recycling technologies. The introduction of commercial R&D services will increase the competitiveness of enterprises using research infrastructure and contribute to the implementation of innovative technologies in the industry. Thanks to the implementation of the FAGUM-STOMIL project, it will gain modern research facilities that will enable it to conduct comprehensive research on ecological materials, optimisation of footwear construction and modern production technologies. As a result, the company will increase its market competitiveness, while offering innovative technological solutions supporting the development of sustainable production. The project will also contribute to increasing the research and development potential of the footwear industry through technology transfer, cooperation with external entities and the implementation of modern solutions in accordance with the principles of the circular economy. The project is in line with the Regional Innovation Strategy of the Lubelskie Voivodship until 2030 and is part of the intelligent specialisations of the Lubelskie Voivodship, in particular in the areas of ‘Green economy’ (detailed issue No 211) and ‘Material technologies, production and logistics processes’ (detailed issue No 514).

title: "Better work - a new tomorrow"
description: The project implements the type specified in the SZOP under Measure 9.2, project type 1: Improving the situation on the labour market of working poor and people employed on short-term contracts, civil law. The aim of the project is to improve the situation on the labour market of 80 UP (40K and 40M) working poor and people employed on short-term contracts, civil law, living in the area of 5 counties located in the south-eastern part of the Lubelskie Voivodeship, i.e.: Chełmski, Krasnostawski, Hrubieszowski, Zamość and Tomaszów. The support offered under the project will be individualised and tailored to the diagnosed needs of 80 project participants (POs) on the basis of the Individual Action Plan (IPD) in order to increase access to stable employment and opportunities to improve skills and competences/skills. The project will focus on people in a difficult situation on the labour market, i.e. people with disabilities, people aged 55+, young people (aged 18-29), people of foreign origin. The gender parity was determined on the basis of the participation of women and men in the labour market in the area covered by the project. As part of the project, comprehensive support is planned in the form of: - career (individual) counselling - psychological counselling - legal counselling - vocational training tailored to the expectations and capabilities of the UP and the labour market, the so-called "Public Employment Law" (PPE) "tailor-made", - job placement - career coaching for 40% of UP - training on adapting socio-occupational life to ecological requirements related to the circular economy and the ambition of zero pollution. The above forms of support offered by UP will solve many problems by: creating/improving IPD to implement an individual development path, breaking down psychological and social barriers, barriers resulting from ignorance of the law, acquiring/completing qualifications/competences allowing to stay on the labour market under better working conditions and wages, people in a vulnerable situation will receive additional support from a career coach, which will help to break down barriers to acquiring new qualifications. In addition, each of the UP will be able to participate and possibly gain competences in the field of the green economy, which will undoubtedly strengthen their position on the labour market. PARTICULARS TO BE RESULATED: - A minimum of 80% of UP, i.e. a minimum of 64 persons, will obtain a certificate/occupational qualification, which is an important result in terms of improving UP's situation on the labour market. - Training in the green economy in social and professional life will result in the acquisition of competences by at least 64 people, i.e. 80% of UP. --- Taking up education/training after the end of participation in the project. WN assumes this indicator at least at the level of 3 people (2K and 1M), because at the stage of applying for project co-financing, it is difficult to predict how many PAs will be affected by this situation. The project is consistent with the horizontal policies of the European Union, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, including in particular the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, accessibility for persons with disabilities, the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, as well as the principle of sustainable development, the provisions of national and EU law, the SZOP of the FEL 2021-2027 programme, and also fits into the objectives set out in the Municipal Revitalisation Plans in the area of implementation of the P.

title: Development of the Research Laboratory of Grupa Azoty PULAWY
description: The aim of Grupa Azoty Grupa Azotowe “Puławy” S.A. is to provide dedicated, innovative research and development services for external entities, including those related to the Azoty Group, in two strategic areas of enterprise’s interest (biotechnology, fertilisers). Thanks to the acquisition of research infrastructure (permanent assets and intangible assets), the Company will conduct industrial research and development in the following areas: 1/Development of controlled release fertilisers; 2/Developing bio-chemical technologies for the management of industrial waste streams/by-products (chemical and agri-food industries); 3/Developing biocomponents that stimulate plant growth and yield and increase their resistance to biotic and abiotic stress factors; 4/Research of the fertiliser-growing-micro-organism system, with particular regard to the impact of these interactions on the quality and size of the yield. The implementation of the Project will enable the Company to implement the Development Strategy for conducting R & D works for the years 2019-2025, which assumes conducting research work on its own, using the substantive support of scientific units, where the use of the scientific potential of external specialists will be necessary and to solve technological and research problems that will arise in other entities. The project fits into both the objectives of the Strategy for Sustainable Development of the country and the Regional Innovation Strategy of the Lublin Voivodship, among others by creating new jobs in the area of R & D. This project also implements the concept of circular economy (GOZ) in a practical way. The Project’s objective is in accordance with the Regional Operational Programme of the Lublin Voivodship for 2014-2020, Action 1.3: R & D infrastructure in enterprises. The area of R & D works is in line with the key intelligent specialisation of Lubelskie Voivodship: IT’S A BIOECONOMY.

title: I'm betting on myself!
description: The aim of the project is to improve the situation on the labour market through comprehensive social and professional activation of 60 (38 K, 22 M) adults over 18 years of age, including 9 OzN (6 K, 3 M) belonging to the group of working poor and people employed on short-term, civil law contracts residing in Lublin in the areas covered by the Municipal Revitalization Program in the period from 01.08.2025 to 31.05.2026, through the use of social, professional and educational activation instruments, i.e. the implementation of the following support: ● Identifying the needs of the project participant and developing or updating an Individual Action Plan - task 1, ● Job-coaching - task 2, ● Workshops - Circular economy in business activities - task 3, ● Training leading to the acquisition, raising, supplementing or retraining of professional qualifications - task 4, ● Vocational guidance - task 5. The project assumes type 1 implementations for Measure 9.2 Improving the labour market situation of working poor and people employed on short-term, civil law contracts and is compatible and will contribute to the achievement of specific objective 4(a) (ESF+) of Priority IX and the objective of Measure 9.2 which is to improve access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, especially through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups on the labour market, as well as for inactive people, and by promoting self-employment and the social economy by achieving results: - the qualifications will be acquired by at least 70% of the participants of the trainings implemented under the project - i.e. 42 pers. - all OPs will be included in the scope of activities supporting the green transition in order to adapt the skills/competences of project participants to the new environmental requirements related to the circular economy and the zero pollution ambition. Justification for implementation: Restructuring and modernization of various industries caused by the deepening economic crisis. - COVID-19, the ongoing war, and the associated mass layoffs have resulted in an increase in the unemployment rate, an increase in the employment of fixed-term/civil-law contracts, which contributes to the deterioration of the financial situation, stabilisation, exclusion. The problem in the Lubelskie Voivodship is the worsening situation on the labour market caused by the shortage of, among others, work in shortage occupations (Bar. profession), the lack of stabilization of employees employed on the basis of short-term civil law contracts and the need to change their current profession and take up employment. In this regard, the importance of the development of border infrastructure (border crossing points facilitating border traffic and increasing transit capacity) should be stressed as an indirect factor supporting the development of the transp. industry and deficit occupations. In view of the changing labour market, it is necessary to intervene in the adaptation of qualifications to the changes taking place in the labour market. The project will focus on providing support in the form of training, which will improve the situation of the PA on the labour market.

title: Unicorn Hub Alliance: Creation of the Enterprise Support Ecosystem
description: The main goal of the project is to create a cooperation network of at least 4 enterprises with the scientific sector and social and economic partners, aimed at establishing real cooperation between entities belonging to the network of cooperation and transformation of the region's economy towards Industry 4.0 and the GOZ. The achievement of the Headline Goal will directly contribute to the achievement of Action 1.6 Support to regional innovation ecosystems, and to the achievement of Specific Objective 1(iv) ‘Developing skills for smart specialisation, industrial transformation and entrepreneurship’ of the FEL 2021-2027. The activities in the project fit into the type of project with SZOP: 2. Enhancing the capacity of regional innovation ecosystems to network enterprises with the scientific sector and social and economic partners by identifying the current technology and skills needs of entrepreneurs in the area of smart specialisation of the region and jointly creating and planning solutions to meet these needs with the involvement of universities, research institutions, NGOs and local government units. The objective of the project will be achieved by: raising the competences of the IOB staff - building a startup solutions bank for enterprises - collecting technological, developmental and organizational challenges of enterprises in areas where they are looking for innovative solutions - preparing enterprises / scientific units to cooperate with startups in the open innovation model - initiating cooperation between enterprises and startups with the participation of scientific units - support in the organization of solution pilots, support in assessing their effects and support in establishing a targeted business relationship. The implementation of the project will be based on the following tasks: Task 1 - Improving the competences of the IB staff - - building organizational and substantive capacity to act as an integrator of social and economic partners in the Lubelskie voivodship Task 2 - Establishing a cooperation network - providing development services in the field of networking of enterprises from the Lubelskie voivodship with socio-economic partners, with particular emphasis on solutions in the field of industry 4.0 and the circular economy.

title: Competences of the Future - WAR for Intelligent SME Development in the Lublin Region
description: The aim of the project is to support the Eastern Development Agency Sp. z o.o. (hereinafter referred to as: WAR), acting as an IOB in the development of skills in smart specialization, industrial transformation and entrepreneurship through the acquisition of new competences and skills of WAR staff in the area of aspects related to the protection of intellectual property, the transformation of the economy towards Industry 4.0 and the circular economy (CSE). Increasing the competences of the IB staff in the above-mentioned subject will take place in the period 03.2025-01.2026 (Task 1). The skills and competences acquired by the WAR staff will be used to provide innovation training services to SMEs from the Lubelskie Voivodeship operating in the RIS (Green Economy, Digital Society) area. 16 SMEs (8 from the RIS-Green Economy and 8 from the RIS-Digital Society) will be supported, including 20 SME employees from the provinces. of Lublin. The applicant envisages the implementation of at least one training in the field of innovation for enterprises from the SME sector, located in the Lubelskie voivodship, in medium-sized cities losing their socio-economic functions and municipalities at risk of permanent marginalization indicated in the annexes to the National Strategy for Regional Development 2030 (Chełm). The planned activities will focus on providing a comprehensive training service, the elements of which will respond to the real needs of entrepreneurs increasing their competitiveness and innovation potential, as well as increasing awareness and skills in the area of transformation towards GOZ and Industry 4.0. Non-financial support for supported SMEs will constitute de minimis aid under Regulation (EU) 2023/2831. The applicant will implement the reporting obligations regarding the de minimis aid granted in a manner consistent with the applicable regulations, including: verification of documents submitted by entities in terms of the possibility of granting de minimis aid in the SHRIMP system, issuing certificates/corrections, creating statistics and reports related to the granting of de minimis aid. The thematic blocks of implemented training for SMEs will include: - Industry 4.0 - GOZ - Building a culture of innovation As part of specialist training, entrepreneurs will gain skills in the field of Industry 4.0, including the integration of digital technologies, artificial intelligence and automation in production processes. In addition, education on practical aspects of the implementation of solutions in the area of GOZ will focus on sustainable resource management and waste minimization. Improving the competences of SME staff in the above-mentioned subject will take place in the period 02.2026-08.2026 (Task 2). Training for the IB will be carried out using the Applicant's infrastructure, while training rooms meeting the relevant conditions will be rented as part of the training for SMEs. The project will result in the development of services provided for the technological transformation of the economy towards Industry 4.0 and GOZ, in particular in the comprehensive business service model. The project will result in increased innovation, increased operational efficiency and competitiveness of enterprises from the SME sector in the indicated RIS areas, and additionally raising awareness in the area of GOZ will contribute to a more sustainable use of resources and reduction of negative environmental impact. The activities in the project will be in accordance with the Guidelines on the implementation of equality principles under EU funds for 2021-2027.

title: Increase your chances in the labour market
description: CEL GŁÓWNY to poprawa sytuacji zawod.i zdolności do zatrudnienia wśród 150os.(79K/71M)zatrudn.na um.krótkotermin.,um.cywilnopr.oraz ubogich pracuj.,w wieku od 15r.ż.,zamieszk.na obszarze Miasta Lublin, powiat lubelski, Gminy Niemce, Gminy Opole Lubelskie, Miasta Puławy, powiat puławski Gminy Kazimierz Dolny, powiat Tomaszowski, zamojski, biłgorajski, janowski, kraśnicki oraz Opolski w woj.lubelskim,w rozum.przepisów Kod.Cywiln.w wyniku realizacji kompleksowej ścieżki wsparcia obejmującej identyfikację potrzeb uczestnika projektu,poradn.zawod.,kursy/szkolenia prow.do uzysk.kompetencji/kwalifikacji oraz pośredn.pracy w okresie 01.03.2025-30.09.2026. The project will be tailored to the individual needs of the participant, resulting from the current state of his knowledge, experience, ability and predisposition to perform a given profession. Each UP will receive an offer of support,including such forms of assistance, which will be identified as necessary to change/improve the situation on the labour market. The project will be preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predisposition and problem raised by the Public Procurement Office, including through studies/updates for each Public Procurement Office of the Indyw.Plan Unit referred to in Article 2(1)(10a) and Article 34a(o) of the Employment Promotion and Labour Market Institute, or another document fulfilling an analogous function.This document will specify the scope of support provided to the person concerned, which will be agreed with it and will be updated, if necessary, during the project. title: Trust Fund of the Lubelskie Voivodeship
description: The subject of the Project, which will be implemented under Measure 4.10, is to provide support to final recipients in the form of financial instruments (loans and loans with a grant within one operation of the financial instrument), through selected entities implementing specific funds (Financing Partners). The project will be implemented in the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The aim of the Project is to support the development of the economy towards climate neutrality. Renewable energy generation will be an important element of decarbonisation of industry and diversification of generation sources in the energy mix of the region. The action will contribute to minimizing the effects of climate change, protecting air quality and strengthening the energy potential of the region. Types of investments financed: 1. Construction of installations for the production of bioliquids and biomethane, second and third generation biofuels. 2. Construction/expansion/reconstruction of local energy sources producing electricity and/or heat/fuels decarbonised from RES for local purposes, not requiring long-distance transmission based on local identified resources or with grid infrastructure. 3. Construction and expansion of installations of renewable energy sources in the field of electricity generation (also with energy storage facilities operating for the needs of a given RES source and connection to the grid). 4. Construction and expansion of installations of renewable energy sources in the field of heat generation (also with heat storage facilities operating for the needs of a given RES source). The project will be implemented in an intermediate model, in accordance with Art. Article 3(c) of the General Regulation. Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego (BGK) will act as the Entity Implementing the Trust Fund and will select Financing Partners (PF). Funding Partners will provide support in their own and possibly also partner sales networks covering the area of the Lubelskie voivodship. Planning the task: 1. Management of the project 2. Implementation of financial instruments – payments to final recipients Project stages: 1. Conclusion of the financing agreement 2. Launch of the procedure for selecting Financing Partners 3. Selection of PF and conclusion of operational agreements 4. Information and publicity 5. Launch of the Loan Facility on Market 6. Continuation of promotion, monitoring, control and reporting activities Most commonly used abbreviations in the application: OO – Final Recipients, IF – Financial Instruments, FEL – European Funds for Lubelskie 2021-2027, BGK – Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego, RES – Renewable Energy Sources.

title: Trust Fund of the Lubelskie Voivodeship
description: The subject of the Project, which will be implemented under Measure 4.6, is to provide support to final recipients in the form of financial instruments (loans and loans with a grant within one operation of the financial instrument), through selected entities implementing specific funds (Financing Partners). The project will be implemented in the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The aim of the Project is to reduce the volume of electricity and heat consumption in micro and small enterprises and commercial law companies in which the majority of shares are held by local government units or their associations, which will translate into a decrease in operating costs and maintain a competitive position on the market. Types of investments financed: 1. Improving energy efficiency in enterprises resulting from the audit (e.g. reduction of energy intensity, energy-efficient indoor and outdoor lighting, modernization of the heating system, minimization of heat losses, closed circuits, installation of RES devices); 2. Comprehensive thermomodernization of buildings in enterprises along with the installation of RES equipment; 3. Application of energy recovery technology together with the system for the use of waste heat energy within the company; 4. Application of energy-efficient technologies in manufacturing processes in enterprises, including reconstruction or replacement of technological installations and transport lines of production lines; 5. Reconstruction/replacement of inefficient heat sources based on solid fuels, including the use of heating systems based on low-emission energy sources/RES together with building connections to the gas and urban heating networks combined with thermal modernisation of buildings, excluding investments in single-family housing. The project will be implemented in an intermediate model, in accordance with Art. Article 3(c) of the General Regulation. Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego (BGK) will act as the Entity Implementing the Trust Fund and will select Financing Partners (PF). Funding Partners will provide support in their own and possibly also partner sales networks covering the area of the Lubelskie voivodship. Planning the task: 1. Management of the project 2. Implementation of financial instruments – payments to the Final Recipients and payment of salaries to PF Project stages: 1. Conclusion of the financing agreement 2. Launch of the procedure for selecting Financing Partners 3. Selection of PF and conclusion of operational agreements 4. Information and publicity 5. Launch of the Loan Facility on Market 6. Continuation of promotion, monitoring, control and reporting activities Most commonly used abbreviations in the application: OO – Final Recipients, IF – Financial Instruments, FEL – European Funds for Lubelskie 2021-2027, BGK – Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego, RES – Renewable Energy Sources, EE – Energy Efficiency.

title: Purchase and assembly of solar collectors in Łaziska Municipality
description: The main objective of the project is to improve the quality of the environment (air cleanness) in the municipality of Łaziska thanks to the use of renewable energy sources. This goal will be achieved by installing solar installations on private properties in the municipality. This will increase the use of renewable energy sources in the municipality, reduce greenhouse gases and other harmful substances in the atmosphere: (dust, sulphur dioxide (SO2), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), carbon monoxide (CO) and carbon dioxide (CO2), improvement of the potential of the municipality of Łaziska in terms of tourism and the development of entrepreneurship linked to improving the quality of the environment. The key result of the project will be improved air quality in Łaziska commune. This result will be achieved through the project’s tasks related to the installation of installations using renewable energy sources, solar collectors on residential buildings. As part of the project, solar collectors will be installed in 572 households. The project also foresees the use of modern information and communication technologies. The installation will be equipped with modern automation, with a regulator allowing for the current monitoring of the operation of the installation and the function of counting energy supplied by collectors in the form of statistics. It will be possible to remotely support solar installations and access to statistics – via the ICT portal and tools. The target group of the planned project is the residents of Łaziska commune directly participating in the project. These are the direct users of the infrastructure created by the project. Despite the fact that no corrective or short-term actions for the Lubelskie SEZ are indicated for the Łazisko district (no overruns of the substance subject to the assessment of air quality) are included in the scope of measures to reduce PM10 dust emissions from individual heating systems.

title: USE OF RENEWABLE ENERGY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF BYCHAWA
description: The main objective is to carry out the tasks contributing to the fulfilment of the obligations arising from the so-called energy and climate package of the European Union and the Europe 2020 Strategy. The project is located in the rural area (Axis 7: Modern village, which is an area with intensive agricultural production and characterised by varying investment status). Administratively, the municipality belongs to the Lubelskie Voivodeship and the Lubelskie county. Results of the project: Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) Mg/year – 3233.20 in 2019, Project products: Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) – 6.3 MW, Number of built units of thermal energy from RES – 1088 units. As a result of the installation variant, 242 biomass-fired boilers with a total capacity of 4.305 MW and 846 panel manifold installations with a total capacity of 1999.5 KW (powers of individual installations are: 369 x 1,71 kW; 476 x 2.86 kW and 1 x 7.15 kW), heat meters with (5 % remote reading) as well as services launched as part of ICT 2: 1 portal will have a form for reporting accidents, asking questions, obtaining information, making a transaction, concluding a contract. The second portal is a customer satisfaction survey, providing data on monitored energy from ICT, will enable public consultations. As a result of the project, there will be a place of work for a disabled person carrying out: readings, surveys, providing information, feeding portals to data. The project is aimed at individual households and the St. Albert’s brother, who provides a -hour stay for the sick. The investment results from the Low-Emission Economy Plan of the Bychawa Municipality Strategic objective no.2 Increased use of renewable energy and energy efficiency of the residential and economic sector through the implementation of the investment Measure 2.2 Modernisation of individual energy sources of central heating and central heating of the residential sector str. 66.

title: Installation of RES installations in Stoczek Łukowski commune
description: The main objective of the project is to meet the growing energy needs of the local economy and to diversify energy sources through the use of RES infrastructure. The key results of the project are: Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) 1,64 [MW]; Additional renewable electricity generation capacity 0,75 [MWe]; Production of electricity from newly built installations using RES 6544,60 [MWhe/year]; Production of electricity from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations 6544,60 [MWhe/year]; Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) 7968.17 [tonnes of CO2-equivalent/year]; Additional heat generation capacity from renewable sources 0,89 [MWt]; Production of heat from newly built installations using RES 7827.24 [MWht/year]; Production of heat from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations 7827.24 [MWht/year]. The tasks to be carried out include the Feasibility Study, Technical Documentation, Photovoltaic and Solar Installations, Investor Supervision, Project Promotion. The target group of the project is the residents of Stoczek Łukowski. The investment complies with the air quality programmes for the Lublin zone (the rest of the voivodship) adopted by the Lubelskie Regional Assembly on 20.11.2017 to ensure compliance with the requirements of Directive 2008/50/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 May 2008 on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe. Compliance with the criterion is ensured, inter alia, by ensuring that atmospheric air pollution is reduced. The project planned the installation of 275 solar collectors, including 171 with a power of 2.72 kW, 101 with a power of 4.08 kW, 3 with a power of 5.44 kW, as well as 241 PV installations with a power of 3.10 kW. All installations will be installed on the roofs of residential buildings.

title: Clean energy in the municipality of Piaski – installation of solar, photovoltaic and biomass boilers
description: As part of the project, 379 photovoltaic installations, 127 solar installations and 135 boilers will be built on the area covered by the investment on individual homes of residents. The project is aimed at individual recipients residing in the municipality. As part of the project, the following tasks will be carried out: Construction works – solars; Construction works – cells; Construction work – biomass boilers; Investor supervision; Feasibility study; Technical documentation; Information and Communication Tools, Project Promotion,Project Management.Construction works – links of utilities The main goal of the project is to meet the growing energy needs of the local economy and to diversify energy sources through the use of infrastructure using renewable energy sources. The capacity of the installation will be adjusted to the size of the residential building and the number of its inhabitants. residents of the Municipality of Sand; Local government, MA ROP; District Office, RDOŚ, Sanitary Inspectorate, Mayor of Sand. The project will implement the following result indicators: Additional renewable heat generation capacity [4,84MWt]; Additional capacity to generate electricity from renewable sources [1,47MWe]; Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI30) [3,37 MW] Heat generation from newly built RES installations [29,85MWht/year]; Heat production from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations [29,85MWht/year]; Electricity production from newly built RES installations [1455,32MWhe/year]; Electricity production from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations [1 484,75MWhe/year]; Estimated annual reduction in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) [1455,32tons of CO2-equivalent/year] The planned investment is in line with the Lubelskie Zone Air Protection Programme

title: Assembly of Renewable Energy Sources in Krasnobród Municipality
description: The aim of the project is to improve air quality by reducing low emissions, reducing the use of conventional heat sources, increasing the use of renewable energy sources and reducing production costs of C.W.U.
