The aim is also to meet growing local energy needs and to increase the region’s energy security. As part of the project in the Municipality of Krasnobród, 347 modern solar collectors will be installed with a total capacity of 1.283 MW per 347 buildings (total cost of PLN 4,683,960), 23 units of heat pumps with a total output of 0.038 MW (total cost of PLN 248 400), 19 units of photovoltaic panels with a total output of 0,037 MW (total cost of 266 220 PLN) on 19 buildings and 12 sets consisting of heat pumps and photovoltaic panels, i.e.12.0.020 MW. The total capacity of the installed devices will be 1.404 MW (of which the solar renewable energy will be 1.346 MW). The material scope of the project also includes the performance of the Feasibility Study (total cost PLN 18 819), the promotion of the project (total cost PLN 7,380), the performance of the supervisory function (total cost PLN 94 104.22) and the project manager – management (total cost PLN 125 472.30). The direct target group of the project is residents who have decided to participate in the project (401 households on which renewable energy sources will be installed). The intermediate target group will be all residents of Krasnobród city and commune, as well as the Zamość county and Lubelskie Voivodeship, who will breathe cleaner air. The project is compatible with PGN for the municipality of Krasnobród, POP for the Lublin zone, PROŻE for the Lubelskie Voivodship in terms of exceeding the permissible PM10 level.

title: Trust Fund of the Lubelskie Voivodeship
description: The subject of the Project, which will be implemented under Measure 4.7, is the establishment and management of the Trust Fund by BGK on the terms and conditions to be set out in the financing agreement, including entrusting the Financing Partners with the establishment and management of the Specific Fund with the aim of providing support to final recipients in the form of financial instruments (loans with a grant within one operation of the financial instrument, if the conditions set out in the Product Metrics are met). The aim of the Project is to diversify energy generation sources, reduce the consumption of fossil fuels, reduce CO2 and dust emissions to the atmosphere, which will contribute to the rational management of energy by final customers and will allow effective solving of economic problems related to the increase in energy prices. The effect of the measures taken will be to increase the installed capacity in RES sources and increase the share of energy generated from renewable sources in the total electricity production. These actions will support the implementation of EU climate and energy policy, including the objectives of the European Green Deal. In addition, as part of the intervention on renewable energy sources in the field of electricity generation, the possibility of removing products containing asbestos will contribute to minimizing the negative health effects on residents of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. All supported final investments will have to demonstrate a clear positive impact on the environment, presented in the form of energy savings, reduced emissions of CO2 and PM 10 and PM 2.5 into the atmosphere, in accordance with the provisions of Directive 2008/50/EC (as amended by Directive 2015/1480/EC), or an increase in the use of renewable energy sources. In line with the existing potential of RES in the region, projects involving the use of solar energy and biomass will be given special attention. The project will be implemented in an intermediate model, in accordance with Art. Article 3(c) of the General Regulation. Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego (BGK) will act as the Entity Implementing the Trust Fund and will select Financing Partners (PF). Funding Partners will provide support in their own and possibly also partner sales networks covering the area of the Lubelskie voivodship. Planning the task: 1. Management of the project 2. Implementation of financial instruments – payments to final recipients Project stages: 1. Conclusion of the financing agreement 2. Launch of the procedure for selecting Financing Partners 3. Selection of PF and conclusion of operational agreements 4. Information and publicity 5. Launch of the Loan Facility on Market 6. Continuation of promotion, monitoring, control and reporting activities Most commonly used abbreviations in the application: OO – Final Recipients, IF – Financial Instruments, FEL – European Funds for Lubelskie 2021-2027, BGK – Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego, RES – Renewable Energy Sources.

title: The use of renewable energy in the municipality of Sitno.
description: The main objective is to carry out the tasks contributing to the fulfilment of the obligations arising from the so-called energy and climate package of the European Union and the Europe 2020 Strategy. The following objectives are: Improving air quality in the commune, Improving the economic efficiency of the heat production system by increasing the number of people covered by RES installations. The project is located in Axis VII Modern Village. Administratively, the municipality belongs to the Lubelskie Voivodeship and the Zamość region. Results of the project: Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) Tonnes – 1674 in 2019, Additional renewable energy generation capacity (CI 30) 3,96 in 2018, Production of heat from newly built/new RES installations [MWht]/year 5366, Number of built units of thermal energy from RES – 450 pieces. The material scope concerns the installation of 97 units of biomass boilers with a total power of 2425 kW and 353 units of solar collector installations with a total power of 1535.2 kW for heating hot water, heat meters with (5 % remote reading) and TIK 2 services: 1 portal will have a form through which the user can: report a malfunction, ask a question, get information, make a transaction, make a deal, change a contract. 2 The portal will have functionalities related to monitoring customer satisfaction by providing up-to-date data on monitored energy in the scope of ICT and to participate in public consultations electronically. There will be a place of work for a disabled person reading, providing current information, feeding portals into data, carrying out surveys. The project is aimed at individual households. The investment results from the PGN of Sitno – Main Objective – str. 63 and Operational Objective 1.2 pp. 65 Construction of renewable energy installations in public buildings and individual residential buildings.

title: Construction of a 1.5 MW photovoltaic farm in Kobylany, Terespol, Bialski region, Lubelskie Province
description: The main objective of the project is to improve the energy security of Innova and Dariusz Muszyński through the diversification of electricity supply. The specific objectives of the project will be to increase the competitiveness of Innova I Dariusz Muszyński by investing in environmental protection and renewable energy sources, improving ambient air quality, reducing CO2 emissions into the atmosphere, raising the environmental awareness of local local society, increasing the use of modern information and communication techniques in energy management through Innova I Dariusz Muszyński. The main objective and specific objectives will be achieved by constructing 3 photovoltaic installations – solar farms in Horbów Cologne, Zalesie. This system will increase the use of RES electricity in the company, reducing the cost of electricity consumption from conventional fuels. The project will achieve the following result indicators: electricity production from newly built/new generation capacity of RES installations [MWhe/year]-1354,00, Additional electricity generation capacity from RES [MW]- 1,5048, estimated annual reduction in greenhouse gas emissions (CI34) [tonnes of CO2/year]-456,39

title: Environmentally friendly energy – Solar Farm No. 3
description: The aim of the project is to build a 726.88 kW photovoltaic farm. The farm will be located in Kock, r. 2-Kock agricultural, in the western part of parcels Nos 730/4, 730/6 and 731. The renewable energy produced will be entirely sold. Implementation of the project will have an impact on improving the competitiveness of the renewable energy market in Lubelskie voivodship, strengthening the region’s energy security and reducing greenhouse gas and particulate emissions (including PM-10) into the atmosphere.

title: Construction of the solar farm in Kock. No. 752/1
description: The aim of the project is to build a photovoltaic power plant with a capacity of 999 kWp planted on the ground together with the accompanying infrastructure, on plot No 752/1 located within the registers. 2-Kock Agricultural, Gm.Kock, and thus improve the competitiveness of the renewable energy market in Lubelskie voivodship. In this investment – photovoltaic cells, solar radiation is converted into electricity – the generation of electricity from a renewable source. The following indicators will be achieved through the implementation of the project: Product – Additional renewable electricity generation capacity (MWe) – 0,99; Additional generation capacity from renewable sources (MW) – 0,99; Number of enterprises receiving support – 1; Number of built electricity conversion units from RES – 1 and REZULTATU – Manufacture of electricity from newly built/new RES installations (MWhe/year) – 999; Electricity production from newly built RES installations (MWHe/year) – 999; Estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions (tonnes of CO2/year equivalent) – 331.95. The target group of the project will be residents of Kock.

title: Parczew – construction of a photovoltaic farm for the production of electricity – 1st stage
description: The main objective of the project is to launch the production of electricity based on a renewable energy source from the sun, and then to enter it into the electricity grid, thus contributing to an increased share of distributed renewable energy production in the Lublin region. The project includes the construction of the PV power plant with a capacity of 1425.60 kW, which will be built on plots Nos 743, 744 and 745 in Parczewo (Lubelskie Voivodeship). The project is part of EU and national environmental and sustainable development policies. The investment consists of assembling 4320 monocrystalline photovoltaic panels with a single output of 330 W each, connected into separate systems with inverters, with the necessary wiring and accessories. The electricity produced will be supplied to the power grid of PGE Dystrybucja S.A. through the SN/nn transformer station, a cable-measuring connector together with an electricity metering system and a cable connection of SN 15 kV. The implementation of the investment will meet all the needs of the Applicant. After completion of the project, there will be positive changes in social, environmental and economic aspects: — development of 1 enterprise on the renewable energy market in Lubelskie voivodship – promotion of renewable energy in society and improvement of the image of the region implementing environmentally friendly technologies – increasing energy security in the region – diversification of sources of energy production from RES sources – protection of nature by reducing CO2 emissions to the environment of 503.67 MgCO2/year through the production of clean energy from the sun – increasing the value of the property on which the planned PV installation will be located – increasing the influence to the self-government in respect of taxes paid by the Applicant.

title: Establishment of a treatment and anesthetic system in the Stefan Cardinal Wyszyński SP ZOZ in Lublin
description: The main objective of the project is to improve the quality and accessibility to health care services. The planned actions will contribute to improving accessibility to health services within the public health system. The project contributes to the thematic objective of promoting social inclusion, combating poverty and all discrimination. The investment consists of the construction of a separate building of block R with a usable area of about 6 500 m² adjacent to block C from the south-east side and connected with the rest of the hospital together with internal installations: sanitary and rainwater sanitation, water supply, c.o. and c.t., thermal nodes, mechanical ventilation, air conditioning, ice water, medical gases, electrical and teletechnical gases; construction of an external transformer station, an external generator, walkways, commuting and parking stations; external installations: sanitary and rainwater sewerage, water supply, thermal, electrical and refurbishment of existing external installations: rainwater and electrical sewerage. The building will be a 3-storey with basement, and a technical floor (a total of 5 floors). — Operating block, Intensive Therapy Department for 18 beds, Hospital Pharmacy, Central Sterilisation. As a result of the project, output indicators for the 2014-2020 ROP will be achieved: Number of medical entities supported -1 pcs. Investment outlays on the purchase of medical equipment — 4 003 001,23 PLN net Anesthesiological column -6 pcs. Surgical column — 6 pcs. Operating lamp — 6 pcs. Treatment lamp — 1 pc. Ceiling power supply system for OIT -24 pcs. Estimated value of purchased net equipment 4 003 001.23 PLN, gross 4 323 241.33 PLN The target group of the project will be residents (patients) of the Lublin Voivodeship and users of the resulting infrastructure medical staff of the hospital.

title: Adaptation of the National Rescue and Firefighting System in the Lubelskie Voivodeship to climate change, changes in the natural environment and civilization threats
description: The project will consist mainly in equipping the Fire Brigade units with the necessary equipment and devices that will complement existing resources or replace equipment that, due to the high level of exploitation, is intended to be withdrawn. The scope of the project will include the District and Municipal PSP units, as well as the TSO KSRG. As part of the project, the purchase will include rescue and firefighting vehicles, cars with mechanical ladders, boats, quads, equipment necessary for evacuation and long-term operations, as well as basic tools to eliminate the effects of storms and strong winds, as well as elements related to monitoring and warning of threats. A detailed list of the equipment can be found in Annex 4.2 to the grant application. The implementation of the project will take place in stages. Step 1. Preparation of documentation for proceedings for the purchase of equipment. Stage. 2. Delivery and deployment of equipment. Stage. 3. Promotion of the project. During the entire implementation of the activities, the service of the project team will be provided. The aim of the project is to increase the level of security of the region and increase the ability to effectively defend against the effects of climate change and natural disasters and catastrophes. The need to implement the project results from diagnosed problems. The growing road infrastructure, housing, start-ups, more people, cars, including electric cars and very large climate changes cause that not only the number of events requiring the intervention of services increases, but also the sense of security of the inhabitants of the region decreases. Therefore, it is crucial to properly prepare services, with particular emphasis on the Fire Brigade, which undertakes the widest range of rescue, rescue and firefighting activities or minimizing the negative effects of events. Strengthening the equipment and technical resources of the PSP and TSO KSRG units will positively affect the sense of security of the inhabitants of the Lublin region, as well as translate into effective operations and limited equipment maintenance costs, due to the lower failure rate of the new equipment. Achieving the projected objective in the long term will contribute to increasing the level of social security in crisis situations and will enable the following benefits to be achieved: improving the equipment of the Rescue Service, improving the working conditions of rescue workers, improving the safety of persons carrying out rescue operations, taking care of the state of the environment and maintaining the level of public confidence in the Fire Service at a very high level. The implementation of the project will also contribute to improving ecological safety in Natura 2000 areas and other protected areas of natural value other than Natura 2000, reducing secondary risks arising as a result of events, reducing material losses of victims of events, preventing natural disasters and contributing to the protection of the border areas of the Republic of Poland and the Schengen area. The project, through the implementation of specific project indicators and the achievement of the project’s objective of ‘ensuring an increase in the level of security of the region and increasing the possibility of effective defence against the effects of climate change and natural disasters and catastrophic events’, is consistent with the objectives set out in the SZOP FEL for priority axis III Protection of resources and climate, including in particular objective 3.1. Environmental safety. The project is in line with the Lublin Voivodeship Development Strategy until 2030 - it fits in with strategic objective 4 - strengthening social capital, operational objective 4.5. public security. The lines of action set out in the Strategy are based, among others, on preventing and reducing the effects of disasters and increasing the effectiveness of response, which is why the draft KR PSP is in line with this document.

title: Błonia near the Castle in Lublin - a comprehensive dimension of revitalization
description: The aim of the project is to revitalize the area of Błonia near the Castle in Lublin by creating a space conducive to social integration and improving the functionality, safety and aesthetics of the place, as well as strengthening the cultural and tourist potential of the city through appropriate land development. The project will be implemented in the revitalization area designated in GPR - Sub-Area Podzamcze (project No 9, sub-project 1.2). The scope includes the implementation of, among others: avenues, cycle lanes and carriageways, including fire roads; wooden piers and paths; field staircases; elements of small architecture; inclusive playground and active recreation facilities; skatespot; connection of tech infrastructure installations. (rain, sanitation and water supply); lighting and illumination, power and teletechnical cable lines; monitoring and equipment for the wireless internet access system; teletechnical sewerage, planting and demolition, including demolition of an existing commercial facility. Tasks foreseen: 1) QC costs: construction works, ext.infrastr.tech. (25% limit), archaeological surveillance, indirect costs; 2) costs of non-squares: elaboration of a training study, construction works: ext.infrastr.tech. (over the limit of 25% kw), trains with vehicle traffic permit, scope realized and preparation of the square with connections (e.g. under the food track setting) The Beneficiary has an approved architectural and construction document, a building permit study and the necessary conservation permits, building permits, certificates of lack of grounds to object to applications. The contractor for the construction works, together with archaeological supervision, will be selected as a result of a public procurement procedure. The information board will be commissioned immediately after the signing of the dof. According to the GPR, there are numerous negative social phenomena in the area of Podzamcze, such as: poverty, domestic violence or other special family needs, e.g. disability. The area of Błonia, despite its attractive location in the city center, is not fully used and on a daily basis remains a bit off the beaten track of the city's social and tourist life. The Błonia area is modestly equipped and needs to be renovated, but it has a great potential that can positively affect the quality of life of residents and the interest of tourists. As part of the project, it is planned to adapt the infrastructure to the different needs of users, plant and care for greenery and promote heritage, which refers to sustainable development. The Błonia area will be organized and adapted to standards in the field of: climate resilience, e.g.: use of good quality materials, planting greenery, adapted to urban conditions and functional and usable, e.g.: construction of an inclusive playground, replacement of track surfaces, construction of monitoring. The infrastructure is designed to encourage children, adults and the elderly to spend time outdoors by creating a passive and active recreation zone. It is planned to use solutions inspired by nature and save resources, e.g.: elements of the playground will be made of wood, as part of the replacement of lighting, energy-saving led lamps have been designed. As a result of the project, the Błonia area will offer not only a modern and tailored to various needs place for relaxation and daily integration, but also the opportunity to participate in seasonal cultural and educational events during the project's durability period. Revitalization of Błonia near the Castle along with complementary projects in the field of strengthening social ties will make this area gain new social and functional values, which will also translate into a greater number of visits. The result of the actions taken will be, among others, improving the quality of life of the local community and equalizing development disparities within the city. Annex to the statement of tasks by parcel and by cost (Annexes 63 and 64).

title: Development and improvement of the quality of medical services of the Provincial Occupational Medicine Centre in Lublin through the development of infrastructure and the retrofitting of block C in connection with the fight against the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic
description: The aim of the project is to increase the potential of the CP-L WOMP in Lublin in the area of POZ, AOS and Medicinal Rehabilitation and to reduce the negative effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. The implementation of the project will increase the availability and quality of medical services provided in the Centre, increase the standard and safety of the patient and the work of the staff.The aim will be realised by locating the clinic rooms in the newly created building: Post, surgical, orthopaedic, neurological, gynecological, cardiac, rheumatological, endocrine, rehabilitation, endocrine and endocrine, along with their respective diagnostic and treatment offices, ECG and Holter diagnostic and treatment laboratories, and spirometry, as well as offices of rehabilitation laboratories. The project will contribute to the implementation of the following strategic result indicators at the level of the relevant PI (Investment Priority 13i ROP WL 2014-2020): 1) Supporting crisis repair in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and its social consequences and preparing a green and digital recovery of the economy that enhances its resilience. As a result of the project, the following results will be achieved: Number of treated in medical entities supported: 20 000 persons/year; and products: Number of medical entities supported [1 pcs.]; The project’s products will be high-quality medical services corresponding to the identified needs of the inhabitants of the region financed by the public health system.

title: Restoration of heritage: Pobernardian Monastery in Lublin together with the Church of St. John the Baptist Conversions of St. John Paul II Paweł in Lublin - a unique product of cultural tourism in Poland
description: The main objective of the project is a new cultural product in Eastern Poland based on the unique potential of cultural heritage oo. Bernardines using local resources and stimulating social development. It will be a unique product on a national scale, as part of efforts to preserve the local tangible and intangible cultural heritage. The project proposes a new tourist product based on a historic complex including a post-Bernardine monastery complex and the Church of St. John the Baptist. Conversions of St. John Paul II Paul in Lublin. The complex of buildings with adjacent green areas is located in the central part of the city, in the area of the History Monument, in the immediate vicinity of the Old Town, which is the most visited part of Lublin by tourists. The Pobernardian monastery complex together with the church of St. John the Baptist and St. John the Baptist. Conversions of St. John Paul II Paweł occupies a significant place in the history of the development of the city, and in the light of recent archaeological discoveries, he acquires the importance of an important city-forming factor for the identity of Lublin. The uniqueness of the tourist product is given by a variety of services and attractions, which will constitute a comprehensive offer of leisure time. The product will become part of an innovative network tourist product, based on the drive for the route of historical sacral buildings in the center of Lublin, with a large, often unique historical and historical value. After the completion of the project as part of the networked tourist offer, the Archdiocese of Lublin will offer visitors the opportunity to visit (also in the digital version) several sacred objects: Archcathedral of Lublin Trinitarian Tower Lublin Seminary The Pobernardian monastery complex and the church of St. John the Baptist in Lublin Conversions of St. John Paul II Paul in Lublin. The facilities will be combined into one product jointly promoted, among others through a new website, on which digital resources will be placed, including virtual walks around the facilities and available as part of a common ticket and loyalty packages. The activities of the project in the investment part include the renovation and adaptation of historic infrastructure, and in the non-investment part - an attractive educational and cultural programme. These two areas interpenetrate and coexist. Therefore, the implementation of the project will contribute both to the improvement of the condition of historic buildings, as well as to the broadening of the applicant's cultural offer, to increasing the importance of the institution itself, and finally to increasing the attractiveness of the project implementation sites, i.e. the city of Lublin and the entire Lublin region on the map of the country's cultural and tourist life. The scope of the planned tasks includes architectural, arrangement, conservation and construction solutions with land development, which are part of the facilities, enabling the extension of significant functions of these facilities. Restoration of the historic architectural substance proper appearance and proper technical condition by carrying out renovation, construction and conservation activities will allow to create modern and safe conditions for the implementation of cultural and educational activities in the facility. The above-mentioned factors determining the decision to implement the project and its assumptions fit into the main goal of the FEnIKS Programme, which is to improve the country's development conditions by building technical and social infrastructure in accordance with the assumptions of sustainable development, including by strengthening the role of culture in social and economic development.

title: Revitalisation of the People’s Park in Lublin located in the area of the Integrated Communication Centre for LOF
description: The project consists of revitalisation of the People’s Park in Lublin. The planned objectives of the project are biodiversity conservation, restoration of natural resources, ordering and construction of inf. recreational and educational inf. and rationalisation of space for LOF residents. The activities of the project will serve to effectively protect the ecosystems present in the People’s Park, to prevent further degradation of green in the urban area and to shape environmental attitudes in society. The project envisages carrying out a full range of green care work of the People’s Park, providing suitable conditions for plant vegetation and the life of animals occurring there. In addition, a reconstruction of the park is planned to include: natural education (e.g. construction of teaching paths, setting up information boards), recreation and tourism – construction of infrastructure for the development of active forms of tourism (e.g. construction of a canoe stop, playgrounds with rope equipment), social policy and security (e.g. adaptation to the needs of the underprivileged, construction of sanitary facilities, lighting and monitoring). Equipping the People’s Park with educational – leisure and recreational infrastructure will increase its attractiveness and translate into achieving a key indicator of the result – the increase in the expected number of visits. The project’s products will be: one built tourist/recreation facility, two facilities tailored to the needs of people with disabilities, one conducted information and education campaign, 6 infokiosks providing servicing in min. 2 foreign languages, 1 km of infrastructure for bicycles. The tasks of the project are: development of project documentation, works related to greenery, construction works, project promotion, including inf. — educational. The project’s addressees are LOF residents, including: families with children, seniors, young people, people with disabilities, tourists and people waiting for connections to the future CCC.

title: Bronowicka 3 in Lublin - the social dimension of revitalization
description: The aim of the project is to adapt the facility to new social functions and implement activities aimed at supporting people in crisis and requiring assistance through renovation and reconstruction of the building at ul. Bronowicka 3 in Lublin together with the purchase of equipment for the needs of the Crisis Intervention Centre. The current headquarters of CIKK (at ul. Rectory) has too few rooms, including specialists' offices and rooms for conducting group classes due to the growing interest in the services provided by the unit. The building is included in the Municipal Register of Monuments of the City of Lublin and located in the urban layout of the Industrial and Residential District Stare Bronowice included in the GEZ of the City of Lublin. The construction works will be carried out taking into account the historic character of the site in order to protect the material heritage and remind of the local history. The scope of construction works includes, in particular: - construction works of the above-mentioned building, including reconstruction of internal walls, replacement of floors, insulation of the non-utility attic, - construction of the above-mentioned elevator shaft, - finishing works of floors, walls, ceilings, - replacement of window and door joinery, - roof renovation, - insulation of all facades, - construction of slipways for people with reduced mobility, - reconstruction of internal installations, including water and sewage, c.o., ventilation of furniture, air conditioning, gas, - reconstruction of electrical and teletechnical installations, - construction of connection and installation of external rainwater sewage system, - works related to land development, including demolition works, hardening of the area (including construction of stands), greenery (including felling trees, replacement plantings), - purchase of equipment. In order to implement the project, the following were developed: construction project, purchase specification. equipment, feasibility studies. The beneficiary has a decision - a building permit, a decision on agreeing a construction project with a conservator, notification and information about the lack of grounds for objecting to the construction of a rainwater sewer connection. Contractors will be selected as a result of progress. tender. Scheduled tasks: (1) Eligible edition: construction works, purchase of equipment and project promotion and management; (2) Ineligible: execution of design documents, feasibility studies, construction works, equipment and author's supervision over the works. The project is located in the revitalization area designated in the Municipal Revitalization Program for Lublin for the years 2024-2033 in the subarea of the District of ul. It's Łęczyńska. The project is included in the list of basic projects under No. 6 entitled: ‘Support for social services and social inclusion, including infrastructure’ in the GPR. The project will result in filling public service deficits and thus strengthening local communities, in particular those in need of support. Socially, the region is characterised by a significant participation of people supported by social assistance, including due to poverty, special family needs: the need to protect motherhood, helplessness in care and education matters. The effect of the project will be to improve the state of public space in the Bronowice district by redeveloping the building at ul. Bronowicka 3. The transfer of the seat of the CIKK will allow for a more effective, more effective solution of the identified social problems, and thus will contribute to reducing their occurrence through psychological, therapeutic, legal and interventional assistance. In addition, the building is located in a place conducive to community integration due to the adjacent Bronowicki Park. District ul. Łęczyńska is characterized by a high number of crimes committed, which reduces the sense of security in public space. Awareness of the existence in the vicinity of an entity such as CIKK, which supports people in a difficult life situation, will strengthen the sense of security in residents.

title: Implementation of elements of the green network for the City of Łęczna
description: The aim of the project is to protect the natural heritage and use its potential to develop sustainable tourism in the Łęczna commune. The project assumes the implementation of an investment consisting in activities related to: construction and development of tourism infrastructure and development of tourism and natural heritage facilities along with development of areas around the city of Łęczna. The implementation of the project will contribute to the development of areas of high natural, landscape and cultural value, constituting a high tourist attraction of the city of Łęczna. The project is located in the city of Łęczna, Łęczna commune, in the Lubelskie voivodship. The material scope of the project includes the following elements: - construction of pedestrian-bike bridges on the Wieprz and Świnka rivers - lighting - construction of a canoe marina with infrastructure in the vicinity of Lubelska Street, - construction of a nature path with resting places on peat grounds in the south-eastern part of the municipality and the city of Łęczna, - indirect costs - promotion and project management. The project was entered under the heading: Annex 1 to the Strategy for the Development of the Lublin Metropolitan Area by 2030 - Project fiches under the ITI Instrument in the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027, Project fiches Measure 11.2 Protection of natural heritage, security and sustainable development of tourism in urban areas and their functional areas under the ITI MOF: (p. 230). The implementation of the project results from the analysis of demand and the assessment of residents' needs. The survey was conducted as part of the Diagnosis of the social, economic and spatial situation of the Łęczna Commune. The survey was addressed to the residents of the municipality. The main objective of the study was to collect the opinions of the residents of the Łęczna Commune on the quality of life, potentials and directions of development of the commune. The survey reflects the real socio-economic needs of local government during the implementation of the Development Strategy of the Łęczna Commune for 2022-2030. In addition, a research tour was organised on 30 June 2023: MARKET II →WINE TREATMENT (ULICA LUBELSKA)→WINE TREATMENT (Length of the PIESZO-ROWER PATH)→TRANSCRIPTION AT THE AMFITEATER. The implementation of this project has been carefully coordinated with other investments in the region to avoid duplication and inefficient spending of public funds, to complement existing tourism and leisure infrastructure and to ensure complementarity with other projects in the metropolitan area (therefore there is no risk of overlap and competition). The project does not duplicate activities carried out in neighbouring municipalities or within Łęczna. The project includes free public infrastructure. The project ‘Implementation of elements of the green network for the City of Łęczna’, in conjunction with other complementary projects at both local and regional level, stimulates tourism activity in the region by taking advantage of the landscape and natural attractiveness of the environment, which is the basis for tourist arrivals related to active qualified tourism, ecotourism, agritourism and leisure tourism. This will help to create a common and comprehensive tourist offer for LOM municipalities, taking into account natural resources and natural heritage, as well as tourist and road infrastructure. Łęczna will gain a new, comprehensive tourist offer, which will be attractive for families, seniors, people practicing sports and nature lovers. The new infrastructure will become an incentive to organize sports and recreational events, such as kayaking, cycling rallies, Nordic walking. The possibility of combining water, cycling and hiking tourism will increase the attractiveness of the region for both individual tourists and organized groups.

title: Revitalisation of Dr Edward Łuczkowski’s Square with historic cellars in Chełm
description: The main objective of the project is to strengthen the development potential of the central part of Chełm by improving the quality of life of the inhabitants of degraded areas and improving access to common spaces. As part of the project, a universal urban space will be created as a place for meetings, leisure, intergenerational integration and business activity. The area of Chełmska Old Town will be given new social functions and will be open to the needs of a wide range of audiences, with a particular focus on the elderly, children and young people. The objectives planned in the project will be achieved through measures, i.e. the reconstruction of the Pl. Dr. Edward Łuczkowski in Chełm, the renovation of the entrance to the underground, the reconstruction of the building and the underground protection along with the execution of external technical infrastructure, the reconstruction of the City Park in Chełm at ul. Lublin, together with the implementation of the monitoring system and electrical infrastructure and the exchange of consumer information elements (restore the old urban landscape on pl.). As part of the real task, products will be created: Number of supported infrastructure facilities located in revitalised areas-4 pcs., Public or commercial buildings built or renovated in urban areas-188.52 m², Area area under revitalisation-11.69 ha, Open space created or rehabilitated in urban areas-116755.48 m², Implementation of planned actions in the project will bring results, i.e. Number of persons using socio-cultural/tourism facilities covered by the project – 40000 persons The project’s activities are aimed at solving problems and meeting the needs of the project’s stakeholder group: residents of the district of Chełmsk borough and land, local authorities, business entities, tourists, entities of the III sector, institutions and media.

title: Retrofitting and increasing the availability of AOS services in the Provincial Occupational Medicine Centre in Lublin
description: The aim of the project is to increase the potential of WOMP CP-L in Lublin in the area of outpatient specialist care, including the Daily Rehabilitation Centre (DOR) to increase the availability of these services. As part of the project, medical equipment will be purchased for the needs of AOS and the Medical Rehabilitation Centre (DOR) of WOMP CP-L in Lublin, as well as the purchase of Braille plates made of steel to mark offices and other rooms located at the place of providing health services in the field of AOS (which will be an invaluable help for the blind in the diagnosis of what room they are dealing with) and training of medical staff in helping people with special needs, as well as training staff providing health services in the field of AOS and the Medical Rehabilitation Centre (DOR) under the funds from the European Funds for Social Development program entitled. "Safe patient - actions for the benefit of patients' rights in the health care system" carried out by the Patient's Rights Ombudsman. The project is part of the implementation of measure 7.8 Health infrastructure (type 2: Development of POZ/AOS through construction, reconstruction and modernization of health infrastructure facilities and/or their equipment, including medical equipment, in order to improve access to services, including primarily in less economically developed areas and rural areas). The project is non-infrastructural - its main element is the purchase of medical equipment and equipment, it does not require any construction works. Through the implementation of the project, through the purchase of medical equipment, marking of offices and other rooms with Braille steel plaques supporting patients with visual disabilities and training of medical staff in helping people with special needs, access to high-quality medical services of outpatient specialist care will be increased for residents of the region financed from public funds. It is a pro-quality activity aimed at adapting medical entities to the dynamic development of medical sciences, including new solutions and diagnostic and therapeutic possibilities, as well as changing epidemiological and sanitary conditions (especially in the face of mitigating the negative effects of the COVID-19 pandemic). The implementation of the project includes: preparation of a feasibility study, purchase of medical equipment, purchase of Braille plates made of steel, training of medical staff in the field of assistance to people with special needs, training of staff providing health services in the field of AOS and the Medical Rehabilitation Center (DOR) under the funds from the European Funds for Social Development program entitled: "Safe patient - actions for patients' rights in the health care system", project promotion and project management. The following medical equipment and equipment will be purchased in the project: dynamic resonance imaging, digital x-ray machine with 3 detectors, densitometer, videodermatoscope with computer and software, exoskeleton for rehabilitation and re-education of gait, EMG for evaluation of muscle activity and conduction of peripheral nerves, ultrasound, laryngological unit, head for testing muscles and ligaments, drive for microsurgical procedures of the foot and hand, impedance audiometer, videocoloscope, cryosurgery apparatus, treadmill for exercise trials, ECG holters, VR glasses supporting physical and spatial rehabilitation and other listed in the Annex "Equipment specification". In addition, 43 Braille plates made of steel will be purchased for the needs of people with visual disabilities, which will be mounted on the doors of offices and other rooms located on the 1st and 2nd floor of Block C, where health services in the field of AOS and rehabilitation are provided.

title: Revaluation of Bronowicki Park in Lublin
description: The main objective of the project is to restore the utility value of the historic Bronowice Park in Lublin and to develop the cultural offer in the Bronowice district, thus strengthening the role of culture and sustainable tourism in economic development, social inclusion and social innovation. Bronowicki Park is the second oldest urban park and is an important element in the historical urban fabric of the city. The park was entered in the Register of Monuments of the Lublin Voivodeship (A/848) in 1982, as an example of an assumption representing the great values of the art of shaping space in the second half of the 19th century and the first decades of the 20th century. buffet, wooden amphitheater, roller skating track, stilt rental, sledge hill, mineral water pump room. Bronowicki Park, although surrounded by compact urban buildings, near it there is, among others, a shopping center, a hotel and residential houses, is a natural enclave of greenery, having great aesthetic, natural and recreational importance. Currently, the park does not perform its original functions, and there are no visible references to its history. The communication function dominates, as evidenced by numerous preepts. The area of the park is very poorly equipped with elements of small architecture. Trees are more self-seeding than composing greens. Scheduled tasks: 1) Q1 costs: construction works, archaeological and dendrological surveillance, indirect costs (promotion and management); 2) non-square costs: design doc., author's supervision, construction works (gym and part of the scope concerning teletech connections). This includes: reconstruction of the communication system, setting of small architecture facilities, construction of a park spring, reconstruction of a sledge hill, construction of a playground and gym, renovation of fences and retaining walls, construction of a water supply system and connection as well as a rainwater drainage system, construction of an electricity system and park lighting along with a monitoring system. The project also assumes the care of existing greenery and the introduction of plantings into the park through the use of shrubs and herbaceous plants. As part of the project, demolition works in the field of infr. and felling of trees and shrubs are planned before the introduction of new plantings. The beneficiary has approved documentation of the architects. - construction, vetting study and necessary conservation permits, building permit from dn. 26/07/2023 (from 31.07.2023) and issued certificates of no grounds for objecting to the application in the field of telecommunications (Dz. 132/1 and 134, rev.2 ark.6; d. 3/6, rev.22 ark.2). The contractor for the construction works will be selected as a result of a public procurement procedure. The planned activities aim at exposing cultural heritage and mean not only the protection and renovation of the historic site, but above all ensure the viability and functional attractiveness of the park, clarify its history, care for the state of greenery and ecological conditions and improve the state of public space. The project is in line with the assumptions of the NEB. It is planned to renovate buildings using innovative materials and solutions inspired by nature and save resources, e.g. mineral, sand surfaces, wood chips, elements of small architecture made of wood, energy-saving park lamps, bird nesting boxes. During the durability period of the project, cyclical outdoor events were planned in the park, implemented by the District House of Culture Bronowice, addressed especially to seniors and children. The planned activities during the durability period will allow the project to have a longer-term impact, contribute to a better use of the infrastructure, increase the number of visitors, as well as promote the site covered by the project. Details are set out in the site’s activity plan over the shelf-life period.

title: Improving the spatial, social and cultural cohesion of the Lublin Functional Area through revitalisation
description: The project consists of 9 communes located within the Lublin Functional Area located in 4 powiats: Lubelski, Łęczyński, Świdnicki and Lubartów. This project will be implemented in 9 municipalities with a common objective – accelerating sustainable development through the spatial and social revitalisation of the LOF. According to the diagnosis, in the Lublin Functional Area there are urgent needs for revitalisation activities, in order to adapt the space and public buildings to perform socio-economic and cultural functions. Due to the numerous negative social phenomena, such as: population ageing, addiction, unemployment – degraded areas are in a state of crisis and some of the population is socially excluded. The measures taken by municipalities are insufficient due to the lack of adequate infrastructure. It is therefore necessary to intervene urgently in this area. Main objective: — halting the process of marginalisation of revitalised areas, and subsequently increasing their importance in the changed structure of the functions and structures of the area, increasing the availability of residents to technical infrastructure services and improving the quality of these services; increasing the accessibility of residents to services provided using social infrastructure; improving the technical status of buildings and buildings improving the level of safety; Result indicators: Number of enterprises located in revitalised areas 4 [pcs] Number of people using socio-cultural/tourist infrastructure facilities covered by the project 11 653 (person/year) – Area of areas prepared for economic activity 12 862 [m²] The usable area of buildings prepared for economic activity 333,7 [m²] In Annex 2 to the application for dofins, a description of the material scope is presented by municipalities.

title: Reconstruction and renovation of the historic Church of the Evangelical-Augsburg Parish of the Holy Trinity in Lublin – Stage II.
description: The aim of the project is to increase the cultural, touristic and social attractiveness of the historic Church of the Evangelical-Augsburg Parish of the Holy Trinity in Lublin by protecting, using and increasing access to unique cultural heritage resources of historical, historical and tourist value. The aim of the project is to develop social activity through the renovation of the historic building and the purchase of equipment necessary for the implementation of the cultural and educational offer of the Church of the Evangelical-Augsburg Parish of the Holy Trinity in Lublin. Cultural objectives to be achieved as a result of the project: stopping the degradation of historic objects naturally predisposed to the creation of a cultural base; exploiting the potential of cultural heritage in the form of tourist, historical and historic values; improving the cultural, tourist and investment attractiveness of the historical architectural and urban complex of the Old Town and the City Centre of Lublin; creating a cultural offer and a unique tourist product based on the values of cultural and historical heritage; increasing social integration through the protection of cultural heritage and the development of infrastructure based on cultural and historical heritage resources; creating conditions for the development of free time in the sphere of culture. The achievement of the headline target, together with the specific objectives, will allow the achievement of many socio-economic benefits. The main benefit will be the increased number of users and tourists, which will entail further profits. The other socio-economic benefits of the investment are: -reducing the costs of maintaining the infrastructure belonging to the Evangelical-Augsburg Parish in Lublin, -reducing the degree of technical degradation of historic cultural heritage infrastructure naturally predisposed to the creation of a cultural, tourist, recreational and landscape base, -activating local entrepreneurs providing services accompanying tourism, -decreasing unemployment through new employment opportunities or running their own business thanks to an increased number of visitors and increased demand for all services, -increase in the income of local companies due to the increased number of tourists, -creating a recreational and tourist offer and a unique tourist product, -increased opportunities for leisure and recreation. As part of this investment, tasks such as: 1.Renovation works together with restoration works in the Church of St. John the Baptist The Trinity, 2. Purchase of equipment for cultural activities, 3. Purchasing services related to cultural activities, 4. Feasibility study, 5. Development of technical documentation and performing author's supervisions, 6. Inspector of Supervision, 7. Indirect costs. This investment will be carried out in one stage. At the date of submission of the application, the Applicant signed contracts for the preparation of a feasibility study and technical documentation. After receiving a positive decision on the selection of the project for co-financing, the Applicant will proceed to the selection of contractors - equipment supplier and contractor of construction works, and then to the implementation - payment and settlement of the project.

title: Reconstruction/expansion of the Voivodeship Road No. 835 Lublin – Przeworsk – Grabownica Starzeńska on the section from the intersection with the Voivodeship Road No. 870 in Sieniawa to the link of the voivodship road with the “Przeworsk” junction in Gorliczyna – Stage II
description: The main objective of the project is to improve the transport accessibility of the south-eastern part of Podkarpackie voivodship in road traffic and to increase the region’s communication coherence. The project will result in improving social and territorial cohesion of the Podkarpackie Voivodship in the area of road infrastructure by improving the communication system of the voivodship. Implementation of the project will contribute to the economic development of the region, its investment attractiveness will increase, as well as the potential and opportunities for the development of entrepreneurship in this area.The object of the investment is construction works on a bridge facility on the San River in m. Ubieszyn in km 133 + 672.81-133+ 925,66 consisting of adjusting its load capacity to class A according to PN-85/S-10030. The investment plan includes the reconstruction of the bridge facility and the adaptation of access to the bridge.The reconstructed engineering facility will be used to carry out motor and pedestrian traffic on the San River. The reconstruction of the facility is aimed at adapting it to the parameters of the rebuilt road, as well as to the requirements of the Regulation of the Minister of Transport and Maritime Economy of 30 May 2000 on technical conditions to be told by road engineering structures and their location. As a result of the reconstruction, the technical and traffic parameters of the bridge will be improved. The load capacity class of the object will increase from C to A according to PN-85/S-10030. As a result of the reconstruction of the facility, it is expected to increase the width of the bridge resulting from the need to equip the facility with a pedestrian pavement with a width of 2.0 m and the use of appropriate traffic safety devices. The total length of the object will not change.As a result of the project, the bridge object will achieve the following parameters: length of the carrying system: 239,95 m, static diagram: continuous beam 6 bay, overall width: 10,67 m, width of the road: 6,00 m + 2 x 0,5 m bands, load class: A (50 tons).The length of the section of the road rebuilt as a result of the project is 0.25 km.

title: "Comprehensive activation of the unemployed by the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin (II)"
description: The implementation of the project will contribute to the achievement of the specific objective of the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027. The aim of the project is to increase access to employment of unemployed people registered in the MUP in Lublin through effective professional activation. The main result of the project will be the employment of 255 unemployed people. The main objective directly translates into tasks that are a component of comprehensive activation activities, including for people in a special situation on the labour market. The implemented projects will be aimed at helping recipients of support in gaining professional experience. For support aimed at people aged 18-29, the project will include the opportunity to acquire digital and necessary skills to work in the green economy sector. Support for young people will be in line with the objectives of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan in Poland, i.e. within 4 months from the date of joining the project, young people will receive an offer of employment, further education, apprenticeship, internship or other form of assistance leading to professional activation. At least 23% of the funds planned in the project will support young people (18-29 years old). All project participants (POs) will be covered by Individual Action Plans (IPDs). Granting support under the project is preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of a given UP, including by developing/updating for each IPD referred to in Art. 1 point 10a and Article 34a of the Act on employment promotion and labour market institutions. 160 UP(75K) will be directed to training in line with the diagnosed needs and potential of UP and the diagnosed needs of the relevant local or regional labour market, including the identified needs of employers. The result of the training is obtaining qualifications or competences by UP. 456 UP(216K) will be directed to internships. The internships established under the project will last for a period of not less than 3 months and not longer than 6 months. 132 UP(62K) will receive one-off funds for starting a business activity, 34 UP(16K) will be directed to equipping/fitting workstations, 49 UP(23K) will receive a settlement voucher, 16 UP(7K) will be directed to intervention works. Inf.-prom. activities will be carried out on the premises of MUP throughout the project implementation period by posting information on the website, on posters and leaflets and by direct contact of employees with customers. The project meets horizontal criteria: 1. complies with the provisions of national and Union law as regards the manner of implementation and the scope of the project, 2. complies with the relevant Union rules: with a minimum standard for the implementation of the principle of equality between women and men, the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the principle of sustainable development. The project complies with: the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union of 26 October 2012, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, drawn up in New York on 13 December 2006, the Detailed Description of Priorities (SZOP) of the FEL 2021-2027 programme, the Guidelines for the implementation of projects involving ESF+ funds in regional programmes for 2021-2027, other Community policies and principles, market prices, and services and labour market instruments will be implemented in accordance with the provisions of the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions, strategic documents: national, regional, communes of Lublin, e.g. The project of the Social Policy Strategy of the Lubelskie Voivodeship for 2021-2030, the Development Strategy of the Lubelskie Voivodeship until 2030 and the Revitalization Programme for Lublin for 2024-2033. The project is substantively coherent and contributes to the achievement of Objective 9.1 and Specific Objective 4a.

title: "Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people from the Hrubieszów county edition I"
description: The aim of the project is to increase access to employment for all jobseekers (including the unemployed remaining in the registers of employment offices), who are in a difficult situation on the labour market, with particular emphasis on women, young people, the elderly, the long-term unemployed, people with low qualifications and competences, people with disabilities, people leaving agriculture through effective professional activation - in particular, increasing, acquiring or reskilling, competences / skills, consistent with the identified needs of employers. The project is in line with specific objective 4(a) (ESF+) of Priority IX Satisfying labour market needs: improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably by implementing the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, as well as for inactive people, and by promoting self-employment and the social economy. As part of the project, the District Labour Office in Hrubieszów will provide comprehensive vocational activation to unemployed people (including subsidies for self-employment) in order to increase their chances of finding employment. The project will finance services and labour market instruments specified in the Act on Employment Promotion and Labour Market Institutions, excluding public works. Providing support to a project participant will be preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of a given participant, including by developing/updating the IPD. The project will provide labour market services, i.e. job placement and/or career guidance, which will not be financed by the EUTF. Participation in the project will enable you to take up employment, and the offered forms of support, i.e. internships will allow you to acquire new practical skills to perform work, training to obtain or supplement occupational qualifications or competences, vouchers for settling and equipping or retrofitting a workplace to gain occupational experience, grants to take up self-employment. Tut. When implementing the project, the Office will carry out information and promotion activities. The documents related to the implementation of the project will be marked and will contain the following characters: The European Funds mark for Lublin, the colour mark of the Republic of Poland, the European Union mark, the promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The project documents will indicate that the project is implemented under the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027 co-financed by the European Social Fund Plus. The announcement of the project will appear in the Office's showcases, on the Office's website ww.hrubieszów.praca.gov.pl partially adapted to WCAG2.1 standards. Information about the project will be provided by the Office's employees who have direct contact with the unemployed during a personal meeting and using a telephone or e-mail. Information posters about the project in A3 format will be displayed at the office. The information poster will appear on the stand of the so-called triptych, which will be set up in front of the Office building, so that the information is publicly available to the residents of the Hrubieszów County. Information about the implemented project will be placed on the lubiehrubie.pl website and posters informing about the project will be displayed on the advertising board in the city of H-ów. Project participants will receive stickers that will be placed in a clearly visible place on the equipment purchased as part of the project. Posters informing about the implemented project will be handed over to employers for display at the company's headquarters. The PLO in Hrubieszów is not in arrears with the payment of taxes, as well as with the payment of social and health insurance contributions, FP, PFRON or other receivables required by separate regulations.

title: Professional activation - PUP project in Łuków (I)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment opportunities of unemployed people registered in the PLO in Łuków, including people in a special situation on the labour market (people up to 30 years of age, long-term unemployed, with disabilities or limited mobility), people over 55 years of age, people belonging to the NEET category, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine by gaining work experience as part of internships, job retrofitting, business start-up grants, a settlement voucher and by obtaining qualifications or competences as part of training. As part of the project, support will be provided to 169 persons (94 K.75M), including at least 6 persons with disabilities, 1 farmer or a member of his family, 4 persons over 55 years of age, 52 persons long-term unemployed, 100 persons aged 18-29 years and 6 persons aged 30-54 years without additional characteristics. As a result of the project, at least 30% of participants (i.e. 51 persons) will take up employment and at least 7 persons will obtain a qualification or competence. All training within the project will end with an exam allowing to obtain qualifications or competences (crit.8). Support for 18-29 year-olds will provide opportunities to acquire the digital and skills needed to work in the green economy (crit.6). Persons aged 18-29 will be provided with an adequate quality of support by defining thematic priorities for the support, needs and potential of the participant and diagnosed needs of the regional labour market (including the needs of employers) (crit.9).Each participant will be presented with an activation offer preceded by an in-depth analysis of skills, predispositions and professional problems as part of occupational guidance. The result of the analysis will be the development or modification of the IPD (crit.7). Each participant will receive a support offer covering all forms of support that will be identified as targeted to improve their labour market situation or gain employment. Each participant will receive support in the form of IPD, career guidance and cost form (training/internship/grant/retrofit/settlement voucher). The support addressed to young people is in line with the objectives of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan (criterion 4).The project planned internships for 104 people, 6 workplace fitting-outs, individual training for 2 people, a training voucher for 11 people, grants for 38 people and settlement vouchers for 8 people. The poster and the criteria for participation in the project will be available on the Office's website and at the Office's premises for the entire duration of the project. Documents created for the purposes of the project will bear the European Union mark, the European Funds mark and the official promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The activities implemented in the project are in line with the thematic objective and Priority IX. The project will be implemented in accordance with the Act on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions, the PPL Act and other relevant national and EU legislation, with the principles of public aid, with the minimum standard of implementation of the principle of equality between women and men, with the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union as regards the method of implementation and the scope of the project, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, the principle of sustainable development, and other Community policies and principles, with the provisions of the SZOP FEL 2021-2027, with the provisions of the relevant guidelines mandatory during the threshold period. 2021-2027. The project is coherent and will contribute to the achievement of the specific objective indicated in the FEL 2021-2027 programme.

title: Professional activation - PUP project in Łuków (II)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment opportunities of unemployed people registered in the PLO in Łuków, including people in a special situation on the labour market (people up to 30 years of age, long-term unemployed, with disabilities or limited mobility), people over 55 years of age, people belonging to the NEET category, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine by gaining work experience as part of internships, business start-up grants, a settlement voucher and by obtaining qualifications or competences as part of training. Under the project, support will be given to 127 persons (82K,45M), including at least 6 persons with disabilities, 1 farmer or a member of his family, 4 persons over 55 years of age, 31 persons long-term unemployed, 63 persons aged 18-29 years and 22 (14K, 8M) persons aged 30-54 years without additional characteristics. As a result of the project, at least 30% of participants (i.e. 39 persons) will take up employment and at least 5 persons will obtain qualifications/competences. All training within the project will end with an exam allowing to obtain qualifications or competences (crit.8). Support for 18-29 year-olds will provide opportunities to acquire the digital and skills needed to work in the green economy (crit.6). For people aged 18-29, the quality of support will be ensured by defining thematic priorities for the support, needs and potential of the participant and the diagnosed needs of the regional labour market (including the needs of employers) (criterion 9).The provision of support under the project will be preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of each participant, resulting in the development or modification of the IPD (criterion 7). Each participant will receive a support offer covering all forms of support that will be identified as targeted to improve their labour market situation or gain employment. Each participant will receive support in the form of an IPD and a cost form (training/training/grant/settlement voucher). The support for young people is in line with the objectives of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan (criterion 4).The project planned internships for 82 people, individuation training for 2 people, a training voucher for 6 people, grants for 31 people and settlement vouchers for 6 people. The amount of training provided for in the project is due to the low interest in these forms in previous years. The poster and the criteria for participation in the project will be available on the Office's website and at the Office's premises for the entire duration of the project. Documents created for the purposes of the project will bear the European Union mark, the European Funds mark and the official promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The activities implemented in the project are in line with the thematic objective and Priority IX. The project will be implemented in accordance with the Act on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions, the PPL Act and other relevant national and EU legislation, with the principles of public aid, with the minimum standard of implementation of the principle of equality between women and men, with the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union as regards the method of implementation and the scope of the project, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, the principle of sustainable development, and other Community policies and principles, with the provisions of the SZOP FEL 2021-2027, with the provisions of the relevant guidelines mandatory during the threshold period. 2021-2027. The project is coherent and will contribute to the achievement of the specific objective indicated in the FEL 2021-2027 programme.

title: "Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people from the Hrubieszów county edition II"
description: The project will be implemented as part of Measure 9.1 Vocational activation - PUP projects, Priority IX Satisfying the needs of the labour market, project type No.1: Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people (including subsidies for self-employment) in order to increase their chances of finding employment - implemented only by district labour offices, the European Funds for Lublin 2021-2027 programme. The project is in line with Policy Objective 4. A more social, inclusive and implementing Europe’s Pillar of Social Rights and with Specific Objective 4a (ESF+): improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably by implementing the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, as well as for inactive people, and by promoting self-employment and the social economy. The project will be co-financed by the EU under the ESF+. The aim of the project is to increase access to employment of unemployed people registered here. Office through the use of comprehensive support. The project will be implemented in accordance with the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions. Support in the project will be preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of a given participant, including by developing/updating the IPD. As part of the project, services and labour market instruments specified in the Act on employment promotion and labour market institutions, excluding public works, will be implemented. Job placement and/or career guidance will be provided to the participant and will not be funded by the EUTF under the project. The project will implement such forms of support as: traineeships that will allow you to acquire new practical skills to perform work, training that will allow you to obtain or supplement professional qualifications or competences, settlement vouchers and equipping or retrofitting a job to gain professional experience, grants to take up self-employment. Tut. When implementing the project, the Office will carry out information and promotion activities. The documents related to the implementation of the project will be marked and will contain the following characters: The European Funds mark for Lublin, the colour mark of the Republic of Poland, the European Union mark, the promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The project documents will indicate that the project is implemented under the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027 co-financed by the European Social Fund Plus. The announcement of the project will appear in the Office's showcases, on the Office's website ww.hrubieszów.praca.gov.pl partially adapted to WCAG2.1 standards. Information about the project will be provided by the Office's employees who have direct contact with the unemployed during a personal meeting and using a telephone or e-mail. Information posters about the project in A3 format will be displayed at the office. The information poster will appear on the "stand", which will be set up in front of the Office building, so that the information is publicly available to the residents of the Hrubieszów County. Information about the implemented project will be placed on the lubiehrubie.pl website and posters informing about the project will be displayed on the advertising board in the city of H-ów. Project participants will receive stickers that will be placed in a clearly visible place on the equipment purchased as part of the project. Posters informing about the implemented project will be handed over to employers for display at the company's headquarters.

title: Professional activation - PUP project in Łuków (III)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment opportunities of unemployed people registered in the PLO in Łuków, including people in a special situation on the labour market (people up to 30 years of age, long-term unemployed, with disabilities or with reduced mobility), people over 55 years of age, people belonging to the NEET category, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine by gaining work experience as part of internships, funds for starting a business, a settlement voucher and by obtaining qualifications or competences as part of training. The project will support 79 people (48K, 31M), including at least 2 people with disabilities, 1 farmer or a member of his family, 2 people over 55 years of age, 20 people long-term unemployed, 32 people aged 18-29 years and 22 (16K, 6M) people aged 30-54 years without additional characteristics. As a result of the project, at least 30% of participants (i.e. 34 persons) will take up employment and at least 4 persons will obtain qualifications/competences. All trainings within the project will end with an exam allowing to obtain qualifications or competences (crit.8). Support for 18-29 year-olds will provide the opportunity to acquire the digital and skills needed to work in the green economy, the skills needed from a regional/local point of view in health and care professions (criterion 6). For people aged 18-29, the quality of support will be ensured by defining thematic priorities for the support, the needs and potential of the participant and the diagnosed needs of the regional labour market (including the needs of employers) (crit.9). The provision of support under the project will be preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of each participant, which will result in the development or modification of the IPD (criterion 7). Each participant will receive a support offer covering all forms of support that will be identified as targeted to improve their labour market situation or gain employment. Each participant will receive support in the form of an IPD and a cost form (training/training/grant/settlement voucher). Support for young people is in line with the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan (clause 4). The project includes internships for 34 people, individual training for 2 people, a training voucher for 5 people, grants for 32 people and settlement vouchers for 6 people. The amount of training provided for in the project is due to low interest in these forms in previous years. The poster and the criteria for participation in the project will be available on the Office's website and at the Office's premises for the entire duration of the project. Documents created for the purposes of the project will bear the European Union mark, the European Funds mark and the official promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship. The colour version also includes the colours of the Republic of Poland. The activities implemented in the project are in line with the thematic objective and Priority IX. The project will be implemented in accordance with the Act on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions, the PPL Act and other relevant national and EU legislation, with the principles of public aid, with the minimum standard of implementation of the principle of equality between women and men, with the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union as regards the method of implementation and the scope of the project, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, the principle of sustainable development, and other Community policies and principles, with the provisions of the SZOP FEL 2021-2027, with the provisions of the relevant guidelines in force during the threshold period. 2021-2027.
