The project is substantively consistent and will contribute to the achievement of the specific objective indicated in the FEL 2021-2027 programme.

title: Actively for the common good
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employability of the Lubelskie labour market and the functioning in Polish society by the end of September 2025 of 70 citizens of Ukraine remaining unemployed, residing according to the Civil Code/legally staying in the territory of the Lubelskie Voivodeship (WL) (67K and 3 M) in connection with war activities carried out in Ukraine benefiting from temporary protection in connection with Council Implementing Decision (EU) 2022/382. The goal will be achieved through the implementation of comprehensive activation measures tailored to the individual predispositions and needs of project participants (POs) and the needs of the Lublin labour market, increasing their attractiveness on the open labour market and enabling them to take up legal employment.The same 70 third-country nationals, i.e. people who are nationals of non-EU countries, will be supported and their participation in the labour market and the degree of integration into Polish society will increase, implementing the specific objective 4i of ESF+ Priority VIII Increasing social cohesion: supporting the socio-economic integration of third-country nationals, including migrants. As a result of the implementation of the project and ESF+ support, up to 4 weeks after the end of participation in the project: 1. employment will take up (including self-employed)min. 35% UP i.e. 25 pers., while others will increase employment opportunities by adjusting qualifications/competences to the needs of the Lublin labour market and gaining professional experience in this area; 2. The social situation will improve at least 80% of UP, i.e. 56 pers., which will be evidenced by the obtained min. 1 from the effects: strengthening motivation to work, increasing self-confidence and own skills, improving the ability to solve emerging problems, starting education, volunteering; 3. The number of people who have obtained qualifications during or up to 4 weeks from the end of their participation in the project will be: 65%UP i.e. 46 pers. The sequence of complementary activities gives real chances to find employment in Poland and increase social cohesion: from researching the potential of professions-teams, and identification of development needs, through adaptation workshops, Polish language courses at the level A0,a1,B1 to vocational training, job placement and 3 months of vocational internships.UP will be taken care of by the Assistant/Adaptive Assistants throughout the support path, who will maintain the motivation of the UP, provide advice and help in practical issues related to staying in Poland, inform about the procedures applicable to, among others, employment, education, active participation in social life, etc. Tasks (mandatory for all UPs): 1. INDIVIDUAL ACTION PLAN (IPD) and Adaptation Assistant support (05/2024-06/2025) 2. ADAPTATION WORKSHOP (3 groups x 8 teaching hours) 06-06/2025r. 3. POLISH LANGUAGE COURSES FOR NATIONALS 06/2024- 06/2025; 8-9 groups of 40 hours 4. COURSES/PROFESSIONAL TRAINING 06/2024-06/2025 5. WORK INTERMEDIATE 08/2024- 09/2025; 3 hours/person 6. PROFESSIONAL TRAILERS 08/2024-09/2025; (After 3 months). Information campaign (bilingual: PL, UA/RU) in the WL area will include info letters/posters/leaflets about the support offered and recruitment criteria.transmitted, among others, by:NGO,JST and employment services, parishes and Caritas,str www proj, Facebook account, groups of Ukrainians in the social media.We will use the channels and partners acquired during the implementation of the project for Ukrainian citizens. The project meets the criteria of 2,3,4: is implemented in a multisectoral partnership, uses an innovative solution developed under the HC OP, and the Applicant and the Partner have experience in interregional, cross-border and transnational cooperation in the scope of the target group planned to be supported and carry out similar tasks. The project fits in with the goals of the Integrated Skills Strategy 2030 consistent with the goal of the Strategy for Responsible Development.

title: Lublin Programme for Active Reintegration
description: The project is aimed at supporting active social inclusion and participation in social life and increasing the employability of economically inactive people in a particularly disadvantaged situation. The project responds to the problems diagnosed in the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027, i.e., among others, the high risk of social exclusion and poverty resulting from unemployment, the unfavourable scale of reducing the chances of certain social groups to participate equally in social and economic life, the large distance of the social group from the labour market, communication exclusion. The project will offer UP comprehensive support responding to their individual needs and capabilities and corresponding to the needs of the local labour market. The applicant and the Partner (multisectoral partnership) will strive to achieve the highest possible degree of achievement of the main objective, which is: increased socio-occupational activity and the ability to take up employment 120[72k/48m], including min.12ozn, inactive, in particular at risk of social exclusion. (in KC) in the area of Lubelskie Province; resulting in obtaining qualifications by min.102 persons[62k/40m], employment by min.30 persons[18k/12m] and job search by min.31 persons[19k/12m]; thanks to participation in the forms of social and environmental activation support proposed in the project, tailored individually to the OP; between 12.2024 and 02.2026. This will be achieved through the following sub-objectives: 1) developed action plan for socio-occupational reintegration based on diagnosed individual needs and possibilities of 120 persons[72k/48m], including min.12ozn; by the end of 08.2025 [zad.1] 2) acquired/increased social competences at least 90% of 120 persons [72k/48m], including at least 12ozn; by the end of 10.2025 [zad.2] 3) obtained qualifications by at least 85% of 120 persons [72k/48m], including at least 12ozn; by the end of 11.2025 [zad.3] 4) overcoming / alleviating individual problems constituting a barrier to social reintegration, at least 90% of 120 persons [72k/48m], including at least 12ozn; by the end of 02.2026 [zad.4] 5) acquired experience by min.90% of 60 persons, including ozn; by the end of 02.2026 [zad.5] 6) acquired/increased job-search skills and established contacts with employers looking for employees for at least 90% of 120 persons [72k/48m], including at least 12ozn; by the end of 02.2026 [zad.6] The above objectives translate into the following tasks within the scope of social activation offered in the project: 1) Individual diagnosis of needs and potentials of UP 2) Workshops of social competences 3) Training courses (ext.) 4) Specialist counselling 5) Internships at UP 6) Intermediation of work. These services will be tailored in an individualized manner, provided while maintaining the subjectivity of the individual, respecting his needs and taking into account the right to infor.o support possibilities. Support offered in the project breaks down barriers (addition to the part below)UP, including: 1) Low motivation to change your situation.-gosp. 2) Shame before admitting to your problems,fear before external evaluation 3) No possibility to reach a larger center (e.g. no bus connections). Formulated for the project, the objective fits in and allows the achievement of the specific objective (4h) indicated in the FELU 2021-2027 for the FELU.08.01 Action, because it allows - among others: increase the chances of finding employment, effective social and professional activation, compensate deficits resulting from (...) lack of qualifications and reduce the negative effects of the exclusion of communications. The promotion will be carried out in a manner accessible to the needs of the organisations (adaptation of channels, method of transmission, adaptation to different types of minors) in accordance with the ‘Handbook WN and benef.FE for 2021-2027 on information and promotion’ and will contain info.o cofin.proj.EFS+. Methods (due to the specificity of GD-os.ZUiWS) will focus on traditional tools (listed posters, leaflets; information through local helpdesks and employment institutions, local partners; information meetings). On-line tools in support.

title: "Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people from the Hrubieszów county 3rd edition"
description: Project implemented under the European Funds for Lublin 2021-2027 programme, Priority IX Satisfying the needs of the labour market, Measure 9.1 Vocational activation - PUP projects, project type 1: Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people (including subsidies for self-employment) in order to increase their chances of finding employment - implemented only by district labour offices. The project is in line with Policy Objective 4. A more social, inclusive and implementing Europe’s Pillar of Social Rights and with Specific Objective 4a (ESF+): improving access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably by implementing the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, as well as for inactive people, and by promoting self-employment and the social economy. The project will be co-financed by the EU under the ESF+. The main objective of the project is to increase access to employment of unemployed persons registered here. Office through the use of comprehensive support. The project is implemented in accordance with the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions. Indirect costs are not eligible under the PLO project. Granting support under the project is preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of a given participant, including by developing/updating the IPD. The project provides services and labour market instruments specified in the Act on employment promotion and labour market institutions, excluding public works. Job placements and/or career guidance are provided to the participant and are not funded by the EUTF under the project. The project will implement such forms of support as: internships - which will allow you to acquire new practical skills to perform work, training - which will allow you to obtain or supplement professional qualifications or competences, settlement vouchers and equipping or retrofitting a job - gain professional experience, subsidies - take up self-employment. During the implementation of the project, the European Funds for Lublin sign, the colours of the Republic of Poland, the European Union sign, the promotional logo of the Lubelskie Voivodeship will be prominently displayed on all information and promotional activities concerning the project, documents and materials made public, documents for people participating in the project. There will be information that the project is implemented under the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027 co-financed by the European Social Fund Plus. Information about the implemented project will be placed in a visible place at the office and a poster in A3 format will appear highlighting the fact of receiving EU funding. The A3 information poster will appear on the "stand", which will be set up in front of the Office building, so that the information will be publicly available to the residents of the Hrubieszów County. Information about the project will be provided by the Office's employees who have direct contact with the unemployed during a personal meeting and using a telephone or e-mail. The description of the project will be posted on the website of the Office ww.hrubieszów.praca.gov.pl adapted to WCAG2.1 standards, on the lubiehrubie.pl website and on the social media website. Posters informing about the project will be posted on the advertising board in the city of H-ów. The label in the form of stickers will be placed in a clearly visible place on the equipment, equipment, etc. purchased under the project. A3 posters highlighting the fact of receiving EU funding will be handed over to employers for display at the company's headquarters.

title: Opportunity for success
description: The main objective of the project is to increase socio-occupational activity and employability of 65 people without employment, socially excluded or at risk of exclusion/poverty from the Lubelskie Voivodeship (41 women, 24 men), in the period 01.08.2024-30.06.2025. The goal will be achieved through a comprehensive socio-occupational activation program for 65 above-mentioned people, including an individual action plan, coaching, training of social skills and competences, vocational training, professional internship and job placement. The project will be implemented between 1 August 2024 and 30 June 2025 in the Lubelskie Province. Promotion of the project in the Lubelskie Voivodeship will include: face-to-face meetings in e.g. the project office, at job fairs; leaflets, posters, e.g. showcases, information boards, parishes, community centres, clinics, direct distribution; sending information on the project, e.g. to PUP, OPS, PCPR, ROPS, municipal offices, mayors, councillors, libraries, third-century universities; website subpage, including for OzN, advertising portals, Facebook information exchange groups; Whisper marketing. The project is a response to the problem of people without employment, socially excluded or at risk of exclusion/poverty from the Lublin province diagnosed in the Applicant's own study, i.e.: low level of socio-occupational activity and employability (due to the lack of signs, a broader description is included in point Additional information, when describing the fulfilment of the award criterion on the target group). The project assumes the achievement of result indicators at the end of its implementation: Number of persons who obtained a qualification after leaving the programme: 52 people (30 women, 22 men); Number of people working after leaving the programme: 16 people (10 women, 6 men); Number of jobseekers after leaving the programme: 32 people (19 women, 13 men); Number of people whose social situation has improved (social efficiency criterion): 32 people (19 women, 13 men). In this context, the specific objective ESF+.CP4.H – Fostering active social inclusion to promote equal opportunities, non-discrimination and active participation, and enhancing employability, in particular of disadvantaged groups, will be achieved. [PREMIUM CRITERIA 1]: The project results from the Municipal Revitalization Program for Lublin for the years 2023-2030. To this end, at the recruitment stage, people living in the area of the Municipal Revitalisation Programme for Lublin for the years 2023-2030 will receive bonus points, and therefore will be preferred for support in the project. At least 10% of the target group (6 persons – 4 women, 2 men) will be persons covered by the above-mentioned Municipal Revitalisation Programme for Lublin for 2023-2030 (description in point Additional information). The implementation of the project will contribute to the achievement of the objectives contained in the national and regional strategic documents, such as: Development strategies: Human Capital 2030 (increasing the level of competences and qualifications of citizens, increasing and improving the use of the potential of human capital in the labour market); Regional 2030 (development of human and social capital); It's a war. Lublin by 2030 (development of human capital). The project is compatible with, among others: with a minimum standard for the implementation of the principle of equality between women and men; the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities; the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the EU of 26 October 2012 (Official Journal Ooh, ooh, ooh. EU C 326, 26.10.2012, p. 391); the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, done at New York on 13 December 2006 (Journal Journal of Laws 2012, item 1169, as amended); with the principle of sustainable development (described in more detail in point Additional information).

title: Return to professional activity
description: The aim of the project is to support gender-balanced participation in the labour market, equal working conditions and a better work-life balance through the activation of 61 unemployed people from the voivodeship of Lublin , including at least 50 women through psychological support, Social Skills Training , training support, placement services and internships and awareness training on work-life balance among 50 employees between 1 March 2024 and 30 June 2025. TARGET GROUP : The project will involve at least 61 people from the Lubelskie Voivodeship, including at least 50 women who are unemployed, inactive, and people returning to the labour market. Min. 50% of project participants, i.e. 31 people will be long-term unemployed We expect that at least 50 employees will take part in the project. They will take part in a 2-day training course – awareness-raising activities to ensure a better work-life balance : WORK-LIFE-BALANCE ACTIONS: 1.Individual diagnosis of skills - 2 hours/person 2. Psychological counseling - 4 hours/person 3. Social competence workshops - 5 groups x 24 hours 4. Employment placement – 60 persons x 6 hours 3. IPD-compliant training - 5 groups x 12 people x 80 hours 4.Work placement - 55 people x 3/4 months 5.Work-life balance awareness training for 50 employees : WORK-LIFE-Balance MAIN INDICATORS : Number of persons who obtained a qualification after leaving the programme - 43 persons Number of jobseekers after leaving the programme - 8 persons

title: Lubelskie helps Ukraine — learning Polish
description: The project is aimed at adults who, as a result of hostilities in Ukraine, have legally arrived on the territory of the Republic of Poland after 24.02.2022 and are located in the Lublin Voivodeship. The 1800 Group will be able to voluntarily take part in free language training courses in Polish. The project will be implemented from 1.05.2022 to 31.08.2023 in the Lublin Voivodeship. Training groups will be set up in places of demand for this type of activity and at times tailored to individual needs, in order to facilitate access for participants. Classes — depending on your preferences — will be conducted in stationary or remote mode. It is planned to create 150 training groups with a small composition — max. 12-person. The beneficiary will outsource a training service to external institutions experienced in such activities. The role of language training will be to provide basic information and communication skills in Polish, so as to reduce the difficulties associated with the language barrier for refugees. Upon completion of the course, the participant will be able to communicate more easily with their surroundings to meet their needs in everyday situations: in offices, shops, health services, help centres, adult educational establishments and those whose children will attend. The acquisition of language skills will contribute to the increase in the professional activity of people coming from Ukraine — it will facilitate the search for employment, start their own business or maintain their existing workplace. Upon completion of the course, students will receive certificates of acquired training and acquired skills. The project assumes that 50 % of participants (900 pers.) will complete courses with a positive internal exam.

title: “BACK – support for the homeless in social readaptation and entry into the labour market – III edition”
description: The project aims to increase the social and professional integration of 50 UP (8K) – homeless people in the area of 18, except for those who are unemployed, low-skilled, including 10 people with disabilities (2 K) from the Lubelskie Voivodship through the implementation of an individual program of leaving homelessness by 30.09.2020.The implementation of the project will contribute to improving the living situation, social and professional reintegration, and ensuring the independent functioning of 50 people and homeless people. (6K) will raise the competence of the public, 16 people. (3K)- raise/professional qualification. The project envisages the acquisition of vocational training by 40 UP (8K), and employment by at least 15 people (3K). The reintegration path created for each UP, with the use of active inclusion services of social, occupation, education and health, assumes support in the process of social reintegration and professions/crit. spec.form No. 4/. Support of 50 UP, including 10 persons under-supply, will be preceded by a diagnosis of their needs and the creation for each IPD and the Individual Programme for Exiting Homelessness (hereinafter the Programme). The PP support will cover the implementation of the established phases using active inclusion services: diagnosis of needs UP- elaboration of IPD, intervention and protective support, support of individual coach trainer, integration of the community,- professional support, support, education. and health., colleagues in the field of active job search, vocational training and internships. The key. the result will be the rebuilding and maintenance of the skills of participation in the community’s life and the profession and the increase in employability. min. 15 UP and the exit from social exclusion and poverty.

title: Tailored Success
description: The project is aimed at 56(29K) unemployed and inactive persons living in the commune of Lubelskie Voivodeship, i.e.Bełżyce,Konopnica, Nie doorzwica Large,Strzyżewice at the age of 30 and more.In this group at least 80 % are unemployed persons, including at least 60 % of those who are long-term unemployed and at least 15 % of people leaving agriculture. In addition, the target group is 25 % of people aged 50 and over. The main objective of the project is to increase the skills and work experience needed on the labour market by 45os(23K,22M) from GD and thus to increase employment among those who are unemployed by 30.06.2018. The proposed project measures are a set of comprehensive approaches to people in particular disadvantaged labour market, including long-term unemployed, people aged 50 and over and those leaving agriculture and combine several complementary phases to identify the skills of the participants and to identify the skills of the individual(s) in the labour market. The project programme will consist of: — diagnosis of professional competences together with the creation of an individual action plan (4h/participant), – group vocational guidance (40h/participant), – individual job intermediation (min. 6h/participant), – Certified training tailored to the needs of the labour market and employers for persons who as a result of individual diagnosis identified the need to acquire, increase or change qualifications. Through vocational training and traineeships and accompanying actions for participants, support will be provided to acquire the qualifications necessary for the year and after the end of the programme, to take up employment.The implementation of the above-mentioned actions will contribute to the achievement of the objective of the main project in line with the specific objective of the Investment Priority

title: Inclusive Labour Market in Lubelskie Province (VI)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment of unemployed persons over 30 years of age registered at the District Labour Office in Lublin and in subsidiaries in Bełżyce and Bychawa from the district of Lublin, who are in a particularly difficult situation on the labour market (including older people over 50, women, people with disabilities, long-term unemployed and low-skilled) and improve the employability of people leaving agriculture. A total of 641 unemployed people will be supported under the project, including: — 230 women, – 163 long-term unemployed, – 12 people with disabilities, – 30 people over 50 years old, – 222 low-skilled people, – 40 unemployed persons not belonging to the groups mentioned above, – 2 persons wishing to leave agriculture (farmer or family member running an individual agricultural holding up to 2 ha of conversion). Individual and comprehensive professional activation will be carried out as part of the project. Each of the PPAs will be supported in the form of job placements or career counselling and an Individual Action Plan. Subsequently, according to the IPD, UP will be directed to one of the available forms of support: — internships of 170 persons, – vocational training of 173 persons, – intervention work of 71 persons, – one-off measures for setting up a business of 32 persons, – retrofitting/equipment of 23 persons.

title: Professional activation of unemployed persons aged 30 and over registered at the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin (VI)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment opportunities of unemployed people aged 30 and over registered at the MUP in Lublin. The main result of the project will be the start of employment by unemployed persons registered at the MUP in Lublin. The project will support unemployed persons aged 30 and over, registered at the MUP in Lublin, belonging to at least one of the following groups: people aged 50 and over, the long-term unemployed, persons with disabilities, the low-skilled, women, farmers and their family members, persons not belonging to any of these groups. The project is adapted to the formal requirements applicable under the 2014-2020 ROP PP. The project meets the horizontal criteria: 1. Complies with national legislation as regards the way in which the project is implemented and the scope of the project, 2. it complies with relevant Union rules: — the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for people with disabilities, – the principle of equal opportunities for women and men, – the concept of sustainable development. The project is in line with the SzOOP ROP WL 2014-2020. The project is coherent in substance and contributes to the objectives of Priority 8i. The project complies with the standard and market prices, and the support will be carried out on the basis of the standards laid down in the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions. The project complies with the Guidelines for the implementation of projects financed by the Labour Fund under operational programmes co-financed by the ESF for the period 2014-2020. The project is in line with other Community policies and principles. The project is in line with the strategic documents: national, regional, Municipalities of Lublin e.g. Lublin Development Strategy for the years 2013-2020, the Lublin Voivodeship Development Strategy 2014-2020 (with a perspective to 2030) and the Revitalisation Programme for Lublin 2017-2023.

title: "Professional activation of unemployed persons from the area of the city of Chełm and the district of Chełm (II)"
description: The aim of the project is to increase the chances of finding employment, including self-employment of 600 persons unemployed, with a particular focus on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; as well as persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category in the district of Chełm and the City of Chełm in the period from 01.01.2024 to 30.06.2025 by directing them to an internship, training, to work at an equipped / retrofitted workplace, granting a settlement voucher and granting one-off funds for starting a business activity. By pursuing the main objective, the project will contribute to the achievement of specific objective 4a of Measure 9.1. European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027. In order to adapt the support to the needs of all participants, an Individual Action Plan will be prepared. In addition, job placement or career guidance will be mandatory for all project participants, which will increase the effectiveness of the activities planned in the project and ensure the provision of individual and comprehensive assistance. Depending on the needs, project participants will be covered by the following forms of support: traineeships, training, settlement vouchers, equipment/retrofitting of workstations, one-off funds for starting a business. The project will result in at least 30% of project participants taking up employment or self-employment (i.e. at least 180KiM). The project will support 600 persons (360K;240M) registered in the PLO in Chełm as unemployed, with particular emphasis on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category. In order to reach potential participants, information and promotion activities will be carried out in the form of: information posters on the premises of the PLO, information on the website and on the social media of the PLO, information provided to social assistance and integration institutions in order to ensure the possibility of benefiting from the support of people who have ended their participation in Priority VII of the FEL 2021-2027 Programme. The project is in line with the provisions of the Action Charter 9.1, Priority IX of the CSP of the FEL 2021-2027 programme. Support for young people will be in line with the assumptions of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan in Poland, and at least 23% of the financial resources planned in the project will be allocated to support young people (18-29l).

title: Vocational activation of the unemployed from the area of the city of Chełm and the district of Chełm
description: The aim of the project is to increase the chances of finding employment, including self-employment of 902 unemployed people, with a particular focus on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category in the district of Chełm and the City of Chełm in the period from 01.01.2023 to 30.06.2024 by directing them to an internship, training, to work at an equipped / retrofitted workplace, granting a settlement voucher and granting funds for starting a business activity once. By pursuing the main objective, the project will contribute to the achievement of specific objective 4a of Measure 9.1. European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027. In order to adapt the support to the needs of all participants, an Individual Action Plan will be prepared. In addition, job placement or career guidance will be mandatory for all project participants, which will increase the effectiveness of the activities planned in the project and ensure the provision of individual and comprehensive assistance. Depending on the needs, project participants will be covered by the following forms of support: traineeships, training, settlement vouchers, equipment/retrofitting of workstations, one-off funds for starting a business. The project will result in at least 30% of project participants taking up employment or self-employment (i.e. at least 271KiM). The project will support 902 persons (542K;360M) registered in the PLO in Chełm as unemployed, with particular emphasis on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category. In order to reach potential participants, information and promotion activities will be carried out in the form of: information posters on the premises of the PLO, information on the website of the PLO, information provided to institutions of social assistance and integration in order to ensure the possibility of benefiting from the support of people who have ended their participation in Priority VII of the FEL 2021-2027 Programme. The project complies with the provisions of the Action Charter 9.1, Priority IX of the CSP of the FEL 2021-2027 programme. Support for young people will be in line with the assumptions of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan in Poland, and at least 23% of the financial resources planned in the project will be allocated to support young people (18-29l).

title: "Professional activation of unemployed persons from the area of the city of Chełm and the district of Chełm (III)"
description: The aim of the project is to increase the chances of finding employment, including self-employment of 375 persons unemployed, with a particular focus on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; as well as persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category in the district of Chełm and the City of Chełm in the period from 01.01.2025 to 30.06.2026 by directing them to an internship, training, to work at an equipped / retrofitted workplace, granting a settlement voucher and granting one-off funds for starting a business activity. By pursuing the main objective, the project will contribute to the achievement of specific objective 4a of Measure 9.1. European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027. In order to adapt the support to the needs of all participants, an Individual Action Plan will be prepared. In addition, job placement or career guidance will be mandatory for all project participants, which will increase the effectiveness of the activities planned in the project and ensure the provision of individual and comprehensive assistance. Depending on the needs, project participants will be covered by the following forms of support: traineeships, training, settlement vouchers, equipment/retrofitting of workstations, one-off funds for starting a business. The main result of the project will be employment or self-employment by at least 30% of project participants (i.e. at least 113KiM). The project will support 375 persons (220K;155M) registered in the PLO in Chełm as unemployed, with particular emphasis on people in a special situation on the labour market, people leaving agriculture and people granted temporary protection in connection with the war in Ukraine; persons with disabilities and persons belonging to the NEET category. In order to reach potential participants, information and promotion activities will be carried out in the form of: information posters on the premises of the PUP, information on the website and on the social media of the PUP. The project complies with the provisions of the Action Charter 9.1, Priority IX of the CSP of the FEL 2021-2027 programme (specific criteria No 2). Support for young people will be in line with the objectives of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan in Poland (specific criteria No 4), and at least 23% of the financial resources planned in the project will be allocated to support young people (18-29l) (specific criteria No 5) .

title: Inclusive labour market in Poviat Lubelskie (VII)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment of unemployed people over 30 years of age registered in the Poviat Labour Office in Lublin and in Filiy in Bełżyce and Bykhawa from the territory of the Lublin district in a particularly difficult situation on the labour market (including older people over 50 years old, women, disabled people, long-term unemployed and low-skilled people) as well as improving the employability of people leaving agriculture. A total of 600 unemployed people will be supported by the project, including: — 304 women, — 203 long-term unemployed, — 11 people with disabilities, 60 people over 50 years of age, — 283 low-skilled people, — 50 unemployed people not belonging to the groups indicated above, — 2 people intending to leave agriculture (farmer or family member running an individual farm up to the size of 2 ha of conversion). As part of the project, individual and comprehensive professional activation will be implemented. Each UP will be supported in the form of placement or career counselling and Individual Action Plan. In accordance with the assumptions of the IPD, UP will then be directed to one of the available forms of support: — traineeships 190 people, — vocational training 227 people, — intervention work of 117 people, — one-off funds for starting a business 43 people, — retrofitting/equipment of a workplace of 32 people.

title: Comprehensive vocational activation of unemployed people (including subsidies for self-employment) to increase their chances of finding employment – implemented by the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin (I)
description: The implementation of the project will contribute to the achievement of the specific objective of the European Funds for Lublin Programme 2021-2027. The aim of the project is to increase access to employment of unemployed people registered in the MUP in Lublin through effective professional activation. The main result of the project will be the employment of 339 unemployed people. The main objective directly translates into tasks that are a component of comprehensive activation measures, including for people in a particularly difficult situation on the labour market. The implemented projects will be aimed at helping recipients of support in gaining professional experience. For support aimed at people over a period of 18-29 years, the project will include the opportunity to acquire digital and necessary skills to work in the green economy sector. Support for young people will be in line with the objectives of the Youth Guarantee Implementation Plan in Poland, i.e. within 4 months from the date of joining the project, young people will receive an offer of employment, further education, apprenticeship, internship or other form of assistance leading to professional activation. At least 23% of the financial resources of the planned project will be allocated to support young people (18-29 years old). All project participants (POs) will be covered by Individual Action Plans (IPDs). Granting support under the project is preceded by an in-depth analysis of the skills, predispositions and professional problems of a given UP, including by developing/updating for each IPD referred to in Art. 1 point 10a and Article 34a of the Act on employment promotion and labour market institutions. 160 UP(77K) will be directed to training in line with the diagnosed needs and potential of UP and the diagnosed needs of the relevant local or regional labour market, including the identified needs of employers. The result of the training is obtaining qualifications or competences by UP. 576 UP(276K) will be directed to internships. The internships established under the project will last for a period of not less than 3 months and not longer than 6 months. 225 UP(108K) will receive one-off funds for starting a business, 70 UP(34K) will be directed to equipment./retrofitting workstations, 69 UP(33K) will receive a settlement voucher, 29 UP(14K) will be directed to intervention works. Inf.-prom. activities will be carried out on the premises of MUP throughout the project implementation period by posting information on the website, on posters and leaflets and by direct contact of employees with customers. The project meets horizontal criteria: 1. complies with the provisions of national and Union law as regards the manner of implementation and the scope of the project, 2. complies with the relevant Union rules: with a minimum standard for the implementation of the principle of equality between women and men, the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the principle of sustainable development. The project complies with: the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union of 26 October 2012, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, drawn up in New York on 13 December 2006, the Detailed Description of Priorities (SZOP) of the FEL 2021-2027 programme, the Guidelines for the implementation of projects involving ESF+ funds in regional programmes for 2021-2027, other Community policies and principles, market prices, and services and labour market instruments will be implemented in accordance with the provisions of the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions, strategic documents: national, regional, communes of Lublin, e.g. The project of the Social Policy Strategy of the Lublin Voivodeship for the years 2021-2030, the Development Strategy of the Lublin Voivodeship until 2030 and the Revitalization Program for Lublin for the years 2017-2023. The project is substantively coherent and contributes to the achievement of Objective 9.1 and Specific Objective 4a.

title: Professional activation of unemployed people aged 30 and over registered in the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin (VII)
description: The aim of the project is to increase employment opportunities for unemployed people aged 30 and over registered at the MUP in Lublin. The main result of the project will be employment by unemployed persons registered in the MUP in Lublin. The project will support unemployed people aged 30 and over, registered in the Lublin MUP, belonging to at least one of the following groups: people aged 50 years and over, long-term unemployed, people with disabilities, low-skilled people, women, farmers and members of their families, persons not belonging to any of these groups. The project is adapted to the formal requirements of the 2014-2020 ROP. The project meets the horizontal criteria: 1. complies with national legislation as regards the way in which the project is implemented and the scope of the project, 2. it shall comply with the relevant Union rules: the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the principle of equal opportunities for women and men, the concept of sustainable development. The project is in line with SZOOP ROP WL 2014-2020. The project is coherent in substance and contributes to the objectives of Priority 8i. The project is in line with market prices and the support will be carried out on the basis of the standards set out in the Act of 20 April 2004 on the promotion of employment and labour market institutions. The project complies with the Guidelines for the implementation of projects financed by the Labour Fund under operational programmes co-financed by the ESF for 2014-2020. The project is in line with other Community policies and principles. The project is in line with the strategy papers: national, regional, communes of Lublin, e.g. The project of the Social Policy Strategy of the Lublin Voivodeship for the years 2021-2030, the Strategy for the Development of the Lublin Voivodeship to 2030 and the Revitalisation Programme for Lublin for the years 2017-2023.

title: Activation of young people without a job in the district of Lublin (VI)
description: The aim of the project is to increase employment opportunities for young people under the age of 30 who are unemployed in the district of Lublin. The main result of the project will be to take up employment for at least 161 most vulnerable people (including immigrants, remigrants, people with disabilities, long-term unemployed, people with low qualifications) will take up work-98 people not eligible for the above group. In total, the project will cover 529 people (250 women, 279 men) under the age of 30, registered in the District Labour Office in Lublin as unemployed, who do not participate in education and training – so-called NEETs. According to the covert access of 133 people in debt. unemployment, 227 people with low qualifications and 5 people from part-time will be recruited to the project.For each participant of the project, individual and comprehensive professional and educational activation is foreseen, which will be based on individual and comprehensive assistance. Granting support under the project will each time be preceded by identification of the needs of the Project Participant and the development or updating of an Individual Action Plan. Next, according to the IPD, Project Participants will be directed to one of the forms of support available in the project:-internship271persons(192K, 79 M), the possibility of passing the internship period to 2022(60 persons)-Training 169persons(20K,149M)-one-off measures for setting up a gosp. 21 persons(8 K,13 M)-intervention work47 persons(22 K,25 M)-fitting/equipment of 21 persons(8 K,13M)The project complies with the principle of equal opportunities for women and men and with other relevant EU principles (including equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities and sustainable development). The expenditure is in line with the guidelines on eligibility of expenditure under the ERDF, ESF and CF 2014-2020 and is necessary to achieve the objectives of the project.

title: Inclusive labour market in the Lublin District III
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment of unemployed people over 30 years of age registered in the Poviat Labour Office in Lublin and in the branches of Bełżyce and Bychawo from the area of Lublin County, who are in a particularly difficult situation on the labour market (including older people after 50 years of age, women, disabled people, long-term unemployed and low-skilled) and to improve the employability of people leaving agriculture. A total of 472 unemployed persons will be supported under the project, including: — 221 women, – 139 long-term unemployed – 1 person with disabilities, – 15 people over 50 years old, – 312 low-skilled people, – 5 people intending to leave agriculture (a farmer or family member holding an individual farm up to 2 hectares of conversion). The project will include individual and comprehensive professional activation. Each of the project participants will be supported in the form of job mediation or professional counselling and the Individual Action Plan. Then, in line with the IPD assumptions, the project participant will be targeted at one of the available forms of support: — internships of 170 people, – vocational training 170 persons, – intervention work 62 people, – retrofitting/equipment of the workplace 70 people.

title: Comprehensive professional activation of unemployed people who are unemployed in the Lublin district (I)
description: The main objective of the project is to increase the employment of unemployed persons registered in the District Labour Office in Lublin and in Filia in Bełżyce and Bychawa, who are unemployed in the Lublin district, through comprehensive professional activation of unemployed persons (including subsidies for self-employment). In particular, by increasing, acquiring or reskilling competences/skills in line with the identified needs of employers. As at 31.12.2022, 2579 (1 315 K) unemployed persons were registered in PUP Lublin. The project will support 599(305M,294K) unemployed people in total, including: 90 persons long-term unemployed - 308 persons aged 18-29 -15 persons aged 55 and over -10 persons with disabilities -2 persons fleeing the territory of Ukraine in connection with the attack of the Russian Federation - 2 persons intending to leave agriculture Individual and comprehensive professional activation is provided for each participant of the project. Each participant will receive support in the form of job placements or career counselling. Granting support under the project will each time be preceded by identification of needs, in-depth analysis of skills, predispositions and professional problems by developing or updating an Individual Action Plan. Thanks to this analysis, the offer of assistance will be tailored in such a way that it responds to the real needs of a given project participant and in accordance with the assumptions of the IPD, participants will be directed to one of the forms of support available in the project: -traineeship of 248 persons, it was assumed that the traineeship implementation period could be extended to 2024. (approx. 43os) -training (223os) -one-off funds for starting a business (76os) -intervention work (33os) -fitting/equipment of a workplace (12 people) -settlement voucher (7os) The project complies with the principle of equal opportunities for women and men and with other relevant Union principles (including the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities and the principle of sustainable development), we ensure respect for fundamental rights and compliance with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union and the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. In accordance with the Position of the Lublin District Council of 30 March 2023 on protection against discrimination as set out in Article 21 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, the Position of the Lublin District Council of 31 May 2019 does not apply. The main objective of the project will therefore contribute to the specific objective of the project to improve access to employment and activation measures for all jobseekers, in particular young people, notably through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged groups in the labour market, as well as for inactive people, and by promoting self-employment. The applicant intends to conduct a wide-ranging promotional and information campaign about the implemented project and the forms of support offered under the project, with particular emphasis on the comprehensiveness and individualization of support through leaflets, posters, announcements, among others, at the headquarters of PUP Lublin and Branch in Bełżyce and Bychawa, on the website and on Facebook of PUP Lublin, in the Municipal Offices, in Social Assistance Centres located in the Lublin district, in the District Starosty in Lublin, in the socio-cultural bimonthly of municipalities and the Lublin district "Panorama of the District".

title: Inclusive labour market in the Lublin District IV
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employment of unemployed people over 30 years of age registered in the Poviat Labour Office in Lublin and in the branches of Bełżyce and Bychawo from the area of Lublin County, who are in a particularly difficult situation on the labour market (including older people after 50 years of age, women, disabled people, long-term unemployed and low-skilled) and to improve the employability of people leaving agriculture. A total of 341 unemployed people will be supported under the project, including: — 168 women, – 83 long-term unemployed, – 9 people with disabilities, – 36 people over 50 years of age, – 201 low-skilled people, – 12 people intending to leave agriculture (a farmer or family member holding an individual farm up to 2 hectares). The project will include individual and comprehensive professional activation. Each of the project participants will be supported in the form of job mediation or professional counselling and the Individual Action Plan. Then, in line with the IPD assumptions, the project participant will be targeted at one of the available forms of support: — internships 122 people, – vocational training 99 people, – intervention work 64 people, – equipment/equipment of the workplace 56 people.

title: Professional activation of unemployed persons aged 30 years and over registered in the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin (III)
description: The aim of the project is to increase the employability of unemployed persons aged 30 years and more registered in the Municipal Labour Office in Lublin.The main result of the project will be the employment of persons registered at the MUP in Lublin. The project will be supported by unemployed persons aged 30 years and over, registered at the MUP in Lublin qualified for the aid profile I (so-called active unemployed) or the aid profile II (so-called “requiring support”) belonging to one of the groups: people aged 50 and over, long-term unemployed, people with disabilities, low-skilled people, farmers and their family members.As part of the project, for each participant, the presentation of a specific offer of professional activation will be preceded by an analysis of the skills, predispositions and occupational problems of the participant. On this basis, the MUP in Lublin will implement appropriately selected services and instruments of the labour market referred to in the Act on the Promotion of Employment and Labour Market Institutions, i.e. drawing up an Individual Action Plan, Vocational Advice, Employment Intermediation, Training, Traineeship, Equipment/Equipment of a Job for the targeted unemployed. The project is adapted to the formal requirements of RPO WL 2014-2020. The project was adapted to the requirements of the Programme Guidelines for the Implementation System of ROP WL for the period 2014-2020. The project meets horizontal criteria: it shall comply with national and Union legislation and principles and shall be implemented in accordance with the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, the principle of equal opportunities between men and women and the concept of sustainable development. The project is compatible with the Detailed Description of Priority Axis RPO WL 2014-2020. The project is consistent in substance and contributes to achieving the objectives of Priority 8i.

title: Activation of the unemployed as an effective way to work carried out by the Rycki I district
description: The project aims to increase the employability of 173 unemployed people from the Ryki district to 30.06.2024. The main objective will be pursued through specific objectives: Enhancing access to employment for young people, in particular through the implementation of the Youth Guarantee, the long-term unemployed and disadvantaged people in the labour market (including people aged 55 and over, women, people with disabilities, the long-term unemployed and the low-skilled), improving the employability of people leaving agriculture, and promoting self-employment and the social economy. In view of the consequences caused by the invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation, assistance will also be directed to Ukrainian citizens. The PLO in Ryki will also provide the opportunity to benefit from support for people at risk of social exclusion who have ended their participation in social inclusion projects implemented under the European Funds for Lublin 2021-2027 programme under Priority VIII Increasing social cohesion. The provision of support under the project will be preceded by the identification of the needs of the OP (including, among others, by diagnosing training needs, professional development opportunities) and the development or update of an Individual Action Plan for each OP. All project participants will use the services of a career counsellor or a job broker, and then they will benefit from support in the form of a traineeship, glazing, one-off funds for starting a business, they will take up employment as part of equipping or retrofitting a workplace or a settlement voucher. An information and promotional poster will be placed at the project implementation site and all project documents will be logged in. The website ryki.praca.gov.pl will contain a description of the project and announcements about calls for proposals under the project. Entities and persons participating in the project will be given verbal information on the possibility of obtaining support. The key outcome of the project will be: - taking up employment (including subsidies for self-employment) by project participants, at least 30%, i.e. 52 people, - allocating a minimum of 23% of the financial resources planned in the project to support young people, i.e. an average of PLN 799502,00 for 105 people. In the case of support for people aged 18-29, the participation of such a person in the ESF+ project will be preceded by an assessment of digital skills necessary to work in the green economy sector by means of surveys recommended by the DRP, and if necessary, the PLO will direct UP to training, which will result in supplementing digital competences. The project is planning a training in support of the green transition, which is aimed at raising and adapting skills and obtaining qualifications of the unemployed to ecological requirements. Retraining will help UP start a new career in fast-growing green sectors.

title: Purchase of zero-emission, electricity-powered rolling stock for passenger transport in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship
description: The aim of the project is to develop and improve sustainable transport at regional and local level, including: - improving the quality of services provided in public transport, - improving the accessibility of means of rail transport for people with disabilities - reducing the negative impact on the environment by adapting the impact of rail on the environment to the level required by regulations - reducing certain nuisances related to railway infrastructure, e.g. noise - improving communication links - increasing the cohesion of the region's transport system - increasing the reliability of rail transport - improving the accessibility of peripheral regions to rail connections with a constant increase in the number of inhabitants - ensuring an efficient, fast and comfortable way of movement. The project includes the delivery of: a) 3 new four-section electric rail vehicles with training on operation and maintenance b) 3 new five-section electric rail vehicles with training on operation and maintenance. PROBLEMS AND NEEDS SUPPORTING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT Regional passenger rail transport in the Podkarpackie voivodship has been losing its importance in favour of road transport since 1990. This is conditioned, among others, by the different transport accessibility of the village to existing railway lines and competition in the form of bus transport. A negative phenomenon in the rail transport system is the lack of stability, continuity in the timetable of trains and poor transport offer, which further discourages potential passengers from this mode of transport. In some relationships, it is noted that vehicles are no longer comfortable and safe enough due to their capacity limitations. In particular, the problem concerns connections on line 91. The project will have a direct impact on solving the problems of the Applicant and the Operator in the field of passenger rail transport. Indirectly, it will affect the inhabitants of the voivodship and other people moving through its territory, various institutions, economic entities (including enterprises) and non-governmental organizations that use public (rail) transport in their activities. For this group of beneficiaries, a number of problems can be identified. Firstly, the passenger transport services provided in the province are characterised by a relatively average level of transport accessibility. This state of affairs mainly consists of the Operator's inefficient and outdated rolling stock, through which passenger transport is carried out in the province. This rolling stock was produced in the 1970s and 1980s. 20th century and does not have air conditioning and ticket machines. This is due to inadequate adaptation of public transport to the reported needs and too long journey times. Thus, tourists and residents of the voivodeship have problems with efficient and comfortable movement on its territory. The result is a low level of competitiveness and unfavourable perception of rail transport in the province. The transport needs of the inhabitants of the Podkarpackie voivodship result not only from the current needs of everyday life of the inhabitants (i.e. the need to commute to workplaces, schools, etc.), but also from the recreational, leisure and tourist function performed by the voivodship. There is therefore a need to provide residents and tourists with comfortable access to both agglomerations and rural areas. In addition to the needs in terms of directions of travel by rail, there are growing needs among passengers in terms of travel comfort, safety or accessibility of rolling stock for all people, including people with special needs. The justification for the need to implement the project is described in detail in points 1.1 and 1.2 of the study.

title: Construction of the Transshipment Terminal of PKP LHS sp. z o.o. at Wola Baranowska LHS station together with the infrastructure necessary for the implementation of the project
description: The main objective of the project is to increase the flow of mass goods handling from Russia and Ukraine to Poland, as well as export of goods from seaports to Ukraine and Russia while maintaining sustainable development, by improving transport with centres of major cities in neighbouring voivodships, investment areas, existing economic infrastructure. The aim of the project is to strengthen and effectively use the region’s economic and social potentials for sustainable and intelligent development of the region. The goal will be achieved thanks to the expansion of the existing Wola Baranowska LHS railway station. The investment will contribute to the development of intermodal freight transport. The location of the transhipment terminal will enable the development of both adhesive and road transport in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship. The construction of a transhipment terminal will contribute to the development and improvement of environmentally friendly, noise-reduced and low-emission transport systems by creating multimodal connections that will transfer part of the transport of goods by road to rail. The investment consists of the construction of a transhipment terminal along with the infrastructure necessary for the implementation of the project. As part of the project, equipment used only for the provision of transport/transhipment services will be purchased. The following work has been planned under this project: construction of a 40 615 m² transhipment and storage site, construction of an access road with an area of 5 349 m²; reconstruction of the track system of Wola Baranowska station: construction of side track No. 13 clearance 1 520 mm; construction of side track No 202 clearance 1 435 mm; track installation No 223 ‘N’; construction of side track “S” No 121. The purchase of equipment such as: O container handling device – Reach stacker; forklift with a lifting capacity of 2.5 t; equipment for transhipment of goods; the wheel loader.

title: Extension/rebuilding of the regional road No 885 Przemysl - Hermanowice - State Border in km 3+642 - 10+257
description: One of the basic challenges in the project’s area of impact is an underdeveloped road infrastructure and insufficient quantity and low quality of transportation connections. The condition of technical infrastructure hinders contacts and cross-border traffic, and as a result reduces the attractiveness of the region for investors and impedes development processes. Fulfilment of this process is a response to the indicated problems. Its main purpose is supporting cross-border development processes in the borderland of Poland and Ukraine through an increase of transport accessibility of the region and an improvement of the road infrastructure. Achieving the indicated target will be possible by increasing technical parameters of a 6.615 km section of national road no. 885 Przemyśl – Hermanowice – state boarder, as well as an increase of communication accessibility for the designed border crossing Malhowice-Niżankowice. The development of the project will result in a 10% passage time decrease. It will also result in an increase of accessibility of the Podkarpackie Voivodeship for Western Ukraine. An effect of the development will be a creation of a new road connection between the countries, an alternative for the existing Przemyśl-Medyka-Lviv connection. It will result in an increase of international traffic mobility, both borderland and transit. It will have an influence on forming new foundations for Polish-Ukrainian cooperation, the development of tourism and trade. This project will be developed in a close partnership between the Podkarpackie Regional Road Management and Lviv Regional State Administration. Due to engagement of both sides in the project, an exchange of mutual practices, know-how and knowledge will be possible. It will affect a more effective implementation of the project and acquiring information and experiences which will be useful in the implementation of consecutive investments, both by the Polish and Ukrainian.

title: Ecological maintenance-free water aeration systems
description: The project consists of the introduction of an ecological, maintenance-free aeration system based on the technology of small-size wind turbines. The product is directed mainly to fish pond owners. This solution makes it possible to reduce the mortality of fish due to the effect of the so-called phantom (low oxygen level in water), which on average in the winter is responsible for the death of 23.9 % of farms. In the case of large farms, this translates into huge losses, which causes breeders to invest in conventional aeration technologies (electrical or combustion systems). However, their maintenance can be problematic and costly. Often, service costs are so high that customers are interested in using an alternative solution over time. The technological advantage of the product is mainly due to the fact that it is independent of conventional energy sources. It is a maintenance-free system that, unlike standard solutions, does not require interference with its operation. It is also a technologically advanced product that has new solutions to ensure safety and maximise efficiency. The planned product is innovative at least at national level and beyond national level (sources: recommendation of the KPT, verification in databases: Esp@cenet, Depatisnet, Patentscope, FO3D9/1). In addition, the product has development potential, it is possible to extend its use in other industries: transport of water and gases; desalination of sea water; supplying industrial plants with compressed air, etc. Basic actions/resources to implement the project: 1.Creation of machine park 2.Preparation of product sales network 3.Producing new products from the industry of ecological systems for industrial and agricultural applications, e.g. systems for accumulation of wind energy in the form of compressed air. The place of implementation of the Podkarpackie voivodship.

title: Development of residential care services in the Municipality of Świlcza
description: The main objective of the project is to increase the availability of social services (care services in the form of residential day care in the Daily Help House in Bratkowice from 01.01.2024) for the residents of the Świlcza commune (from 01.10.2023 to 31.12.2025). DDP - and in the Senior Club in Trzcian from 01.10.2023 - hereinafter: KS) for 80 people in need of support in everyday functioning, who due to age or health condition or disability require care or support due to the inability to independently perform at least one of the basic activities of everyday life, and consequently improve their quality and comfort of life. - provision of care services in the form of day care in DDP (for 40 people) and in KS (for 40 people) - retrofitting GOPS in Świlcza with devices supporting the provision of care services in DDP and in KS (equipment purchased under the project due to the increase in the number of places) Target group: 1. people in need of support in everyday functioning (hereinafter referred to as: Project Participants; UP)-80 people, i.e. persons who, on the day of submitting the recruitment form for the project: - have reached the age of 60 - due to age or health condition or disability require care or support due to the inability to independently perform at least one of the basic activities of everyday life - live within the meaning of the Civil Code, in the municipality of Świlcza (Podkarpackie Voivodeship) 2. persons planned to be covered by support,reveal the following characteristics: -Personal: Adverse health and/or disability - environmental: lack/limited formal care and/or loneliness, and consequently the lack of family members who can provide care services, the need to engage in activities as part of social activity - property: low income (survivors of pensions) 3. barriers: financial barrier - applies to UP - low pension/pension, which does not allow for the purchase of care services 4th need: Residents expect to improve the availability and quality of care services (available to the public) that directly increase their quality of life. - running and subsequent development of the activities of the Senior Club in Trzcian: implementation of care services for 25 people and extension of the number of places provided by 15 - running and subsequent development of the activity of the Daily Help House in Bratkowice: implementation of care services for 30 people and extension of the number of places provided by 10 For all tasks, and consequently for UP, the same scope of support was provided throughout the project, including stationary care services, activities/additional events affecting the quality and comfort of life, transport, food, and others. Main results: - the number of persons covered by the services provided in the local community in the programme: 80 - Number of supported public administration entities or public services at national, regional or local level: 1 - number of hours of group classes (artistic - art therapy, choreotherapy, theatre, music, painting, movement support, make-up, with a psychologist) carried out as part of the project: 2688 - number of completed trips/integration attractions (in the form of a trip) within the project: 8 - number of events in the form of a trip (alternatively: cinema, theatre, philharmonic) within the project: 42 - number of people in need of support in everyday functioning, who have improved the quality and comfort of life as a result of participating in the project: 48 The project fits directly into the specific objective of the FEP 2021-2027 regional programme, by increasing equal access to good quality, sustainable and affordable services that support access to care-centred care in the conducted and extended (by the number of places) entities, which are: DDP and KS

title: Purchase of rescue cars, trailers and drones for the purpose of conducting rescue operations by the Regional Group of the Mountain Voluntary Rescue Group Bieszczadzka Group
description: The project includes the task of equipping the rescue system unit with high-quality equipment to ensure the protection of health and human life, which in the planning documents of the Podkarpackie Voivodeship (WP) is one of the directions of action to counteract, minimize and remove threats. The subject of the project is the purchase of two rescue cars, a trailer and drones for the purpose of conducting rescue operations by the Bieszczady Group GOPR - an entity that has obtained the consent of the minister competent for internal affairs for the implementation of mountain rescue Decision No 40/2013 of 30.12.2013 and has an entry in the register of units cooperating with the State Medical Rescue system. According to Annex 14 to this proposal, poor equipment in operational cars and unmanned aerial vehicles, in particular for mountain rescue activities, is a significant barrier to the development of a safety system in the HR. The current state of equipment of the group with operational technical means and means of transport achieved through many years of efforts and obtaining funds from many sources does not sufficiently cover the actual demand resulting from the implementation of the tasks imposed by the regulations. Despite the fact that the group is regularly equipped with the necessary equipment, it is still equipped with outdated vehicles in the group of off-road vehicles, as well as four-wheel vehicles or unmanned aerial vehicles. The Bieszczadzka Group has only one vehicle adapted to the safe transport of people injured in accidents. Average age of the unit’s vehicles (including vehicles of the type: Quad) is 9 years old. The intensity of use and the use of vehicles and equipment in extreme conditions, with a very high risk, causes that their consumption is much higher than under normal conditions of use. Therefore, most of the equipment wears out much faster, without reaching the assumed operating periods. As a result of the insufficient number of newly purchased vehicles or drones, there is no full replacement, especially those intended for withdrawal. This reduces the efficiency of the equipment and increases the expenditure of funds for their further maintenance in technical efficiency and rescue readiness. Poor equipment of the unit responsible for undertaking mountain rescue activities reduces the broadly rumored level of safety, i.e. the safety of people staying in the mountains, including residents of the Podkarpackie Voivodeship, and safety in terms of management conditions. As a result, the competitiveness of the voivodeship is reduced, and the living conditions of residents are not satisfactory. Insufficient protection of the inhabitants of the Podkarpackie Voivodeship in terms of the potential to undertake, among others, mountain rescue activities, is a current problem that results from: a significant risk associated with the occurrence of events resulting in human actions or forces of nature, poor equipment of the GOPR of the Bieszczady Group, worn-out operating cars and technical equipment (drones), a shortage of cars adapted to the safe transport of injured persons. This situation results in: low level of security in terms of the above-mentioned risks. Meeting the needs of local communities and tourists resting here, in terms of improving the rescue system, civil protection and the sense of security among citizens, which, based on modernized technical facilities, which will be used mainly for mountain rescue, will increase the effectiveness of response to existing threats and was considered crucial, and strongly dependent on the implementation of the proposed project. The aim of the project is to improve the state of preparation of the Regional Group of the GOPR to take rescue actions in situations of threats resulting from the occurrence of events that result in human actions or forces of nature.

title: Modern school - satisfied students.
description: The aim of the project is to improve the quality of general education in the First High School and King Władysław Jagiełło in Dębica in the Podkarpackie Province, which is in line with specific objective 4(f) (ESF+) of the FEP 2021-2027, i.e. supporting equal access to quality education and training. The project will implement a comprehensive development program aimed at improving the quality of education. Actions are planned to support pupils in acquiring and developing key competences, psychological and pedagogical support for pupils, improving the competences of pedagogical staff and equipping subject workshops. The intervention will take into account the diverse needs of pupils, in line with their individual or special educational needs. Support will be provided to, among others, materially disadvantaged students, students with disabilities, students at risk of social exclusion, students from rural areas, students with insufficient grades in subjects covered by additional classes, students with a low average grades in subjects covered by additional classes, students with emotional problems, in need of psychological and pedagogical support and pedagogical therapy, and students with special educational needs. The main goal of the project results from the diagnosed problems and needs of the participants and aims to minimize them by implementing such support as: improving students' competences through additional classes, improving teachers' competences and qualifications, equipping the studio, study visits for students, involving parents in the school's activities by organizing workshops on addictions and potential threats in the virtual world. The target group of the project will be students of ILO in Dębica, teachers of ILO in Dębica, parents of children attending ILO in Dębica. Main tasks of the project: Additional classes and workshops for students. Improving the competences and qualifications of teachers. Retrofitting of subject studios. Study visits for students. Workshops for parents. Psychological and pedagogical support for pupils. The main results to be achieved will be: Upgrading the competences of 540 students, Upgrading the qualifications and competences of 80 teachers, Retrofitting 17 subject workshops Implementation of the project ensured compliance with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union (Journal of Laws No. Ooh, ooh, ooh. EU C 326, 26.10.2012, p. 391), by actions such as: human dignity and freedom, equality of all citizens before the law, solidarity, civil rights and the right to impartial justice, as well as the fundamental rights of the third generation, necessary in the modern world. Journal of Laws 2012, item 1169, as amended), which guarantees access to public offices, participation in elections and the use of public utilities, gives the right to free use of means of transport and movement, as well as the guarantee of full access to information and the possibility of interpersonal communication. During the entire project implementation period, the applicant will run a project office in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship, i.e. in the building of the I LO Dębica school, ul. Słowackiego, 39-200 Dębica with the possibility of providing full documentation of the implemented project. The office will provide project participants and people interested in participating in the project with the opportunity to contact the project staff in person and obtain, from a person employed in the project office, full information about the project, in particular about the recruitment rules and forms of support offered to participants. The office will be open for at least 20 hours a week, during the entire project implementation period, at fixed hours, i.e. from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. The location, architecture and organization of the office, as well as the way of sharing information about the project will implement the principle of availability in accordance with the Guidelines.

title: Extension of provincial road No 651 on the Dubeninki – provincial border section
description: The project concerns the extension of provincial road No 651 on the section Dubeninki – provincial border (from km 20+160 to 39+460). This section is located in the Warmińsko-Mazurskie Province, in the Gołdap district, in the municipality of Dubeninki. The length of the section to be extended is about 19.3 km. The main objective of the project is to improve road safety and adapt the road to the parameters of road traffic. G. As part of the planned extension of the road, the following tasks are planned: 1.
