Construction work (including demolition, land exchange): -the felling of trees in conflict with the extension and endangering the safety of road users -bringing the road to class G road parameters; -reinforcement of the surface to a load-bearing capacity of 11,5 t/axle; -correction of horizontal and vertical curves; -any necessary conversion/construction of street lighting, drainage (with pre-treatment devices, reconstruction of existing watercourses/railways) and other conflicting technical infrastructure equipment (sanitary sewerage, water supply network) -reconstruction of existing energy infrastructure (medium and low voltage); -reconstruction of existing teletechnical infrastructure. -reconstruction/construction of engineering structures (passes, bridges with environmental protection devices, improving animal migration conditions); -development of green areas and installation of green areas within the boundaries of the designed road lane; -improving traffic safety at intersections (reconstruction with geometry correction); -construction of new and redevelopment of existing bus bays, pavements (pedestrian, bicycle and pedestrian-cycling trains on road sections passing through built-up areas), vaults of a parking bay; -construction of new and reconstruction of existing pedestrian crossings; -construction of new and reconstruction of existing individual and public conventions in the area. - road safety equipment (road safety barriers, horizontal and vertical markings. 2. Acquisition of property 3. External services - preparation of project documentation 4. Author's supervision 5. Investment supervision/management - Contract Engineer 6. Feasibility study 7. Promotion Total cost: PLN 233 837 561.48, planned co-financing: PLN 187 045 552.08. The section of road in question does not ensure safety conditions for both individual users and users of collective transport. They are not adapted to the needs of traffic, especially heavy goods vehicles. The road does not have the required load capacity. DW 651 is an element of the northern communes of the Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship. The extension is necessary in order to eliminate the transport exclusion of the northern areas of the province and to connect to the road network of the Podlaskie province (to the TEN-T network (DK16,S-61). The project improves the route towards the TEN-T network, using the potential of completed and complementary road investments. It ensures greater economic, social and territorial cohesion in the region. It improves the quality of life of residents, improves their safety and counteracts the negative impact of transport on climate change and the environment. The project is socially awaited. The project was included in the Transport Plan of the Warmińsko-Mazurskie Voivodeship until 2030 (with a perspective until 2050), as an action important for achieving strategic and specific objectives in the field of functioning and development of the region's transport system. The project implements the specific objective of Action FEWM.04.01 Infrastructure for regional mobility and security: ERDF/CF.CP3.II Developing and improving sustainable, climate-resilient, smart and intermodal mobility at national, regional and local level, including improving access to TEN-T and cross-border mobility. Results of the project (2028): Save time with improved infr.: 34 303.98 person-days/year, annual number of users of newly built/developed roads 16 047 096.26 passenger-kilometre/year.

title: Extension of provincial road No. 651 on the section Gołdap - Dubeninki
description: The project concerns the extension of the provincial road No. 651 on the section Gołdap - Dubeninki - from km 1+934 to km 20+160 (stage II). Location of the project: Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship, Gołdapski District, Gołdap Municipality and Dubeninki Municipality. Length of the section to be extended: 18.2 km. The main objective of the project is to improve road safety and adapt the road to the parameters of road traffic. G. As part of the planned extension of the road, the following tasks are planned: 1. Construction work (including demolition, reinforcement, construction, assembly works) comprising: - felling of trees interfering with the expansion and endangering the safety of road users - bringing the road to class G road parameters (providing passability for non-standard vehicles; - strengthening the surface to a load-bearing capacity of 11.5 t/axle (using a "quiet surface" on sections where residential buildings are present; - correction of horizontal and vertical curves; - all necessary reconstructions/constructions of street lighting along with power supply, drainage (with pre-treatment device, reconstruction of existing watercourses) and other conflicting technical infrastructure equipment (sanitary sewerage, water supply network) - reconstruction of existing energy infrastructure (medium and low voltage); Reconstruction of existing telecommunications infrastructure. - reconstruction/construction of engineering structures (viaduct, culverts and bridge with their adaptation to perform the function of passages for small animals); - development of green areas and installation of green areas within the limits of the designed road lane; - execution of a position for weighing vehicles together with the place of vehicle service in accordance with the guidelines of the Provincial Road Transport Inspectorate in Olsztyn; - improving traffic safety at intersections (reconstruction with geometry correction); - construction of new and reconstruction of existing bus bays, pavements, cycle paths and parking spaces - construction of new and reconstruction of existing pedestrian crossings; - construction of new and reconstruction of existing individual and public conventions in the area. - Road safety equipment (road safety barriers, horizontal and vertical markings. 2. Acquisition of property 3. External services - preparation of project documentation 4. Author's supervision 5. Investment supervision/management - Contract Engineer 6. Feasibility study 7. Promotion Total cost: PLN 240 290 694.52, planned co-financing: PLN 182 747 849.61. The section of road in question does not ensure safety conditions for both individual users and users of collective transport. They are not adapted to the needs of traffic, especially heavy goods vehicles. The road does not have the required load capacity. The project enables a functional connection of the TEN-T network with local and regional infrastructure in the northern part of the Warmińsko-Mazurskie voivodship. It eliminates the transport exclusion of the northern areas of the voivodship and serves to strengthen connections with the TEN-T road network, i.e. DK 16 and S-61 in Podlaskie Voivodeship. The project was included in the Transport Plan of the Warmińsko-Mazurskie Voivodeship until 2030 (with a perspective until 2050), as an action important for achieving strategic and specific objectives in the field of functioning and development of the region's transport system. The project implements the specific objective of Action FEWM.04.01 Infrastructure for regional mobility and security: ERDF/CF.CP3.II Developing and improving sustainable, climate-resilient, smart and intermodal mobility at national, regional and local level, including improving access to TEN-T and cross-border mobility. Results of the project (2028): Save time with improved infr.: 49 653.53 person-days/year, annual number of users of newly built/developed roads 19 679 295.10 passenger-kilometre/year.

title: Development of the smart electricity grid at the Białystok Branch of PGE Dystrybucja S.A – II
description: The subject of the project is the development of an intelligent power grid at the Białystok Branch of PGE Dystrybucja S.A. The project includes • Task 1 Modernization of the Ełk2-Olecko line. • Task 2 Modernisation of 110/15 kV Łapy+2 transformers (replacement of 16 MVA to 25 MVA). • Task 3 Modernization of 110/15kV RPZ 9 Białystok+2 transformers (replacement of 16 MVA to 25 MVA). • Task 4 Modernization of 110/15 kV Siemiatycze station. • Task 5 Modernisation of 110/15kV RPZ 5 Białystok+2 transformers (exchange of 25 MVA to 31.5 MVA). • Task 6 Modernization of 110/15 kV Zambrów station. • Activity 7 Indirect costs. All tasks are included in the document entitled ‘LIST OF INDICATIVE FEPW PROJECTS’, which was established as a result of consultations with the Podlaskie and Warmińsko-Mazurskie Provincial Governments. These tasks are part of the "Podlaskie Development Strategy 2030" and the document entitled "Warmińsko-Mazurskie 2030 Strategy for Socio-economic Development". The list of projects in the field of development of smart electricity grids in the European Funds for Eastern Poland 2021-2027 Programme was subject to ongoing update in consultation with voivodship governments. All tasks have building permits. The project is an independent unit of analysis and includes all investment tasks necessary to ensure the functionality and operability of the infrastructure immediately after the completion of the material scope. The project responds to the needs of rational energy management through the development of smart electricity grids (distribution systems) of the smart grid type, in order to increase the possibilities of RES connection, the development of zero-emission transport, as well as to ensure the stability of energy supply to customers. The Applicant, Investor and Beneficiary of the project is PGE Dystrybucja S.A. (hereinafter referred to as PGE) as the Distribution System Operator within the meaning of Art. 25 of the Energy Law Act of 10 April 1997, distributing electricity, Dz. Journal of Laws 2022, item 1385 I.e.). The applicant has adequate technical and human resources to implement the project and experience in implementing projects co-financed by the EU in the field of energy investments. The project will implement the following functionalities of the intelligent electricity distribution network, supporting the development of RES or electrification of transport: - functionality of monitoring and visualization of load in real time, - functionality of active and reactive power flow control (including control of distributed sources and reactive power compensators), - functionality of automatic control of voltage level and reactive power level on the bus, - functionality of real-time load measurement along with visualization. Yes - The project contributes to the development of electromobility, as the implementation of the project serves to provide power for the electrification of railway lines. The list of projects under the National Railway Programme until 2030 includes projects whose route runs through the towns where the project's products are located. In addition, the implementation of the project will allow the development of electric public transport in the provincial city - Białystok and in the city of Ełk, in which they are beneficiaries of Measure 3.1. Sustainable urban mobility - more broadly, the section "Additional information". The project contributes to the development of entrepreneurship - more broadly, the section "Additional information". It is planned, among others, to design, execute, deliver and assemble 6 information and memorial boards and cost-free forms of promotion, i.e. on the Applicant's website and mark the documentation related to the project.

title: IPASZ – programme of social and professional activation of participants in OCTs
description: The aim of the project is to increase the level of social and professional activation of 80 participants of WTZ Wojnicy w Dołubowie and WTZ Kolektyw w Raciborach Starych (39K and 41M) in the period 01/04/2025 – 31/03/2027. Specific objectives: a) Increasing the level of social activation of OCT participants b) Increasing the level of professional activation of OCT participants c) Increasing the chances on the labour market of OCT participants. For over 15 years we have been working in the villages (Siemiatic and high school districts), leading WTZ Collective and Warriors. In the area of our activities, there is practically no support for people with disabilities outside the OTSC (no access to specialists, no offer of leisure time for people with disabilities), there are no vacancies on the protected labour market and there is a low level of cooperation between reintegration entities and employers on the open labour market. Another barrier is the minimum level or rather the lack of public transport (we have to get everywhere by rented transport). Participants of our WTZów are a group of inhabitants of the Podlaskie voivodship diverse in terms of age, opportunities, degree of disability. They share a low level of social and professional competence and a low level of ability to cope with anxiety and uncertainty. They require reinforcement in terms of motivation to take action, faith in their abilities and a sense of being needed and important. They need support in expressing their opinions and shaping habits of taking care of their health. 87% of the participants of both WTZs are residents of villages excluded from access to high culture. The solution to the above-mentioned problems will be to provide comprehensive support to 80 project participants, which will be provided to them for a period of max. 23 months, based on a reintegration path, created individually for each person expressed in the form of IPASZ (Individual Social and Occupational Activity Plan). The basis of IPASZ will be the diagnosis of the problem situation of project participants, their resources, potential, predispositions and needs. IPASZ will be a living document that will be evaluated in accordance with the ongoing support provided to participants in the project. As part of the project, activities will be carried out such as: social contact contracts, individual and group psychological counselling (660h) and professional counselling (560h), social skills training (160h), health education classes (108 workshops and 80h consultations) and physical improvement (324h), trips to high culture places for 80 people, study visits up to 2 ZAZs for 80 people, professional training (barista's helper, waiter and professional cleaning) for 60 people, internal practices in mini cafes for 80 people, external practices in accordance with the profile of vocational training for 40 people, consultations with a specialist for participants requiring support under alternative forms of communication, permanent support of the work coach. Thanks to the project activities, participants of WTZ will be assigned a realistic path of transition to ZAZ or to the open labour market in accordance with our local conditions. The results of the project will be: - increase in social activation of OCT participants by reducing mental barriers and strengthening social competences - increase in professional activation of pupils. OTSC thanks to the organization of professional support, training and apprenticeships - an increase in opportunities on the student's labour market. The effect of the actions will be to eliminate stereotypes of OZN as a passive person, a recipient of aid, unable to work, eliminating social and professional exclusion of OZN especially from rural areas, building a network of economic entities supporting the professional activation of OZN Collectives and Warriors participants on the open labour market. The implementation of the activities will be based on the Standards of functioning of WTZów, in which the WTZ Collective and Warriors took part in the pilot.

title: PROFESSIONAL STAFF OF PODLASIA - support for the development of qualifications of residents of the Białystok subregion.
description: OBJECTIVE: by 30.06.2027 min. 2418 people (1282K, 1136M) out of 3100 adults (1643K, 1457M), on their own initiative interested in improving their skills or acquiring qualifications/competences, living in the Bialystok subregion in the Podlaskie voivodship PODNIESIE YOUR SKILLS/COMPETENTIONS/QUALIFICATIONS MAIN RESULTS: L-ba os having obtained a qualification after leaving the programme – 2418 os L-ba os having obtained a formal qualification attested by a body authorised to certify – 1151 os TARGET GROUP: min 3100 adult wasps (1643K, 1457M) living in the Bialystok subregion [SB] in the Podlaskie voivodship, on their own initiative interested in improving their skills or acquiring qualifications/competences, including: – 156 pers: 117K, 39M (i.e. 5% GD) are long-term care workers and Ukrainian citizens who found employment in the Podlaskie Voivodship after leaving their homeland in connection with the outbreak of armed conflict in Ukraine – 156 people: 83K, 73M (i.e. 5% GD) is a low-skilled wasp – 621 wasps: 330K, 291M (i.e. 20% GD) is a wasp aged 50 years and over (50+) – 621 wasps (i.e. 20% GD) are inactive women 1. ADDITIONAL SUPPORT – provided on a case-by-case basis (average 3 hours/person) by professional advisers for at least: – building motivation to develop skills or acquire qualifications, including competences – support in the analysis of development needs, including through the use of the Competence Balance model and, where development needs for digital skills are identified, the European Digital Competence Assessment Tool – support in the selection of appropriate development services in the BUR – identification of acquired skills/competences and support in their validation and certification, including encouraging the creation of a ‘My Portfolio’ or Europass 2 account. The project will finance development services, including digital and ecological competences for adults. Services will be provided in the form of trainings, courses or postgraduate studies ANALYSIS AND GD SELECTION CARRIED OUT BY: – Report on the state of voivodships for 2022 (Department for Regional Development, Marshal’s Office of the Podlaskie Voivodeship, Białystok 2023) – Information on the situation on the local labour market: * in 2022, * in the first half of 2023 (PUP Białystok, 2023) – Białystok helps Ukraine (UM Białystok, 03/2023) – Life situation and economics of migrants from Ukraine (...) (NBP, 2023) – data for the Podlaskie voivodship – NSP 2021 [BDL, CSO as at 01/2023) – Yearbook of statisticians of the Podlaskie voivodship (Białystok 2022) – OWN ADN RESEARCH: * ULICZNA ANKIETA (25.09 – 12.10.2023) IN BIAŁYMSTOKU AND IN EACH COMMUNITY IN BIAŁOSTOCKI AREA (in the vicinity of Municipal Offices, PUPs, OPS, banks, ZOZów, shops, churches, public transport, NGOs, nurseries, kindergartens, institutions: support for refugees from Ukraine and long-term care) * 15 QUESTIONS: filtering: o age, place of residence, education, disability, status on the labour market, refugee status from Ukraine, place of work, participation in lifelong learning, needs, expectations, barriers * REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SOCIAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY (structure according to SB statistics, taking into account project assumptions, random-amount selection) * ANALYSIS 1075 ANKIET [1075 pers. after 18 years of age: 715 from Białystok, 360 from Białystok county, 569 K (including 253 K inactive), 506M, 463 people 50+ (265 K, 198 M), 632 people with low qualifications (328K, 304M), 105 OzN, 49 refugees from Ukraine (36K, 13M), 83 long-term care workers (69K, 14M) On the basis of the above, needs and expectations as well as barriers to participation in the project concerning a potential GD were identified, problems were identified and support adequate to the identified problems and needs of GD was planned. The number of GD was estimated at a realistic level to be achieved, based on the results of the above survey and the indicator assumed in the FEdP 2021-2027, and the structure of GD - in accordance with the structure of the inhabitants of the Białystok subregion.

title: Improving the energy efficiency of the US building in Szczytno, Szczytno, ul. The Warsaw 5.
description: The project aims to improve the energy efficiency of the building of the Tax Office in Szczytno, ul.Warszawska 5. In addition, the project aims to reduce the amount of energy used to warm the building, the cost of energy consumption and the emission of harmful gases into the atmosphere. Both economic, environmental and financial effects can be achieved by reducing the demand for final and/or primary energy. By Decision No 38/2015 of 6 February 2015, the Warmińsko-Mazurski Provincial Conservator of Monuments ruled that a building located in Szczytno at ul. Warsaw District 5 (former Starosty building in Szczytno) to the register of monuments of the Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship. On 16 May 2023, the Provincial Office for the Protection of Monuments in Olsztyn, by letter No IZNR.5183.188.2023.Is issued conservation recommendations specifying the method of using the monument, the scope of permissible changes that may be introduced and relevant conservation recommendations for planned renovation works. The building was built in 1885. The technical condition of the building is not satisfactory: External walls, foundations, ceilings according to the audit do not meet the WT2021 standards.The central heating system is heavily worn out. The thermomodernisation measures will be followed by a reduction in energy demand and a reduction in emissions of harmful substances into the atmosphere: -for final energy for the building [kWh/year] 124.113,90 , percentage reduction of 45,2 -for non-renewable primary energy for the building [kWh/year] 189.258,10, percentage reduction of 45,90 -CO2 emissions/year [MgCO2/year] 52,80 , percentage reduction of 46,10. Ultimately, the project will contribute to the reduction of emissions of harmful pollutants into the atmosphere and thus to the achievement of the policy objective CP2 set for the Cohesion Fund in the SZOP of the FENIKS Programme 2021-2027: The project is consistent with the “Basic Conditions” set out in Chapter 4 of the FEnIKS Programme, relevant strategies and planning document established to fulfil this enabling condition. The project was divided into 5 tasks: 1.Development of techn documentation. 2.Thermal modernization works resulting from the energy audit 3.Supervision of conducted construction works 4.Promotion of the project 5.Indirect costs. The implementation of the project started on 04.10.2023, part of the technical documentation for the project has already been completed (among others, energy audit, feasibility study, ornithological inventory) and the necessary permits, recommendations and consents of the relevant institutions have been requested. The real objectives of the project are affected by the achievement of the planned indicators: output and result described in detail in the "Project indicators" section of the proposal. The indicators planned to be achieved reflect the project objectives, are relevant to the material scope and to the financial outlays. The project was prepared in accordance with the law on environmental protection. On the basis of the State aid test carried out, it was found that the project does not meet all the conditions, so there is no State aid. The project is financially, institutionally and legally feasible.The applicant is not excluded from applying for funding, has the necessary resources and financial mechanisms to cover the costs of operating and maintaining the project. The project is in line with horizontal policies. The project envisages the use of educational elements in the field of raising environmental awareness of the society (e.g. SW, ch. 2.2, point 2) The project is implemented in the strategic intervention area (SIA) indicated in the NSRF 2030 (e.g. SW, ch. 2.2, point 6.7) It is planned to raise the awareness of building occupants of the planned energy savings (ex-audit, in particular. SW chapter 2.4, paragraph.7) The application file is complete, the information contained in the WoD is consistent with its annexes.

title: Comprehensive water supply for Nowe Miasto Lubawskie Commune with construction of water treatment station in Mszanów
description: The subject of this project is the reconstruction and construction of the Water Treatment Station in Mszanowo along with the necessary infrastructure and installation of a photovoltaic installation. The investment will be located on plots No. 1046/9 and 1046/10 at 2 Parkowa Street in Mszanowo, Nowe Miasto Lubawskie Commune, Nowy Miasto District, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship. Land register No EL1N/00021777/2 is kept for plot No 1046/9 and land register No EL1N/00033745/6 for plot No 1046/10. Currently, in the town of Mszanowo, there is only a station that has only a water intake without the possibility of treatment, therefore it is necessary to build a modern facility in the form of a Water Treatment Station equipped with water treatment devices for raw materials, including removing iron and manganese. The main objective of the project is to improve the quality of the system of collective supply of drinking water in the Nowe Miasto Lubawskie Commune. The project also includes milestones such as: -supplying residents with clean drinking water with appropriate chemical composition and physical properties through the construction and reconstruction of the Water Treatment Station, -ensuring uninterrupted water supply, even at the time of its largest abstraction thanks to the construction of two retention tanks in which water will be stored, -increasing the share of Renewable Energy Sources and the efficiency of drinking water supply by installing a photovoltaic installation together with two energy stores used to supply equipment at the Water Treatment Station. As part of the implementation of the project, the following tasks are planned: 1. Reconstruction and construction of the Water Treatment Station with the necessary infrastructure and installation of a photovoltaic installation in Mszanowo, As part of Task 1, the exchange of hydrants for intelligent hydrants is also planned on the water supply network in the following location: parcels No: 16/1, 622/2, 948, Bratian and 25, 4, which are the property of the Applicant, as confirmed by land registers no EL1N/00020154/2, EL1N/00020076/1, EL1N/00016468/5, EL1N/00025006/5. 2. In order to properly perform the subject of the contract, investor supervision is planned, 3. In accordance with the guidelines of the programme, information and promotion activities are planned. Due to the character limit, the above tasks are described in detail in the ‘Tasks’ section of this grant application. The project in question is fully operational, as evidenced by the following administrative decisions held by the Applicant: - Building permit (Decision No 102/2023), which was issued by the Starost of Nowomiejski on 26 April 2023 approving the land development project and issuing a building permit for the investor: Nowe Miasto Lubawskie Commune, including the reconstruction and construction of a water treatment plant together with the construction of two foundations for retention tanks and their installation, the construction of a new building of a water treatment plant, the construction of an underground wastewater treatment plant and the necessary infrastructure accompanying water – sewage and electricity, and the demolition of the existing hydrophore building and retention tanks on plots Nos 1046/10, 1046/9 of Bratian Gmina Nowe Miasto Lubawskie – Stage I. This construction permit is final. -Environmental conditions decision of 12 December 2022, finding that there is no need to carry out an environmental impact assessment. The applicant also has the necessary documents, an extract from the land register and the required technical documentation, including the architectural and construction project. In addition, the Applicant announced a procedure for the award of a public contract for the reconstruction and construction of the Water Treatment Plant in Mszanowo together with the necessary infrastructure. This Application is accompanied by a statement from the Nowe Miasto Lubawskie Commune that a tender procedure has been announced with the indicated link to it.

title: Comprehensive thermomodernization of a public utility building located in Olsztyn at 82 Partyzantów Street
description: The project presented for implementation concerns the improvement of the energy efficiency of a public (historical) building located in Olsztyn at 82 Partyzantów Street, area 0072, plot Nos 65/1 and 65/2. The building dates back to the second half of the 19th century before 1890. The building is owned by the Warmian-Masurian District Chamber of Civil Engineers. The Warmia and Mazury Regional Chamber of Civil Engineers in Olsztyn was established pursuant to the Act of 15 December 2000 on professional self-governments of architects and civil engineers (Journal of Laws of 2000, No. Journal of Laws 2023, item 551) and is a non-governmental organization. The energy class of the building has been assessed as class G. The project scope includes a comprehensive thermal modernization of the building with an area of 880,97m2, which includes the following activities: insulation of the floor on the ground, insulation of the roof with the replacement of the structure and roofing, insulation of the external walls of the building, replacement of window and door joinery, modernization of the domestic hot water system, modernization of the heating system with the installation of a heat pump, installation of a photovoltaic installation with energy storage and energy management system, and replacement of lighting sources with energy-saving ones with the installation of a reactive power compensation system, as well as training, education and promotion and information activities. Within the scope of the project, preparatory activities were carried out such as: ex-ante audit, ornithological and chiropterological expertise and business plan of the project in question. The implementation of the project started on the day of the conclusion of the first contract for the preparation of preparatory documentation, i.e. 12/06/2024 Further activities are planned for Q4 2024 and will be completed in Q1 2026. The material scope will be consistent with the construction permit, design documentation and recommendations of the monument conservator, as well as with the recommendations resulting from the ornithological expert opinion. The costs incurred under the project will be in line with the Guidelines on the eligibility of expenditure for 2021-2027. The tasks to be carried out in the area of comprehensive thermomodernisation are the result of an ex-ante audit. The presented project is in line with the assumptions set out in the FEWiM 2021-2027, SZOP and the Regulations for the selection of projects. Project without public aid and without de minimis aid. WMOIIB as an entity did not implement investment projects with co-financing, however, the members of the team for the preparation and implementation of the comprehensive thermal modernization investment of the building at 82 Partyzantów Street in Olsztyn have many years of experience in the implementation of this type of projects. For the submitted project, the WMOIIB has Decision No II-32/2024 approving the land development project and the architectural and construction project and building permits have been granted. The submitted application for co-financing, the material and financial schedule includes only elements related to the comprehensive thermal modernization of the public building. The implementation of the project will improve the energy efficiency of a public (historical) building, reduce the need for energy consumption from conventional sources, and thus reduce CO2 emissions to the atmosphere. After completion of the project, the project will be financed and managed by WMOIIB during its lifetime within 5 years from the date of payment of the final payment. The Chamber will have the organisational and financial capacity to maintain the sustainability of the project in accordance with its statutes.

title: Thermomodernization of the building of Primary School No. 4 in Kętrzyn
description: The project consists in thermal modernization of a public utility building - Primary School No. 4 in Kętrzyn, as part of the construction works, the following works will be carried out: 1/ Exterior walls of the above-ground floors - polystyrene ((λ = 0.038 [W/(mK)]) with a thickness of: 0.180 [m] 2/ Stropodach - mineral wool granules (λ = 0.039[W/(mK)]) with a thickness of: 0.250 [m]) 3/ Basement exterior walls - extruded polystyrene (A = 0.038 [W/(mK)]) with a thickness of: 0.160 [m] 4/ Wall adhering to the ground - extruded polystyrene (λ = 0.038 [W/(mK)]) with a thickness of: 0.160 [m] 5/ External doors - Replacement of external doors 6/ Windows - Replacement of windows 7/ PV installation with a capacity of 25.30 kWp 1/ Preparatory Actions: - elaboration of an ornithological opinion - elaboration of an energy audit of the building Primary School No. 4, Moniuszko 1, 11-400 Kętrzyn - elaboration of a business plan - elaboration of technical documentation for thermomodernization of the building SP No. 4 2/ implementation of the project: - preparatory actions - preparation of the FTZ - selection of the contractor - signature of the contract - acceptance of works, signature of the acceptance protocol 3/ settlement of the project The project implements the specific objective of Measure FEWM.02.01 Energy efficiency, FEWiM 2021-2027, which is ‘promoting energy efficiency and reducing greenhouse gas emissions’ (ERDF/FS.CP2.I). This investment contributes to improving the energy efficiency of public buildings (Basic School No 4 in Kętrzyn) and to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, in accordance with the assumptions contained in the ex-ante energy audit. The applicant (Beneficiary) will comply with the requirements for carrying out information and promotion activities concerning projects co-financed by the European Union, which are set out in: Articles 46 to 50 of Regulation 2021/1060 and Annex IX thereto - Communication and Visibility. As part of the promotion, activities tailored to the target group and material tasks provided for in the project are planned: Information about the project will also be presented on the website and social media of the Applicant (Kętrzyn Municipality) and Primary School No. 4 in Kętrzyn. Place of implementation of the investment: Primary School No. 4, ul. Moniuszko 1 11-400 Kętrzyn Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship

title: The Katowice System of Integrated Interchange Nodes – Zawodzie node.
description: The subject of the project is the construction of the Katowice System of Integrated Interchange Nodes – the “Zawodzie” junction, which will provide transfers from buses to trams and from individual transport to tram, in the Park & Ride system, in the area of access to the Katowice Centre from the eastern part of the city and subregion. The key problem identified for this project is the low attractiveness and insufficient availability of public transp. services. At the root of this problem is the lack of infrastructure enabling effective integration and linking of individual transp. to public transp. and bus transp. with tram and rail in Katowice. The specific objective of the planned investment is to create a sustainable system of transp. in Katowice through the construction of infrastructure for the needs of the integrated interchange node. The direct objective of the project is to increase the attractiveness and accessibility of public transp. in Katowice.

title: Improving the state of public transport of the city of Wągrowiec through the purchase of low-carbon buses and the construction and reconstruction of transport infrastructure together with promotional activities
description: The project “Improving the state of public transport of the city of Wągrowiec through the purchase of low-carbon buses and the construction and reconstruction of transport infrastructure together with promotional activities” involves the purchase of 4 low-carbon buses for public transport Wągrowiec, construction of road, parking, bicycle and pedestrian infrastructure. Within the framework of the project, a functional Integrated Communication Centre (ZCK) will be established in Wągrowiec, enabling a convenient change of means of transport, equipped with infrastructure for handling travellers, including ticket sales points. Access roads, pavements and bicycle paths will be built for the needs of the ZCK, free and public parking lots will be created: type "Parkamp;Ride" with 171 m. parking and double charger for electric cars, with designated seats for the disabled and "Bikeamp;Ride for approx. 200 m. equipped with bicycle worlds, surrounded by greenery. Energy-efficient street lighting will be installed. In addition, a new bicycle road linking ZCK and the city centre with the eastern part of the city, which includes the largest housing estate – Osiedle Wschodnie, will be built after a closed railway line, using a railway embankment. Electronic boards integrated with the IT system will be installed on the new and listed stop worlds, enabling you to familiarise yourself with the timetable, the communication line. As a result of the project, the following product indicators will be achieved:- number of rolling stock – 4 pcs- length of bicycle roads – 1.919 km- number of seats PAMP;R- 171 pcs- number of places BAMP;R – 200 pcs – number of seats for people with disabilities – 7 pcs- object PAMP;R – 1 pieces- object BAMP;R – 1 pieces- number of integrated systems – 1 Komunik. — 84- number of actions

title: Creation of a transfer centre in Sokołów Podlaski together with the development of the connected communication system of the Sokołowski district
description: The subject of the project is: construction of a transfer centre at the base of PKS S.A. Sokołów podl together with the passenger information system; construction of transport bicycle paths in Sokołów podl and on district roads; reconstruction of streets and roads in Sokołów Podl. and district roads; change of street line to energy-saving along bicycle paths in Sokołów podl and in places. Jabłonna Lack, Unknow, Unhappy Italian, Bujal Mikoshes and Bujal Wraths; construction of parking lots The Park Ride in Sokołów podl at ul. Fair 2 and Oleksiaka Wichura-1; construction of parking lots Bikeamp;Ride in Sokołów Podl. on ul. Marketplace and Oleksiaka Wichura and in the towns of Sabna and Jabłonna Lacka; setting up a bicycle rental system: Falcons podl – 4 points, Sabnie-1 point, Jabłonna Lacka-1 point. Project costs include, in addition to investment tasks relating to the construction, conversion or demarcation of separate roads for bicycles, including road markings, bicycle lanes and the designation of bicycle locks and cycling crossings; the construction of a transfer centre; construction of car parks, lighting changes, reconstruction of public roads also costs: preparatory works (technical documentation, feasibility study), investor supervision, contract engineer, preparation of tenders and information and promotion and purchase of plots. The target group is the inhabitants of the north-eastern part of the Siedlce subregion. The area of implementation of the project is in line with the Investment Plan for the Siedle subregion covered by the problem OSI “Creation of the Integrated Multifunctional Passenger Exchange Node in Siedlce and the extension and modernisation of the connected city and sub-region of Siedlce” The project fits in with the directions of low-carbon activities and the principles of mobility policy and has been identified in documents concerning the low-carbon economy. The project envisages investments in local roads. They are merely a necessary and complementary element

title: Construction of an integrated network of cycling routes in Małopolskie Voivodship – Task No. 1 Wiślan Bicycle Route (WTR) – section 1: Drwinia (Niepołomice) – Szczucin.
description: Wiślan Bike Route is a route from the group of 8 main routes of Małopolska, part of the integrated network of cycle routes of Małopolska Voivodeship. It runs through the most attractive areas of the Vistula valley. The length of the entire route is about 220 km, while the project covers section I of the Vistula Bicycle Route with a length of about 90.8 km located in central and eastern Małopolska. The WTR is located along the river Vistula from the village of Drwinia (Niepołomice) to Szczucin commune. The width of the route on the shaft is 2.5 m. It is allowed to narrow the width of the road in places where the geometry of the shaft does not allow the construction of a bicycle road with a width of 2.5 m. This cycle route mostly uses the Vistula river shafts as an ecological transport link without motor traffic, thus ensuring healthy recreation in a clean environment. Small inclinations (up to 6 % and Vp min 30 km/h) and level differences make it pleasant and easy for ordinary cyclists as well as for families with children, as well as cyclists with trailers or purses. As part of this project, 90.8 km of bicycle route is planned. The entire length of the route marking is planned in accordance with the guidelines of the Regulation of the Minister of Infrastructure on detailed technical conditions for road signs and signals and road safety devices and their conditions on roads and in accordance with the Regulation of Ministers of Infrastructure and Internal Affairs and Administration on road signs and signals and with the adopted logo of Wiślana Bicycle Route. In addition, six Service Facilities for Cyclists (MOR) will be built. In accordance with the requirements of the Ordering Authority, asphalt paving was designed for bicycle roads. The designed surfaces will be positioned on the G1 substrate: frost-resistant.

title: Integration of Foreigners in Eastern Wielkopolska
description: The project "Integration of Foreigners in Eastern Wielkopolska" is aimed at 120 people (80 k and 40 m - including 78 unemployed, 40 employed, 2 inactive, including 1 SA who study, work or live in the Wielkopolska Region within the meaning of the Central Committee. The project will be implemented in the period 01.06.2024-31.12.2025. The main objective of the project is to increase the socio-economic integration of 120 foreigners (including 80 K and 40M) residing in the Eastern Wielkopolska region, by providing comprehensive support that will enable them to actively participate in social life and the labour market until 31 December 2025. In order to make the project's activities as effective as possible, a multi-sectoral partnership was established in September this year. The project partners will be the Turkish Chamber of Commerce (Leader) and the District Labour Office in Turku (Partner). The project will respond to the main problems that foreigners face after arriving in a foreign country (problems indicated in description 3.4.2). The actions planned to be implemented in the project ensure the comprehensiveness of support and correspond to the current life situation of foreigners, they will also be complementary to actions from the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund. Migration specificity for WLKP Wsch: working men of working age, women of productive age looking for work and/or taking care of children. Workplace-transport and logistics industry,wood industry, Employment by employment agencies, most often long-term. Level of education - low qualifications. The proposed forms of support will include: - initial needs assessment, which will be aimed at individualizing forms of support and adapting them to the needs of participants, - specialist advisory support - including legal/psychological support, which will be aimed at providing assistance in solving the problems of foreigners, - organization of language courses - Polish necessary for better adaptation and integration in the new country; - thematic support groups for third-country nationals, including migrants (integration-education, sport, etc.); - organization of vocational courses and trainings, ending with exams and obtaining a certificate confirming the acquisition of competencies or qualifications, allowing to increase UP's competitiveness on the labour market; - professional/job mentoring - i.a. to help UP find work or change jobs and find their place on the local labour market in line with development priorities for the region. Each of the offered forms of support will be tailored to the needs of participants and will take into account such elements as, for example, knowledge of Polish, the situation on the labour market, education (including education gained outside Poland), qualifications, competences that can be validated in accordance with the Integrated Qualifications System, type of work performed or sought, cultural differences, gender, age, migration status. The forms of support planned for implementation in the project are adequate to the main goal of the project, and their implementation will allow it to be achieved. In order to implement the support path in the project, each participant will have to use at least two forms of support offered in the project - including the initial needs assessment and one of the other forms of support provided for in the project, selected on the basis of the needs assessment carried out. Each form of support will be documented in detail (e.g. attendance lists, advisory cards, journals, substantive documentation). The implementation of the project and the forms of support planned in it is necessary to help foreigners integrate and adapt and solve other problems they face. Its implementation will contribute to the creation of an inclusive and open society in which foreigners have the opportunity to actively participate in the social life and inn of the Wielkopolska Region. It's Eastern.

title: Supporting the energy transition in Eastern Wielkopolska
description: The aim of the project is to prepare a comprehensive educational offer for local administration and key stakeholders in the context of the energy transformation of Eastern Wielkopolska. The objective will be achieved during the period: 1September 2024 – 31 August 2026 by developing substantive housing, i.e. teaching materials taking into account regional specialisations for market qualifications diagnosed in the application, in particular those operating in the Integrated Qualifications Register, and then testing and implementing the created educational model into practice. Based on the diagnosis*, it was decided to direct support for the group of 200os. - officials and employees of NGOs from the area of Eastern Wielkopolska. It is an area heavily dependent on coal and the mining industry. Due to the ongoing energy transition in Europe and Poland, jobs in mining and related sectors are to be finally extinguished in this region by 2049. This is linked to a process of massive societal change at many levels: education, labour market, social. The key staff to effectively conduct the process are stakeholders from the broadly understood public sector, including: public administration, employees of local government units and their organisational units (e.g. labour offices, organisational units, social assistance units, investment units), as well as employees of the so-called Social Security Offices, 3 sector, as animators and responsible for local development and at the same time supporting groups at risk of poverty and social exclusion. The demand for competences and qualifications in the project is in line with the provisions of the Territorial Just Transition Plan (TPST) for Eastern Wielkopolska (WW), under which various activities are to be initiated to activate and support the EU regions most affected by the negative phenomena of the energy transition. One of the objectives of TPST is to: "...support for the upskilling and reskilling and skills development of adults in directions consistent with Smart Specialisations (IS) and the needs of a zero-emission, resource-efficient and digital economy...". According to IS, the most promising sectors in Eastern Wielkopolska are: Tourism and logistics. The qualifications selected in the project result from the diagnosis carried out and correspond to the development needs of the region in the above-mentioned scope. The competency gap diagnosed concerns in particular skills in the area of: sustainable management, use of ICT tools supporting the customer service process; effective communication; effectively navigate the network, taking into account security and data protection elements, the use of AI tools in everyday work. Our project responds to the diagnosed needs in the area of effective implementation of changes in connection with the long-term transformation process, which is just beginning in Poland and the Wielkopolska region, which is finally to be completed in Eastern Wielkopolska in 2040. The WSKM is based in the Energy Transition area and works for an equal and fair coal phase-out process. The partnership with the Turkish Chamber of Commerce will ensure the development of solutions supporting the logistics and tourism sector, which has great potential for the development of the region. The Chamber brings together several dozen companies from the region from the transport, forwarding, logistics, tourism, gastronomy and hospitality sectors. Therefore, the training offer of staff implementing the transition developed in the project will be used for at least several years after the end of the project, ensuring the sustainability of the planned results. *Diagnosis (desk research) based on: -TPST for Eastern Wielkopolska 2022 Regional Innovation Strategy for Wielkopolska 2030 - Smart Specializations for Wielkopolska. Links to the documents confirming the diagnosis of the need for qualifications can be found in the section "Potential for implementation".

title: New competences for FPP regions and industry in the process of establishing and monitoring employment and skills laws and public policies
description: The aim of the project is to increase the competences of the social partners in the processes of establishing and monitoring public employment policies. Support for strengthening the above-mentioned competences will be provided to at least 200 FPP representatives and at least 18 member organizations (reg. or industry or cross-industry). The project thus meets the criteria of access Nos. 2 and 4 included in the rules of the competition. The above-mentioned number of representatives and member organisations will receive support to strengthen the institutional and expert capacity related to their participation in the law-making and monitoring processes of employment and skills laws/policies according to identified needs, thus fulfilling criterion 3. When planning the expert opinion, the Applicant undertakes to consult the thematic scope of the study and expert opinion at the project implementation stage with the other representative organisations of the social partners implementing the projects selected for funding in the call and the IB or MA, thus meeting criterion No 5. Support under the project will be used to develop and strengthen capacities in the personal, organizational and process dimensions, in order to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of statutory activities. According to the statutes of the FPP, the basic purpose and task of the Federation is to protect the rights and represent the interests of employers associated in the Federation, in particular by conducting research, storing and transferring information in the field of employers; - providing economic advice and conducting expert opinions for employers and employers' organisations; organizing and supporting training of employers, managers and business activists and organizing seminars, conferences and other forms of exchange of views and experiences of the employers' community and initiating and supporting activities in the field of publishing and information activities; - taking initiatives aimed at shaping appropriate social policy, including employment policy, safeguarding the interests of workers and employers; - submitting requests to the competent authorities to take legislative initiatives with proposals for legal regulations in the scope covered by the tasks of the Federation and representing the interests of associated members All the above statutory objectives will be supported by activities in the project (described in section: "Tasks"). Thus, the Applicant fulfils Criterion No 6. The project is scheduled for 36 months. (According to Clause 7). The FPP plans to submit one additional grant application in addition to this application. The total budget of both projects will not exceed PLN 6 million (in accordance with Clause 8). The start of the project is planned for November 2024, thus the date does not exceed the maximum start date of the project - 1 January 2025 - included in Criterion No 9. In order to diagnose problems within the organization, a detailed needs analysis was carried out (which we intend to deepen during the research and expert part of the project and before the start of each action). Activities were the subject of debate in the ranks of FPP leaders, experts cooperating with the FPP, representatives of the FPP were also invited to speak. The subject and direction of activities were chosen through consultations by e-mail, telephone, during meetings in traditional and online form. Additional activities will be directed to the newly created structures (established within the framework of the Norwegian project MIGHRIGHT 2) and within the framework of the project within the competition FERS.04.03-IP.06-0001/23: 2 completely new regional structures will be created in Warmińsko-Mazurskie and Podlaskie voivodships, two recently established structures (2023) will be strengthened in Łódzkie and Małopolskie voivodships. The project also provides for the creation and strengthening of a new industry association - the Circular Economy Employers' Association.

title: Development of the GOZ-transformation business model in Kucharczyk Sp. z. o. o. in Podlaskie Voivodeship
description: The development of the GOZ-transformation model is crucial for the Applicant to effectively implement circular economy solutions by creating a comprehensive process involving a variety of fields, including economics, technology, society and the environment. As part of the advisory services, the following activities will be carried out: 1. Analysis and diagnosis of the Applicant’s company – verification of resources, waste generated in the company, life cycle assessment of products and their disposal, checking the level of electricity consumption. 2. Defining targets and strategies - developing clear targets related to waste reduction, increasing resource efficiency and introducing circularity principles. Develop an action plan covering projects, initiatives and policies to achieve the objectives set. 3. GOZ-compliant design - creating products designed for easy reuse, remanufacturing or recycling. Adapting business strategies to the idea of circularity. 4. Implementation and action - implementation of plans, including changes in production processes, distribution, disposal and waste management. Raising awareness among workers, consumers and the community about the benefits and practices of GOZ. 5. Monitoring and optimization - monitoring progress in achieving the goals of the GOZ, collecting data and indicators to assess the effectiveness of actions. Data-driven strategy alignment, identification of areas for improvement and implementation of adjustments. Carrying out the above activities will allow us to target the scope of work in detail and develop a business model of GOZ-transformation, the elements of which will be an audit of the company and implementation consulting, aimed at determining possible directions of the company's transformation in the GOZ trend. The project will result in a comprehensive and coherent plan for the company's transformation towards an economy based on GOZ.

title: Development of the post-mining area for the purposes of advanced construction services.
description: The main objective of the project is to develop post-mining areas for the purposes of conducting economic activity as part of the mitigation of social, economic and environmental effects in the Silesian Voivodeship. This objective will be achieved by developing the plot of land constituting the post-mining area of the Pniówek Coal Mine and launching the provision of a new service: erecting hyper-heavy structures from complex prefabricated elements with a lidar system supporting the field of work of crawler cranes operating in dual mode. The aim and method of implementation of the project is consistent with the Territorial Plan for Just Transformation of the War. Silesia 2030 and the goal of the Just Transition Fund. The other objectives of the project are also in line with the operational objectives of the above-mentioned Programme. Plan: 1. Implementation of the results of R&D works carried out by the Cracow University of Technology. 2. Diversifying activities into non-mining activities, i.e. the construction industry and starting to provide an innovative construction service, - Increasing the share of clean technologies through the purchase of a heat pump for heating water in the service process, which will reduce the consumption of conventional energy for renewable energy sources. 3. Increasing employment by 6 people in the non-mining services sector, - Development in the alternative sector to mining and conventional energy through development in the construction industry, - Increase in the internationalization of companies by increasing exports to approx. 50% of sales. 4. Use of post-industrial areas for the development of the region through post-mining land development. 5. Increased professional activity of residents of mining subregions through the creation of 6 permanent jobs. The project will be implemented through the purchase and commissioning of fixed assets: 2 crawler cranes, lidar, heat pumps, 2 sets of belt slings, 2 sets of ball holders and transp. belts and 2 compl. traverses for prefabricated assembly. The project also implements CSR principles. Promotional activities in the project will be carried out in accordance with the Manual of the applicant and beneficiary of European Funds for 2021-2027 in the field of information and promotion. In addition, from the budget under indirect costs, the Applicant plans to implement additional information and promotion activities: - printing of promotional materials (leaflets) with information about the new service implemented as part of the project, - promotional mailing about the new service and the grant granted as part of the project, - the place of implementation of the project and the headquarters will be marked with a poster. https://annbauslask.pl

title: Silesian Interdisciplinary Centre for Chemistry
description: The scope of the project includes the establishment of the Silesian Interdisciplinary Chemistry Centre (ŚICCH). SICCH will be created in a newly built and equipped facility as part of the project. The implementation of the project is a component of a larger concept of universities, which is the launch of the Green Science Zone - a horizontal undertaking that meets the needs resulting from the Just Transition, which will contribute to mitigating its effects in three areas: -economic, -social, -environmental. The economic transformation of the region associated with the extinction or significant transformation of entire industries forces the gradual updating of knowledge and the acquisition of new skills, competences or qualifications by residents and employees of mining subregions. Due to the close link between higher education (practical and vocational) and the transformation of the region, it is of utmost importance to take measures to improve the quality of education in order to adapt it to the current needs of the labour market, the challenges of the digital transformation and the transition towards a green economy and smart and technological specializations of the region., which will allow to educate the future workforce and create new economic areas in the transformed region. The implementation of the project is therefore a response to the socio-economic changes taking place in the region. The aim of the project is to improve the conditions of higher education through the creation of SICCH, which will translate into the development of a society with high professional qualifications sought on the labour market and the creation of new professions. The applicant will carry out information and promotion activities in accordance with the requirements of the General Regulation, the Guidelines on information and promotion of European funds for 2021-2027 and in accordance with the Visual Identity Book of the European Funds 2021-2027 brand. As part of the project, it is planned to: - installation of an information and commemorative plaque (the plaque will be mounted on the building of the newly created SICCH), - organization of two press conferences - the first at the beginning of the investment and the second at the end of the investment. Representatives of the Management Board of the Silesian Voivodeship and the European Commission will be invited to participate in these events. During the conference, a sign language interpreter and an English translator will be provided, - information and promotion of the project in the local press and through the website and social media of the University of Silesia. https://us.edu.pl/

title: jUŚt transition - Potential of the University of Silesia as a basis for Just Transition of the region
description: The aim of the project is to strengthen the potential of the University of Silesia in Katowice for effective support for the just transition and future staff of the region, which will be achieved through the implementation of activities affecting the institutional development of the university and by providing individual support to people constituting the academic community. Institutional development will include strengthening the human resources and infrastructure capacity of the Career Office, Doctoral Schools and Faculties of the University of Silesia associated with the process of change - with the directions of the green and digital economy. Individual support will be provided to students, teachers, PhD students and representatives of the socio-economic environment. Thanks to the project, the university will have the opportunity to create and develop new directions of industry such as artificial intelligence, VR, cybersecurity, green chemistry and energy, biotechnology and environmental protection. The project will be implemented by 30 months in the period 1.01.2024-30.06.2026 in the area of mines of one of the subregions of the Silesian Voivodeship: Katowice, Sosnowiec, Thousands, Bytom, Gliwice, Rybnik, Bielsko. The project includes: support for the Career Office, activities for the development of scientific staff, including doctorates (including implementation) and doctoral schools, support for cooperation between scientific units and entrepreneurs in the field of innovation and technology transfer, promotion of the idea of entrepreneurship, increasing the attractiveness of the University by equipping scientific laboratories and laboratories, support for the University's staff regarding, among others, the use of modern teaching methods, shaping soft and digital competences, skills for transformation through participation in courses, trainings, workshops, study visits, as well as the organization of internships and student internships in fields related to the green and digital economy, which are a response to diagnosed problems of the target group. Promotion and information activities will be carried out by the Management Team, which will constantly cooperate in this respect with the Centre for the Promotion of the University of Silesia. Various information channels will be used, including social media, the main website of the University of Silesia. Information and promotion activities will be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (EU) 2021/1060 and the Guidelines on information and promotion of European Funds for 2021-2027. Before the start of the recruitment of project participants, information and promotion activities will be implemented, among others, via the website of the University of Silesia (the home page is responsive, in accordance with the requirements of the W3C ad. accessibility and directives. EP AND COUNCIL (EU) 2016/2102 of 26.X.2016), social media (eg. Facebook, Instagram), newsletters and emails to UŚ employees – meeting digital accessibility standards and information meetings. The implementation of these actions will contribute to the wide availability of information on the project and planned support. The information and promotion campaign will be conducted in accordance with information and promotion accessibility standards, i.e. all information about events will be digitally available and will contain information that is non-stereotypically formulated. Information meetings will be organised in rooms that meet accessibility standards and will be organised in such a way as to allow the specific needs of participants to be reported. Information about the meetings will include contact details for the organiser (at least 2 contact channels) and an indication of how the event will be accessible to persons with disabilities. http://www.us.edu.pl

title: Dynamic growth of the company's competitiveness through the implementation of innovative products in the region.
description: The aim of the project is to significantly increase the competitiveness of the company "TRACARNIA STALI SILESIA" Dawid Śpiewak through the implementation of innovative products in the region. Achieving the objective of the project will significantly contribute to mitigating the effects of the economic transformation in the region. As part of the activities aimed at significantly increasing the competitiveness of the company, the company's offer will be diversified and one innovative product in the region will be implemented in the form of a cold-drawn bar. Thanks to the implementation of the project, there will be a significant strengthening of economic activity and a significant improvement in the competitiveness of the company not only on the regional market but also on the domestic market. The assumptions of the project will consist of the following activities: 1. Introducing innovative products in the region to the company's offer – this is confirmed by the opinion about innovation. 2. Expansion of the Applicant's activity and commencement of operations in the area of new production from the industry of steel products for construction and industry. 3. Diversification of revenue sources in the company – broadening the offer and introducing new opportunities will allow the Applicant to obtain new revenue sources. 4. Enlargement of customer groups – contractors – introduction of product innovation (extension of activities with new technological products) will increase the company’s audience. 5. Increase the company's human resources by creating 10 new jobs related to the production and promotion of innovative products. 6. Dynamic growth of revenues and profits - the company will expand its business, gain new customers, significantly increase turnover and profits. The main objective and objectives of the project will be achieved through the implementation of the investment in question consisting in the purchase and assembly of a dedicated production line for cold drawing of the bar and the execution of a photovoltaic installation supplying the new technological line. Activities planned to be used by the Applicant: • Website – information about the project will be made available on the website. • Social media activities – information about the project will be shared on social networks. These activities will allow you to reach a wide range of recipients. • Promotional folders/brochures – developing and distributing promotional material will be a tool to inform about the results of the project. • Advertising films – creation and publication of advertising spots on specialist industry and social networks (e.g. Facebook and YouTube). • B2B meetings – participation in such meetings is an effective way of attracting new customers. At the end of the project, an event is planned to summarize the project and promote its results. Promotion activities will be carried out highlighting aspects related to the just transition and EU funds, as well as promoting the idea of a green approach to production processes and the implementation of solutions based on the assumptions of the GOZ. https://www.zafama.com.pl/

title: Centre for Biotechnology and Biodiversity
description: The scope of the project includes the creation of the Centre for Biotechnology and Biodiversity (CBB). CBB will be created in a newly built and equipped facility as part of the project. The implementation of the project is a component of a larger concept of universities, which is the launch of the Green Science Zone - a horizontal undertaking that meets the needs resulting from the Just Transition, which will contribute to mitigating its effects in three areas: economic, social, environmental. The economic transformation of the region associated with the extinction or significant transformation of entire industries forces the gradual updating of knowledge and the acquisition of new skills, competences or qualifications by residents and employees of mining subregions. The project will result in the creation of an optimal and modern infrastructure for education and competence building in disciplines in the fields of science and natural sciences, engineering and technical sciences, as well as medical sciences and health sciences, in particular such as biological sciences, biotechnological sciences, environmental engineering, mining and energy, and earth and environmental sciences, with a broadly understood interdisciplinary approach covering traditionally related areas such as medicine, pharmacy, material engineering, biomedical engineering, agriculture and horticulture, food and nutrition technologies, zootechnics and fisheries. This education will ultimately provide qualified specialists ready to take action and implement solutions in the priority areas of the region's development, including biotechnology, biodiversity and the functioning, shaping and protection of the environment. The applicant will carry out information and promotion activities in accordance with the requirements of the General Regulation, the Guidelines on information and promotion of European funds for 2021-2027 and in accordance with the Visual Identity Book of the European Funds 2021-2027 brand. As part of the project, it is planned to: - installation of an information and commemorative plaque (the plaque will be mounted on the building of the newly created CBB), - organization of two press conferences - the first at the beginning of the investment and the second at the end of the investment. Representatives of the Management Board of the Silesian Voivodeship will be invited to participate in these events. An invitation to participate in at least one of these events will be addressed to representatives of the EC. During the conference, a sign language interpreter and an English translator will be provided, - information and promotion of the project in the local press and through the website and social media of the University of Silesia: www.us.edu.pl University of Silesia in Katowice | Katowice (facebook.com) https://www.instagram.com/uniwersytetslaski/ https://us.edu.pl/

title: Transformation of the activity of Poliamid Plastics Sp. z o. o., enabling an increase in production volume, optimization of energy consumption and introduction of modified products limiting heat losses in district heating networks to the offer.
description: The aim of the project is to carry out technological transformation in Poliamid Plastics Sp. z o.o. by: 1) increasing the volume of production of existing products, 2) introducing modified products to the offer - rings limiting heat loss in district heating networks, 3) fundamental change in the overall production process and optimization of energy consumption in the company, consisting in connecting all machines with the central feed system and drying. To achieve these goals, it is necessary to build a new hall, as well as its comprehensive equipment with the necessary machines: injection moulding machines, cranes, central feed system, cooling system and storage racks with system trolleys. The whole will be managed with the help of production management software. The project is in line with the assumptions: European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021-2027 - the objective of measure 9.4 is investment support for SMEs from the manufacturing and service sectors, contributing to the expansion (diversification, modernisation) of the enterprise and increasing its competitiveness - support closely related to the goals of the transformation process of the subregion. The specific objective is to enable regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the Union’s 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral economy of the Union by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement (FST). The proposed lines of action are: grant support for investments in SMEs, grant support for investments in SMEs contributing to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and decarbonisation, the implementation of circular economy solutions, reducing the energy intensity of processes and services, investments in R&D activities and the implementation of innovations increasing the potential of Lower Silesian smart specialisations. - Territorial Just Transition Plan for the Lower Silesian Voivodeship 2021-2030 - Wałbrzych Subregion: the specific economic objective is economic activation and strengthening competitiveness by exploiting the endogenous potential of the sub-region in a way that ensures the achievement of the objectives of low emission reduction and decarbonisation. This goal assumes the activation of the economic sector in the area of green, competitive technologies, opens an opportunity for the development of innovation and diversification of economic activity and the creation of additional jobs with significant added value in industries already present in the subregion. For the economic purpose, activities of changes in products, processes that fit into the principles of circularity will be implemented. This project fits perfectly into the above assumptions. It includes the construction of a completely new production hall and its comprehensive equipment with production machines, cooling and central feed systems, as well as modern storage racks with system trolleys. The plant will be equipped with specialized production management software. The implementation of the investment will contribute to the dynamic development of the company operating for years in the Wałbrzych Subregion (in Kłodzko). The planned actions will allow the introduction of an innovative product resulting from R&D works, increasing the volume of existing production at such a plant organization, in order to further reduce energy consumption in production and reduce the amount of waste and pollution generated. The process innovation used will allow for a significant improvement in the management of the raw material and will contribute to the overall change of the production process in the plant. The implementation of the project will additionally require the employment of new people to operate machines in specialized positions. Promotion of the project will take place by installing an appropriate information board and creating a special tab on the Company's website.

title: Butterflies from Lower Silesia - on their own. Sub-regional support system for people at risk of social exclusion in the TPST area, in particular in relation to the risk or experience of homelessness.
description: The Wałbrzych subregion – the area covered by the Just Transition Fund – is a series of challenges to which the Programme aims to respond with a systemic intervention. The aim of the project "Butterflies from Lower Silesia - on their own" is to increase the activity of at least 140 excluded people and their families, affected by the negative effects of the transformation, and to counteract the social exclusion of people in vulnerable situations on the labour market by using the potential of social economy entities (PES). The project is supported by two groups: I. People in the crisis of homelessness, supported by ARTE Multi-branch Social Cooperative-40 pers. Piotr, for 10 years in homelessness, has been consistently taking up work and maintaining sobriety for 4 years with the support of ARTE and FRES. Dominik, a homeless person with experience of mental illness, works and supports Cooperatives. Men with similar challenges who are active within the Cooperative are 70 from all over the region. Many of them are trying to change their lives again. As part of the support, housing is necessary, which the Project will launch and thus develop, a system for supporting people in a long-term crisis, including homelessness, which has been created for 10 years. The system including socio-professional support within the cooperative with the possibility of living in a hostel will be supplemented with assisted housing. This group will be supported under the project in the following areas: 1.Accommodation in assisted housing – 9 places were created for 9 people, 2.Support by housing caregivers and participation in training (576 hours) - for 12 people. (9+ rotation 3 pers. in the rear) 3.as GR II -31 pers. These actions will also enable or maintain the possibility of professional activation (priority intervention direction). II. People in need of support in everyday functioning-100 persons, affected by exclusion from access to housing and at risk of homelessness due to: age - health condition - disability - or the need for constant care/support. And an environment specific to the TPST area - inactive people in need of constant support. These are single parents (especially women), people with experience of mental illness, families with huge problems in educational aspects, people in foster care. A large part of the planned group (40 families) are people at risk of homelessness, which will be supported by 40 apartments created in Bielawa from autumn 2023 in the Social Rental Agency - Zad. Arte supervision of the use of apartments. It is a huge and diverse group of people, also with visible and often invisible diseases that limit and often prevent independent functioning. These are people suffering, tired, with disabilities, often without judgment, for which they do not have the strength to try. Many of them could work and gain dignity if they received regular support. A special group includes people with experience of cancer, mental illness, autoimmune diseases, depression many other invisible, e.g. after trauma related to violence. The project for this group assumes the creation of non-residential and non-isolated forms of support in the resources of the applicant, partner and in places of residence and activities, including: 1. Various forms of self-help – moderated by group specialists. 2. Animation activities with the participation of non-governmental organizations activating, connecting people among themselves and building cooperation with institutions. 3.
