A permanent place equipped with hall and garden facilities, the so-called non-residential support facility. 4. Assistance services for persons with disabilities and assistance services for persons in need of support in everyday functioning. The project will result in the construction of a sub-regulated system of assistance for people at risk of social exclusion, in particular in connection with homelessness or its threat, living in the TPST area. The system in the formula of partnership with the participation of Social Economy Entities and other suppliers.

title: A serene Autumn of Life in Kłodzko and Dzerżoniów districts
description: The main objective of the project is to increase equal and rapid access to good quality, sustainable and affordable social services for people in need of support in everyday life (hereinafter people in need of support or assistance), provided in the local community of residents of the Kłodzko and Dzerżoniów districts in the period from 01.03.2024 to 30.06.2025. Specific objective 1 is to increase access to social services, by organising 28 new places for the provision of part-time care services, which will allow 50 people (35 K) in need of support/persons with disabilities (PNS) to be supported under the project. Specific objective 2 is to increase the knowledge and competence of 25 de facto carers (22 K) in the care of people in need of support/NSA. The project contributes to the objectives of the FEDS 2021-2027 Programme, including the Territorial Just Transition Plan, and in particular contributes to the specific objective FST.CP6.I for Measure 9.1 - Enabling regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition. The project implements operation type 9.1.A Prevention of exclusion from the labour market specified in the SZOP European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021- 2027 for Measure FEDS.09.01 Social transformation. Compliance in terms of area, forms of support, GD and result indicators. The project activities are in line with the scope of the projects: Improving access to social, assistant and care services relevant for increasing the labour market participation of excluded people and their families affected by the negative effects of the transition, including those whose inactivity results from the need to care for dependent persons and counteracting the social exclusion of people in vulnerable situations on the labour market by exploiting the potential of social economy entities: a) development of care services (including specialised care services) for people in need of support, together with accompanying support increasing the chances of independent living, provided in the local community: - residential care services and specialised care services; - Neighborhood care services; - services enabling people in need of support/NSA to function independently. The project is implemented under 3 tasks: Task 1. Providing care services to people in need of support in their place of residence Task 2. Services supporting the work of carers and additional services for supported persons and specialist care services Task 3. Support for de facto carers and neighbourhood care services. In total, the project will support 75 people living within the meaning of the CC in the Kłodzko and Dzerżoniów districts. Care support and specialist and neighbourly care services will be provided to 50 people in need of support in their day-to-day functioning, and training and advisory support to 25 real carers. Main project indicators: Total number of people supported. 75 people. Number of people covered by community-based services in the programme. 75 people. Number of persons covered by care services and specialised and neighbouring care services. Fifty people. Number of actual/informal carers supported in the programme. Twenty-five people. Number of service places created in the local community. Target value 0. The project will be implemented in accordance with Union and national legislation, taking into account the principles of equal opportunities for women and men, equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, in accordance with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union of 26 October 2012, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, done at New York on 13 December 2006, and the principle of sustainable development.

title: A serene Autumn of Life in Kłodzko and Wałbrzych districts
description: The main objective of the project is to increase equal and rapid access to good quality, sustainable and affordable social services for people in need of support in everyday life (hereinafter people in need of support or assistance), provided in the local community of residents of the Kłodzko and Wałbrzych districts in the period from 01.01.2024 to 30.06.2025. Specific objective 1 is to increase access to social services, by organising 28 new places for the provision of part-time care services, which will allow 50 people (35 K) in need of support/persons with disabilities (PNS) to be supported under the project. Specific objective 2 is to increase the knowledge and competence of 25 de facto carers (22 K) in the care of people in need of support/NSA. The project contributes to the objectives of the FEDS 2021-2027 Programme, including the Territorial Just Transition Plan, and in particular contributes to the specific objective FST.CP6.I for Measure 9.1 - Enabling regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition. The project implements operation type 9.1.A Prevention of exclusion from the labour market specified in the SZOP European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021- 2027 for Measure FEDS.09.01 Social transformation. Compliance in terms of area, forms of support, GD and result indicators. The project activities are in line with the scope of the projects: Improving access to social, assistant and care services relevant for increasing the labour market participation of excluded people and their families affected by the negative effects of the transition, including those whose inactivity results from the need to care for dependent persons and counteracting the social exclusion of people in vulnerable situations on the labour market by exploiting the potential of social economy entities: a) development of care services (including specialised care services) for people in need of support, together with accompanying support increasing the chances of independent living, provided in the local community: - residential care services and specialised care services; - Neighborhood care services; - services enabling people in need of support/NSA to function independently. The project is implemented under 3 tasks: Task 1. Providing care services to people in need of support in their place of residence Task 2. Services supporting the work of carers and additional services for supported persons and specialist care services Task 3. Support for de facto carers and neighbourhood care services. In total, the project will support 75 people living within the meaning of the CC in the Kłodzko and Wałbrzych districts. Care support and specialist and neighbourly care services will be provided to 50 people in need of support in their day-to-day functioning, and training and advisory support to 25 real carers. Main project indicators: Total number of people supported. 75 people. Number of people covered by community-based services in the programme. 75 people. Number of persons covered by care services and specialised and neighbouring care services. Fifty people. Number of actual/informal carers supported in the programme. Twenty-five people. Number of service places created in the local community. Target value 0. The project will be implemented in accordance with Union and national legislation, taking into account the principles of equal opportunities for women and men, equal opportunities and non-discrimination, including accessibility for persons with disabilities, in accordance with the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union of 26 October 2012, the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, done at New York on 13 December 2006, and the principle of sustainable development.

title: Improving the quality of education in Cieszyn poviat through investments in educational infrastructure - stage I
description: The project concerns the improvement of the quality and adaptation of education to the needs of the local and regional labour market by modernizing the educational infrastructure, including the adaptation of the infrastructure to inclusive education of students, in three schools of the Cieszyn County educating in professions important for the changing labour market. It primarily concerns adapting the level and directions of vocational education to the needs of the region's transformation, by enabling students to acquire specific qualifications and skills that will allow them to efficiently enter the changing labour market in terms of the region's transformation. The aim of the project is therefore to develop and improve the quality of vocational education in accordance with the needs of the region's transformation. It results from a defined problem, i.e. the inadequacy of education courses - the level and quality of education to the changing socio-economic situation of the region and its labour market. Thanks to the implementation of the project, the adaptation of vocational education to the requirements of the changing labour market under the influence of the transformation of the region will be increased, both in regional and local industries (industry, production, automotive, engineering, technology, agriculture, services, tourism, gastronomy, hospitality, sales). modernising school workshops and classrooms for practical apprenticeships with the purchase of equipment and equipment and adapting the infrastructure to inclusive learning. Schools covered by the project: - Complex of Natural and Agricultural Schools in Międzyświatie (farmer technician, mechanic - operator of agricultural vehicles and machinery); - Technical School Complex in Ustroń (mechanical technician, IT technician, programmer technician); - Complex of Gastronomy and Hotel Schools in Wisła (hotel technician, economist technician, food and catering techniques, tourism organization techniques, sales technician). As part of the project, information and promotion activities will be carried out in accordance with the recommendations/principles, in particular the principles indicated in Article 50 of Regulation 2021/1060 and the grant agreement. Promotional activities of the project include: - placing in a visible place the European Funds mark, the colour mark of the Republic of Poland, the European Union mark and the figurative mark of the Śląskie Voivodeship on all information and promotional activities concerning the project, documents and materials made available to the public and intended for persons and entities participating in the project, products, were created / purchased from EU funds, - placing in a visible place of the project an information board about the co-financing of the project from the EU - i.e. in three schools (objects) covered by the project - at the entrance to each modernized workshop (7 pieces of boards) - placing the project description on the website of the Cieszyn County (title, objectives, tasks, target groups, value of the project and EU co-financing, source of financing with a set of logotypes) - in accordance with the WCAG 2.1 standard - organizing 3 information and promotional meetings summarizing the implementation of project activities along with ensuring information about the co-financing of the project from EU funds under the European Funds for Silesia Programme 2021-2027 (Just Transition Fund) - i.e. in each school covered by the project (ZSP in the Interworld, ZST in Ustroń and ZSGH in Wisła) ensuring accessibility for people with disabilities. https://www.powiat.cieszyn.pl/fastMenu/projekty-ue

title: Developing competences from the NUB sector among LO students from subregions: Rybnicki, Gliwicki, Bytomski, Katowice and Sosnowiecki
description: The aim of the project is to prepare 2,500 students of High Schools from the Just Transition (ST) area from 5 subregions: Rybnicki, Gliwicki, Bytomski, Katowice and Sosnowiecki to study courses that prepare future professionals to work in the sector of Modern Business Services in Silesia. Currently, approx. works in this sector in the province. 35,000 people and in the near future, as a result of the energy transition, this industry will generate additional tens of thousands of jobs (ABSL 2022 report). The professions commonly found in the sector can be identified, among others, specialists in accounting, finance, customer service using IT systems (eg. ERP), logistics processes, and the higher education courses that make up the above-mentioned staff include IT, civil engineering, transport, management, and economics. These directions are linked to the green and digital transitions of the economy, as they provide quality jobs that are friendly or minimise negative environmental impacts. As part of the support, implemented in the period of: III.2024 - VI.2026, each student will receive comprehensive support preparing to take up and maintain their studies in Silesia. The acquired skills (including digital and green) will be the basis for students to continue their educational and professional development at a higher level in Silesia in the broadly understood NUB sector. The above assumptions: Strengthening cooperation between higher education and secondary education, providing the student with advisory support, outgoing workshops at the university, help in passing the high-percentage baccalaureate exam in science subjects, courses preparing for studies related to the possibility of obtaining an additional certificate by the student as part of the Integrated Qualifications System, with learning effects inscribed in the effects of higher education courses, will allow to retain qualified staff in the region who will find employment in new, developed industries. The scope of information and promotional activities in the project: -information on the project (recruitment, individual activities, effects) on the websites of the Leader, Partner and Schools and on social media; -information in local (electronic) media; -regular face-to-face meetings with parents, pupils, social and social environment of schools; -development and distribution in schools, local government units, project materials, scope of support, etc. uploading photos from trainings, classes, workshops to social media, - organizing a conference (meeting) summarizing the project, achieved results, achieved goal and presentation of products developed in the project. Various activities and communication channels will be used during inf.-prom. activities. In the materials, we will avoid stereotypes that perpetuate unfavorable images, e.g. the division of women's and men's roles in consciousness. Promotion activities will be carried out in accordance with the Guidelines on information and promotion of European Funds for 2021-2027. https://www.polsl.pl/roz/

title: Development of post-mining areas through the construction of recreational and recreational infrastructure over Kleczewska Malta
description: The area of Eastern Wielkopolska, including the Kleczew commune, requires actions aimed at rational development of post-industrial areas. These measures will restore the economic and environmental value of degraded areas and areas affected by the mining industry. The project plans to develop post-mining areas located in the area of the Kleczew commune through the construction of recreational and leisure infrastructure on the Kleczewska Malta. The planned project will help to clean up the area after the operation of the opencast mine and create attractive places to spend time actively both for the residents of Kleczew and the surrounding municipalities, as well as tourists. Through sustainable activities, the project envisages the transformation of these areas into a multifunctional recreation and recreation area that harmoniously combines social, economic and environmental elements. The recreation and recreation area will consist of the following elements: 1) Administrative area with sanitary facilities, green area and playground 2) Disc Golf field 3) Education and recreation park 4) Multifunctional square 5) Parking: 6) Paved surfaces The project also plans actions to promote knowledge on the just and green transition. The material scope of the project includes the following categories of expenditure: 1. Preparatory work – preparation of project documentation 2. Construction of recreational and leisure infrastructure over Kleczewska Malta 3. Construction works – RES installations (de minimis aid) 4. Investor supervision 5. Measures to raise citizens' awareness of the just and green transition 6. Information and promotion of the project 7. Indirect costs Project timetable: - project start date - 01.06.2025 - project end date - 30.05.2027 The project is a stand-alone (operational) unit of analysis. The investment tasks planned in the project are aimed at creating a fully functional and operational infrastructure. The planned activities are aimed at creating a fully operational infrastructure that will serve recreation, environmental education, development of the local economy and improving the quality of life of residents, while supporting the sustainable development of the region through the use of renewable energy sources and adaptation to climate change. The project is an example of a sustainable approach to the development of brownfield sites, combining social, economic and environmental benefits. The transformation of these areas into recreational, educational and touristic spaces will bring long-term benefits to the local community, while contributing to the improvement of the natural environment and strengthening the competitiveness of the region in the investment context.

title: Installations of renewable energy systems for residents of Lądek, Ostrowite, Strzałkowo Municipalities
description: The main objective of the project is to protect the natural environment through the production of energy from renewable sources in the Commune of Strzałkowo, the Commune of Lądek and the Commune of Ostrowite. This will be achieved through the installation of photovoltaic installations with energy storage and heat pumps (air and ground) in private real estate in the above-mentioned local government units. This result will be achieved through project tasks related to the installation of installations using renewable energy sources in private buildings. As part of it, they will be installed in: 1. Communes of Strzałkowo (Lead Partner): 161 sets of photovoltaic micro-installations with a total capacity of 1,281 MW, 95 sets of air and ground heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a total capacity of 1,1554 MW and 122 energy storages for electricity with a total capacity of 1,160 MWh. 2. Municipality of Lądek (partner): 49 sets of photovoltaic micro-installations with a total capacity of 0.366 MW, 36 sets of air and ground heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a total capacity of 0.485 MW and 31 sets of energy storages for electricity with a total capacity of 0.294 MWh. 3. Municipality of Ostrowite (partner): 17 sets of photovoltaic micro-installations with a total capacity of 0.138 MW, 5 sets of air and ground heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a total capacity of 0.072 MW and 8 sets of energy storage for electricity with a total capacity of 0.080 MWh. In accordance with the adopted methodology and conditions for the production of energy from RES in (1.) Strzałkowo Commune, (2.) Lądek and (3.) Ostrowite, the production of electricity from PV panels planned to be installed will be at the level of: 1. 1281,6 MWh/year, 2. 366.4 MWh/year and 3. 138,0 MWh/year, which in total will give a value of - 1786,0 MWh/year. However, for heat energy from heat pumps, the annual yield is for 1. 1781,135 MWh/year, 2. 655,875 MWh/year and 3. 93,962 MWh/year, and the total value will be 2530,9720 MWh/year. According to the planned savings, in the form of produced energy from renewable sources, the estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions will be for 1. 686,714 tCO2/year (calculated CO2 level before project implementation is 1148,445 t per year), 2. 214,757 tCO2/year (CO2 level before implementation is 372,454 t per year) and 3. 73,254 tCO2/year (CO2 level before implementation is 100,873 t per year). The project is in line with the Territorial Plan of Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska and the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040. The project also provides for the use of modern information and communication technologies, such as ICT and ICT, to monitor installed RES devices and report any problems with RES installations. The system will be adapted for all groups of people in terms of horizontal policies. The project also includes activities to increase the knowledge of residents in the field of energy transition and climate change and extensive promotion of the project in order to reach the widest possible audience of the project result. The target group of the planned project are the residents of the Commune of Strzałkowo, the Commune of Lądek and the Commune of Ostrowite, who play a double role as main stakeholders and as direct users of the infrastructure created as a result of the project, as well as other residents of the region who, thanks to the installation of RES, will be able to benefit from the implementation of the main objective of the project, which is to improve environmental protection.

title: Development of post-mining areas near the Kozarzewek reservoir by giving them new functions: Recreation, leisure and tourism
description: The project will be implemented in the area of Kazimierz Biskupi commune, in Konin County, Wielkopolskie Voivodship. The investment area is located in the area of Eastern Wielkopolska, which is currently undergoing a just and green transition. The material scope of the project is the development of post-mining areas, degraded areas and areas affected by the mining industry by giving them new functions mainly through investment activities aimed at the development of brownfield areas (including facilities) in order to give them new functions, the construction of municipal infrastructure in areas with new functions to provide access to basic municipal services, the construction and reconstruction of road infrastructure improving access to areas with new functions to the extent necessary for the implementation of the investment, and activities increasing the knowledge of residents on the just and green transition, including on the concept of the environmental footprint. The implementation of the project is the development of post-mining areas around the reservoir in Kozarzewek, within the territory of the Kazimierz Biskupi commune, which will be given new functions: recreational and tourist. This work stems from the development needs of the municipality, which have been identified in various strategic documents. The implementation of the project will have a positive impact on: - mitigating the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the achievement of the Union's 2030 targets, - improving the investment attractiveness and socio-economic development of the Konin subregion, - the possibility of using valuable natural and cultural assets for tourism and recreation purposes The scope of the project covers the following areas and material scope: 1. Preparation of application documentation, including: feasibility study in the descriptive and computational part and functional-utility program. 2. Giving new functions at the tank in Kozarzewek: recreational and tourist activities - non-assisted activities, including implementation of: - works on the main beach: execution of a pavilion building, a sandy beach, beach volleyball courts, playgrounds, street workout sticks, piers, slips for launching water equipment, execution of other elements of beach development, - works on the campsite: construction of a sanitary building, stands for campers, a campsite, a barbecue gazebo, places for a bonfire, fences, - a wakeboard lift, - a long footbridge on the promontory, - a viewing platform on the promontory, - fishing bridges on the promontory, - development of the southern island along with development of the south-eastern part of the coast: piers, footbridges, beaches, shore zone, - paved surfaces: internal communication and parking, - bicycle roads, -access roads, road ditches, culverts and barriers, - small architecture, - greenery, - sanitary connections to facilities, - sanitary connections in the field (waterworks and sanitary sewage), - power supply to the infrastructure, - external lighting of pedestrians, roadways and parking lots, - monitoring of the area. For the purpose of verifying the correctness of the work, an investor supervision inspector will be selected. 3. Giving new functions at the tank in Kozarzewek: recreational and tourist aid - as part of de minimis aid, including: implementation of RES micro-installations together with investor supervision. 4. Actions to promote knowledge on the just and green transition, including a comprehensive educational campaign in the form of an educational festival. 5. Information and promotion campaign, which will be carried out using the Applicant's own channels (websites and social media - no-cost activities) and using local media (press, web portals)

title: Przykona Commune in transformation - revitalization of the space around the Przykona water reservoir
description: The project includes investment activities aimed at developing the post-industrial area in the Przykona Commune in order to give it new social functions (recreational and leisure). The assumption of the project is to revitalize the space around the Przykona water reservoir, thanks to which a recreation and leisure space will be created in the commune, used free of charge by residents. Planned: - Construction of a nautical marina building with a community centre; - Construction of road infrastructure improving accessibility to and in areas with new functionalities; - Construction of a campsite; - Development of the beach; - Execution of a walking and cycling path with LED lighting along with accompanying robots, small architecture and green areas. The project does not directly create new jobs, but it is assumed that the effect of creating a new recreational space will be the creation of new economic entities generating additional jobs for the inhabitants of the Przykona Commune. The project therefore has a potential impact on the creation of jobs in its surroundings. The project will not be implemented in partnership. However, it was developed in a socialised form, and the results of participation and the comments made (together with the names of the entities submitting them) were made public – the local community actively participated in the development of the project and had an impact on the decision on the choice of the planned option to be implemented (co-operation/co-decision) and the results of the process carried out were made public. The project fits into the assumptions contained in the Przykona Commune Development Strategy for 2022-2030, strategic objective 1.1.Revitalization of degraded rural areas as a form of counteracting negative socio-economic phenomena - directions of action: 1. Development of brown coal post-mining areas in the Dąbrowa-Construction of the Sailing Marina; 2. Construction of communication infrastructure of streets and car parks above the Przykona Water Reservoir. The project consists of the first stage and assumes the following tasks: 1) Development of the Feasibility Study and application form; 2) Construction works - revitalization of the space around the Przykona water reservoir (design and build); 3) Investor supervision; 4) Author's supervision; 5) Information campaign - promoting knowledge on the just and green transition, including on the concept of the environmental footprint; 6) Indirect costs. The project assumes the implementation of promotional activities in accordance with the provisions of the ‘Manual of the applicant and beneficiary of European Funds for 2021-2027’. When creating graphics, the provisions of the Visual Identity Book of the European Funds 2021-2027 brand will be used. As part of the project, it is planned to mark the sign of the European Union and the sign of the European Funds, the colours of the Republic of Poland and the graphic sign of the Wielkopolska Region with all information and promotion activities related to the investment. The beneficiary will mark the documents relating to the project accordingly, inter alia: in terms of documentation on the selection of contractors, notices, publications, materials, etc. and all documents related to the implementation of the project made public, as well as documents and materials for persons and entities participating in the project. These markings will be made in a durable and difficult to remove manner. Information and memorial boards will be placed next to the Przykona Commune Office. The tables will consist of mandatory markings: European Funds (upper-left corner), European Union (upper-right corner), voivodship (lower-right corner), name of the beneficiary, title of the project (max. 150 characters), portal address: www.mapadotacja.gov.pl. Information on the implementation of the project will also be posted on the Applicant's website. The website will meet the requirements of WCAG 2.1 taking into account the AA level.

title: Construction of the Centre for Social Services and the Municipal Cultural Centre with the infrastructure necessary for the Grodziec Commune Office
description: This project assumes the construction of a new public building on industrial areas, which involves their rehabilitation, giving them new useful functions: social, cultural, economic and administrative. The subject of the project is the construction of the Centre for Social Services and the Municipal Cultural Centre with the infrastructure necessary for the needs of the Municipal Office of Grodziec. In addition, the area will be developed around the resulting development, including the construction of an economic and garage building. The whole is within the framework of the just transformation of Eastern Wielkopolska, by increasing the development potential of this region. The project can be divided into 7 main tasks: 1. Preparation of documentation necessary for the implementation of the investment. 2. Construction works – demolition of old buildings and construction of a public building. 3. Acquisition of fixed assets - the first equipment of the building. 4. Acquisition of photovoltaic installation and energy storage. 5. Supervision of construction works. 6. Promotion and information. 7. Promoting a fair and green transition. Total value of the project: PLN 41 284 737.38 gross Total eligible costs: 41 284 737,38 PLN gross Value of co-financing: 33 027 789,90 PLN Own contribution: The result of the project will be the regeneration of the natural environment in the Grodziec Commune, thus creating a public utility infrastructure for residents and all visitors. The existing social, cultural and economic offer will be expanded. The quality of services provided will increase, the accessibility of the building for people with reduced mobility, as well as increasing the comfort of work and handling basic household and civic matters. The development potential of the municipality will increase, among others, through the multiplier effect of the investment, increasing employment by the Applicant, as well as increasing the aesthetics and functionality of the space. Formal indicators and results: • Area of mining/post-mining areas converted to new functions: 0.89 ha • Number of projects that financed reasonable accommodation costs for persons with disabilities (ERDF/CF/JTF): 0 pcs. • Number of environmental awareness information and education campaigns carried out: 1 pc(s) • Number of green projects: 1 pc(s)

title: Installations of renewable energy systems in the City of Słupca
description: The main objective of the project is to protect the environment through the production of energy from renewable sources. This goal will be achieved through the installation of photovoltaic installations with energy storage and heat pumps (air and ground) in private properties in the City of Słupca. This result will be achieved through project tasks related to the installation of installations using renewable energy sources in private buildings. As part of it, the following will be installed: 188 photovoltaic micro-installations with the following capacities: - 2,8 kW; -3.2 kW; -3.6 kW; -4 kW; -4,4 kW; -4,8 kW; -5,2 kW; -5,6 kW; -6 kW; -6.4 kW; -6,8 kW; -7.2 kW; -8 kW; -8,4 kW; -8,8 kW; -9.6 kW; -1 an air heat pump used for the preparation of domestic hot water with a capacity of 1,7 kW; -93 air heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a capacity of - 8 kW; 12 kW; 16 kW; 20 kW, -36 ground source heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a capacity of 8 kW; 12 kW; 16 kW and 20 kW and 168 energy storages for electricity with capacities - 6 kWh and 10 kWh. According to the above, the value of additional renewable electricity generation capacity (PV installations) will be 1,412 MWe and the total capacity of electricity storage facilities will be 1,419 MWh. For the installation of heat pumps, the value of additional renewable heat generation capacity will be 1,697 MWt. In accordance with the adopted methodology and conditions for the production of energy from RES in the City of Słupca, the production of electricity from the planned panels to be installed will be at the level of 1456,4 MWh / year and for thermal energy from heat pumps 2678,985 MWh / year. According to the planned savings in the form of produced energy from renewable sources, the estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions will be 680,827 tCO2/year. The project is in line with the Territorial Plan of Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska and the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040. The project also provides for the use of modern information and communication technologies, such as ICT and ICT, to monitor installed RES devices and report any problems with RES installations. The system will be adapted for all groups of people in terms of horizontal policies. The project also provides for activities increasing the knowledge of residents in the field of energy transition and climate change and extensive promotion of the project in order to reach the widest possible audience of the project result.The target group of the planned project are residents of the City of Słupca, who play a double role as main stakeholders and as direct users of the infrastructure created as a result of the project, as well as other residents of the region who, thanks to the RES installation, will be able to benefit from the implementation of the main goal of the project, which is to improve environmental protection.

title: Renewable energy sources in the Kramsk Commune - 2nd edition.
description: The subject of the project is the design, supply and installation of 263 brand new sets of photovoltaic installations for 257 residential buildings and 6 public buildings in Kramsk. In addition, the project includes the supply and installation of 96 electricity storages, 104 heat pumps, 22 solar collector installations and 16 biomass boilers. The implementation of the project will allow for better use of the green energy produced. All sets of photovoltaic installations and warehouses will be equipped with an energy management system, whose task will be to: monitoring and control of electricity consumption, management of this energy, management and optimisation of the energy consumption profile and maximisation of self-consumption taking into account the optimisation of the final electricity price. The umbrella project will be implemented in the design and build mode consists of the first stage and assumes the following tasks: 1. Preparatory action. 2. Supply and installation of RES installations. 3. Investor supervision 4. Promotional and educational campaigns. 5. Indirect costs (project management) The selection of contractors will take place in a competitive manner, in accordance with the PHP. The main objective of the project is the development of renewable energy through the construction of installations for the production of electricity and heat from RES, including: a. supply and installation of 257 photovoltaic installations and 96 energy storage facilities for residential buildings located in the Kramsk commune b. supply and installation - 22 solar collector installations and 16 pellet boiler installations for households located in the Kramsk commune c. supply and installation of air-water heat pumps for 104 residential buildings to provide heating and hot water d. supply and installation of 6 photovoltaic installations for public utility facilities of the Kramsk commune The goal will be achieved through the implementation of direct objectives that are a response to the defined problems: reducing energy losses, optimising energy consumption and reducing energy costs related to the maintenance of residential public buildings; increasing the stability of the energy grid; support for the development of microgrids and distributed energy (integration of RES at local level); reducing greenhouse gas emissions by enabling the use of more renewable energy and optimising energy consumption; increasing flexibility and resistance to failures; diffusion of the use of RES-based solutions; increasing energy independence. The implementation of the project will contribute to achieving the goal of the FEWP Priority.10 Just transformation of Eastern Wielkopolska, the goal of: CP6 - To enable regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the Union's 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral economy of the Union by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement. The main objective of the project will be achieved by 30.06.2026, the result indicators will be achieved by 31.12.2027.

title: Support for the development of renewable energy sources in the Municipality of Dobra
description: The project consists in the installation of RES:139 PV installations, 63 sets of energy storage, 44 heat pumps, 24 biomass boilers for residential buildings in the Municipality of Dobra (Turkish county). Interest. are the residents of the commune of Dobra, selected on the basis of open, transparent and publicly accessible proceedings for the umbrella project. RES installations and energy storage facilities will be located on real estate owned by the Municipality, to which the Municipality has the right to dispose. The Municipality, which will act as Zam. i Inwest, will be responsible for the implementation of the project. The contractor will be selected in a tender procedure. The real investment will be carried out in the ‘design and build’ mode. Support for project implementation and supervision over its proper implementation will be supervised by the relevant substantive and financial units. The municipality is fully prepared for the implementation of the project, for the investment. there is no requirement for a building permit / construction notification. The investment does not require a strategic environmental assessment. As a result of the implementation of planned solutions, the state of the environment - mainly air - will improve. As a result of the replacement of RES installations, the use of conventional fuels will be reduced. The main objective of the project is to increase the production of electricity and heat from renewable sources in 152 residential buildings in the Commune of Dobra in Eastern Wielkopolska, enabling the achievement of the Union's energy and climate objectives and towards a climate-neutral economy. The project assumes the following tasks: Task 1: Preparatory work Zad 2: Designing and carrying out installation and assembly works of RES installations - without department.gosp/rol. Task 3: Investor supervision Zad 4: Educational activities - advisory meetings for residents of Zad 5: Information and promotion activities Zad 6 Designing and carrying out installation and assembly works of RES installations from department.gosp/rol. Supervision over the works will be carried out by the Supervision Inspector, in accordance with the Construction Law Act. The implemented tasks will allow to achieve indicators: Additional RES-E capacity: 0,623 MW Additional heat generation capacity from RES sources: 0,5406 MW L. of the resulting electricity storage facilities: 63 pcs. L. RES heat generation units built: 68 of them. L. conducted information and education campaigns shaping environmental awareness: 2 pcs. L. RES-E power generation units built: 139 pcs. Electricity storage rooms: 0,2669 MWh Il.output of electricity from RES sources: 529.55 MWh/year Il.extension of thermal energy from RES sources: 520,44 MWh/year Estimated greenhouse gas emissions: 668.20 Mg CO2/year, Project implementation is in accordance with the provisions of PFEW 2021-2027, Prio.10 Just transformation of Eastern Wielkopolska (JSO8.1. Allowing regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the Union’s 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral economy of the Union by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement (FST). Scope of intervention: Building an innovative, zero-emission, dynamic and circular economy. The implementation of the project will contribute to mitigating the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the Union’s 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral economy of the Union by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement. The project objective is in line with the specific objective FST.CP6.I set out for Measure FEWP.10.06 SZOOP European Funds for Wielkopolska 2021-2027. After completion of the investment, during the project durability period, i.e. 5 years from the date of final payment, the resulting property will belong to the commune of Dobra; after this period, the installations will be handed over to the residents free of charge.

title: Installations of renewable energy systems in the Municipality of Koło
description: The main objective of the project is to protect the environment through the production of energy from renewable sources. This will be achieved through the installation of photovoltaic installations with energy storage and heat pumps (air and ground) in private properties in the municipality. This result will be achieved through project tasks related to the installation of installations using renewable energy sources in private buildings. As part of it, the following will be installed: 184 photovoltaic micro-installations with a capacity of 2.8 kW; 3,2 kW; 3,6 kW; 4 kW; 4,4 kW; 4.8 kW; 5,2 kW; 5,6 kW; 6 kW; 6.4 kW; 6.8 kW; 7.2 kW; 7.6 kW; 8 kW; 8.8 kW; 9.2 kW; 9.6 kW; 10 kW; 12 kW, 1 air heat pump used for the preparation of domestic hot water with a capacity of 1.7 kW; 105 air heat pumps used for central heating and domestic hot water with a capacity of 8 kW; 12 kW; 16 kW; 20 kW, 22 ground source heat pumps for central heating and domestic hot water with 8 kW capacity; 12 kW; 16 kW and 75 energy storages for electricity with capacities - 6 kWh and 10 kWh. According to the above, the value of additional renewable electricity generation capacity (PV installations) will be 1,4048 MWe and the total capacity of electricity storage facilities will be 0,694 MWh. For the installation of heat pumps, the value of additional renewable heat generation capacity will be 1,449 MWt. According to the adopted methodology and conditions for the production of energy from RES in the Municipality of Koło, the production of electricity from the planned panels will be at the level of 1404.8 MWh / year and for thermal energy from heat pumps 2213.98 MWh / year. According to the planned savings in the form of produced energy from renewable sources, the estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions will be 747,223 tCO2/year. The project is in line with the Territorial Plan of Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska and the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040. The project also provides for the use of modern information and communication technologies, such as ICT and ICT, to monitor installed RES devices and report any problems with RES installations. The system will be adapted for all groups of people in terms of horizontal policies. The project also provides for activities to increase the knowledge of residents in the field of energy transition and climate change and extensive promotion of the project in order to reach the widest possible audience of the project result.The target group of the planned project are residents of the Municipality of Koło, who play a double role as main stakeholders and as direct users of the infrastructure created as a result of the project, as well as other residents of the region who, thanks to the RES installation, will be able to benefit from the implementation of the main goal of the project, which is to improve environmental protection.

title: RES umbrella project - support for the development of renewable energy sources in the Słupca Commune
description: The main objective of the project is to protect the environment through the production of energy from renewable sources. This will be achieved through the installation of photovoltaic installations with energy storage and heat pumps (air and ground) in private properties in the municipality. This result will be achieved through project tasks related to the installation of installations using renewable energy sources in private buildings. As part of it, the following will be installed: 168 photovoltaic micro-installations with a capacity of 3.2 kW; 3,6 kW; 4 kW; 4,4 kW; 4.8 kW; 5,2 kW; 5,6 kW; 6 kW; 6.4 kW; 6.8 kW; 7.2 kW; 7.6 kW; 8 kW; 8.8 kW; 9.2 kW; 9.6 kW; 10 kW; and 82 air-based heat pumps for central heating and domestic hot water with a capacity of 8 kW; 12 kW; 16 kW; 20 kW, 15 ground heat pumps used for central heating and hot water with a capacity of 8 kW; 12 kW; 16 kW and 102 energy storages for electricity with capacities - 6 kWh and 10 kWh. According to the above, the value of additional renewable electricity generation capacity (PV installations) will be 1,241 MWe and the total capacity of electricity storage facilities will be 0,924 MWh. For the installation of heat pumps, the value of additional renewable heat generation capacity will be 1.096 MWt. In accordance with the adopted methodology and conditions for the production of energy from RES in the Municipality of Słupca, the production of electricity from the planned panels will be at the level of 1241.60 MWh / year and for thermal energy from heat pumps 1613.977 MWh / year. According to the planned savings in the form of produced energy from renewable sources, the estimated annual decrease in greenhouse gas emissions will be 662,521 tCO2/year. The project is in line with the Territorial Plan of Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska and the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040. The project also provides for the use of modern information and communication technologies, such as ICT and ICT, to monitor installed RES devices and report any problems with RES installations. The system will be adapted for all groups of people in terms of horizontal policies. The project also provides for activities increasing the knowledge of residents in the field of energy transition and climate change and wide-ranging promotion of the project in order to reach the widest possible audience of the project result.The target group of the planned project are residents of the Commune of Słupca, who play a double role as main stakeholders and as direct users of the infrastructure resulting from the implementation of the project, as well as other residents of the region who, thanks to the RES installation, will be able to benefit from the implementation of the main goal of the project, which is to improve environmental protection.

title: Development of infrastructure for individual non-emission traffic through the expansion of bicycle paths in the Kleczew Commune
description: The project envisages the construction of bicycle roads in the area of the Kleczew commune with the necessary accompanying infra. The scope of the investment includes the following sections: - walking and cycling path on the section Budzisław Kościelny - Adamowo, - cycling path in Budzisław Kościelny on the section from ul. Słoneczna do Szkolna, - bicycle path on the Sławoszewek-Sławoszewo section The project includes equipment with accompanying infrastructure improving the comfort of the cyclist: - Walking and cycling path between Budzisław Kościelny and Adamowo: Along the path, 3 rest areas with dimensions of 5.0 m x 2.0 m are designed, limited by a concrete edging 8x30 with a bench and a bicycle stand and a trash can. The resting place in km 2+620.0 will also be equipped with a gazebo with a wooden structure with a roof measuring 5.0mx2.0 m and a self-service bicycle repair station - Bicycle path in Budzisław Kościelne on the section from ul. Sunny to School: Along the path at the exit into Szkolna Street, there is a resting place with a bicycle rack (min 4 places), a bench and a trash can. - Cycle path on the Sławoszewek-Sławoszewo section: During the cycle path, 3 resting places with a bench, a bicycle rack and a trash can are planned. It was also designed to install a repair station for bicycles. The project envisages actions contributing to the reduction of electricity consumption and CO2 emissions: - Walking and cycling path between Budzisław Kościelny and Adamowo: solar-wind hybrid lamp mounted on a pole in the rest area, - Cycle path on the Sławoszewek-Sławoszewo section: four hybrid lamps were designed at pedestrian crossings. Hybrid lanterns illuminating the pedestrian crossing, As a result of the rea. of the project, a cycling infrastructure will be created that will allow the development of alternative forms of movement to motorized transport. In order to increase the long-term benefits, the project is planning to carry out an educational and inf.-prom. activity on the promotion of cycling, as well as a fair and green energy transition. Among other things, it is planned to: bicycle rallies (2 x PLN 7,500.00 = PLN 15,000.00), picnics (2 x PLN 2500.00 = PLN 5,000.00). The material scope of the project includes the following categories of expenditure: 1. Construction works – construction of bicycle paths in Kleczew 2. Investor supervision 3. Information and promotion activities on public transport, cycling and walking, as well as on the just transition 4. Information and promotion of the Harmon project. real. project: - start date of project. - 01.05.2025 - Project completion date – 30.11.2025 The project is a stand-alone (operational) unit of analysis. The investment tasks planned in the project are aimed at creating a fully functional and operational infrastructure. The solutions adopted in the project are characterized by functionality and durability required for this type of infrastructure. The construction of cycle paths in the municipality of Kleczew will contribute to achieving tangible benefits from increasing the use of cycling in everyday journeys for road transport, which will contribute to reducing the negative impact of motorised traffic on the environment and residents. Kleczew Commune is located in the area of Eastern Wielkopolska, which will significantly feel the effects of the energy transition. It will be important to use the region's development potential in the form of, among others, favorable geographical location, industrial traditions, tourist potential. For the development of the Great. Tackling environmental degradation and adapting to climate change is an extremely important challenge for the East. Activities promoting and developing non-motorized transport in the city area give a real chance to reduce the level of emissions of harmful substances into the air.

title: Investment in technologically innovative fixed assets in the newly established branch of the company in order to increase production capacity and employ new people
description: The subject of the project is the purchase of a technologically modern, innovative new machine park. As part of this project, a new product and service offer will be introduced. The implementation of the project will contribute to: - faster execution of orders, - creation of additional jobs (2 people), - increasing competitiveness in relation to other companies with a similar profile. - creation of a new branch and production line - creation of new products and services, - improvement of already existing products in the newly rented hall. - creation of a company branch. The strategic branch of the company will be located in Eastern Wielkopolska in Strzałkowo. The company signed a lease agreement for the warehouse and production hall on 26.08.23 for the period from 26.08.23 to 31.12.2030, where a branch of the company will be established. The area of the hall is 500 m2. The project concerns the increase of production capacity through the purchase of a new machine park for a new branch of the company, as well as the development of new products previously purchased in order to concentrate production within a single company. The objectives of the project are in line with the objective of Action 10.02 on adapting to changing market conditions and technologies and creating new jobs, digitisation and internationalisation. As part of the implementation of the project, it is planned to: 1. Purchase of a Production Line complete for assembling SMD components on PCBs 2. Purchase of CNC milling plotter for acrylic , plexi 3. Purchase of a water cutting CNC plotter – Water Jet 4. Purchase of CNC laser for cutting metal 5. Purchase of service - Conducting specialized training in connection with each purchase of equipment 6. Order to create software to detect theft in gates. As part of the project, a new product and service offer will be introduced , Project location - Strzałkowo ul. B. Nowakowskiego 1b The project is executed in terms of personnel, financial, technical and organizational. The project will be carried out in several stages: Phase I of the project: - purchase of an acrylic cutting plotter and a metal cutting laser - Training of employees on the operation of an acrylic cutting plotter and training on a metal cutting laser II stage of the project: – purchase and assembly of the production line – training on the operation of the production line Stage III of the project: - purchase of a water cutting plotter - training in the field of operation of a water cutting plotter IV stage of the project: - The service of digitization implementation in the enterprise implemented throughout the project implementation period, i.e. the development and implementation of software for detecting theft. The software will be a unique solution on a global scale. This project is consistent with: - Territorial Plan for the Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska - Strategy for the Development of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040 - Strategy for the Development of the Wielkopolska Region until 2030 - Regional Innovation Strategy for Wielkopolska

title: Improving the medical offer of CM Multimed in Konin as a response to changing market and technological conditions.
description: The CM Multimed project is about adapting to market changes and technological progress in order to maintain competitiveness in the city of Konin. The investment includes a number of activities aimed at improving the Company's potential, including the acquisition of modern medical devices to improve the 4 specialist services provided so far (cardiology, endocrinology, diabetes and rheumatology), as well as the implementation of one new service to the offer, previously not provided by the entity in the form of an internal diseases clinic. Modern equipment (diagnostic ultrasound, echocardiograph and pressure holters) and its functionalities will broaden the range of available tests, increase the precision of obtained results, and as a result will increase the effectiveness of diagnosis and treatment (adults and children), in particular in the area of progressive civilization diseases. All these services constitute product innovations at least at company level (and even at national level, due to the introduction of ultrasound functionality on the market in 2022) and will be permanently implemented in CM Multimed’s offer. This will allow you to stand out from competing entities and offer a fully comprehensive medical offer. Additional but not less important elements of the investment will be: - purchase and installation of a photovoltaic micro-installation for heating domestic water, which is an essential element in a medical facility. The installation of RES (with a capacity of 4.1 kW) will allow the generation of clean energy only for own needs, contributing to reducing the demand for energy from conventional sources (from the heating network for the needs of cwu), positively affecting the natural environment and the company's transformation towards sustainable development. - purchase and implementation of software streamlining the process of cooperation with PZU ZDROWIE and training in its operation (performance of the training service for the Company's staff), which will contribute to increasing the level of digitalisation of the company, including the automation of registration or settlement of medical services under insurance for the benefit of employees, but also patients. The project will further increase employment in the region, as it is planned to create at least 2 new jobs (2 full-time jobs) necessary to provide an extended medical offer. All the activities indicated are planned for the period 01.03.2024 – 31.07.2024. The project will be implemented from the Company’s own funds, together with the planned co-financing. The scope and expected effects of the project will contribute to the achievement of the objectives set out in the Territorial Just Transition Plan for Eastern Wielkopolska, directly fitting into the types of operations envisaged for SO 1. Building a zero-emission, dynamic and circular economy, ‘Diversified and modernised economy’, ‘Support for investments in SMEs in adapting to changing market and technological conditions and creating new jobs, as well as internationalisation and digitalisation of businesses’ activities’. The investment includes the implementation of activities aimed at increasing the company's potential in the face of market transformational changes, including the digitalisation of processes and contributes to the increase of employment in the company, while increasing the qualifications of employees through the implementation of trainings. The project will also have a positive impact on the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, sustainable development and will contribute to mitigating the particularly negative effects of the restructuring of the mining and energy sector in the city of Konin (in accordance with the Development Strategy of Eastern Wielkopolska 2040).

title: Extension and improvement of the offer of the Konin Veterinary Centre in Konin in order to adapt to changing market and technological conditions
description: The subject of the project is an investment in fixed assets and intangible assets as well as the implementation of a training service. The measures taken are aimed at adapting the Konin Veterinary Centre in Konin to changing market and technological conditions. As a result of the project, we will expand the service offer by 1 new service - neonatal care and improve veterinary diagnostics in the area of X-ray and ultrasound diagnostics (2 improved services). The project will be implemented within 4 coherent and logically divided tasks. The investment scope of the project includes the purchase of: – incubators – 2 items; - ultrasound scanner - 1 unit; - x-ray apparatus - 1 unit; - operating lamp - 1 piece; - photovoltaic installation – 1 set; - heat pumps - 1 set; - software for managing new devices - 1 piece; The investment in the adopted scope is an expansion of the company in terms of increasing its technical resources, expanding the service offer. The technical solutions used in the above-mentioned devices are adequate to the investment and constitute the necessary resources for the development of the company. In addition, the technological solutions used in them, which will translate into the quality of services provided, will enable a full response to own needs in terms of diversification of the offer, expansion of the target group, as well as the expansion of technical facilities, implementation of RES solutions and increasing employment. The project will also respond to identified market needs in terms of quality, speed and accuracy of diagnosis and comprehensive veterinary care. The development of the service offer and investment in new technical resources is associated with the need to ensure proper and comprehensive service. Therefore, as a result of the project, we will create 2 new jobs. In addition, we assume an increase in the competence and qualifications of our staff in order to ensure the best possible customer service and treatment of animals. The project also takes into account the implementation of a digital solution in the form of ready-made software, which will enable the digitization and digitization of the research carried out and the results obtained. This will improve data archiving and keeping full patient records. The scope and expected effects of the project will contribute to the achievement of the objectives set out in the Territorial Plan for Just Transition of Eastern Wielkopolska. This is because the investment fits directly into the types of operations envisaged for ‘CS 1. Building a zero-emission, dynamic and circular economy’, ‘Diversified and modernised economy’, point ‘- support for investments in SMEs in adapting to changing market and technological conditions and creating new jobs, as well as internationalisation and digitalisation of businesses’ activities. The project is aimed at increasing the company's potential in the face of market transformational changes, as well as the implementation of digital solutions and contributes to the increase of employment in the company, while increasing the qualifications and knowledge of employees.

title: Improving and expanding the offer of "FENIKS" bakery in order to increase the company's potential in the face of transformational changes
description: As part of the project, it is planned to modernize the production infrastructure by acquiring modern bakery machines for equipping the plant along with the digitization of elements of the baking process through a recipe system and improving working conditions, taking into account the increase in production capacity. The purchase of the indicated equipment will allow to optimize production by implementing changes in the process and thus improving it, modernizing the offer - including the introduction of new and improved bakery products. Measurable environmental effects will also be possible. Thanks to the implementation of the project with the planned scope, it will be possible to implement one improved baking process and 1 new range of butter bread, the production of which has not been possible so far due to significant technological limitations. The project will create 2 new jobs and will have a significant positive impact on the environment, thanks to the adopted technological assumptions of the investment. It will be possible to achieve a better energy balance - it is planned to use highly energy-efficient machines and devices, use technologies that reduce the consumption of fuel (pellet) and increase the precision of baking, which will contribute to reducing the amount of so-called defective bread. The last of these effects will be possible to achieve thanks to the implemented recipe software, which will improve the process of making bread by precise control of weighing of raw materials. The entire investment will serve as a significant automation of baking and will affect fundamental changes in the production process, optimizing efficiency and increasing innovation and economic efficiency of the PPHU Phoenix bakery plant. The bakery's production staff will receive implementation training in the area of handling new machines and software, which will allow for an increase in professional qualifications and competences, and new employees recruited as a result of the investment to the position of the furnace operator will be facilitated by possible retraining (e.g. from mining-related professions). The scope and expected effects of the project will contribute to the achievement of the objectives set out in the Territorial Just Transition Plan for Eastern Wielkopolska, directly in line with the types of operations envisaged for ‘CS 1. Building a zero-emission, dynamic and circular economy’, ‘Diversified and modernised economy’, point ‘- support for investments in SMEs in adapting to changing market and technological conditions and creating new jobs, as well as internationalisation and digitalisation of businesses’ activities. The investment includes the implementation of activities aimed at increasing the company's potential in the face of market transformational changes, as well as includes the digitalisation of processes and contributes to the growth of employment in the company, while increasing the qualifications and knowledge of employees through access to specialized implementation (industry) training.

title: Museum of Brewing and Mining with innovative beer and wort drink production line and restaurant, winery and educational path
description: The aim of the project is to create a ‘Brewing and Mining Museum with an innovative beer and wort drink production line and a restaurant, winery and educational path’. The project will be implemented in Wałbrzych, Sobięcin district, ul. Emilii Plater 3A, 58-305 Wałbrzych. The implementation of the project will be achieved through: construction works (stage I) and purchase of fixed assets (stage II). The scope of construction works includes: renovation of the water tower and foundation of the mezzanine for the brewery and the Museum. As regards fixed assets, the purchase of: technological line for the production of beer with a pasteurizer – brewery, line for bottling – brewery, hall – museum, multimedia equipment (holograms, screens, sound system) – museum, equipment for the catering part – kitchen, restaurant, bar, wine bar, beer garden. The renovation of the water tower will allow you to organize a beer garden, and the foundation of the mezzanine in the main building will allow you to create a Brewing Museum along with the possibility of admiring an innovative technological line for the production of beer and wort drink. The purchase of an innovative technological line for the production of beer with a pasteurizer and a line for bottling will allow the creation of an innovative product - beer aerated with volatile nitrogen and wort drink. The acquisition and foundation of the hall will enable the creation of a Mining Museum, where mining exhibits and purchased multimedia equipment in the form of holograms, screens and sound system will be located. The purchase of catering equipment will enable the launch of a kitchen, restaurant, bar, winery, beer garden. The main objective of the project is to identify innovations at both product and process level. The innovative process created by the Applicant will be to improve the fermentation process with an aeration pear, which by filling with nitrogen in a volatile state creates a high-quality foam with a creamy consistency on the surface of the beer, which significantly affects the taste, maintaining the optimal temperature and intensified visual and aesthetic values. The product innovation will consist in brewing beer with an increased content of carbon dioxide and nitrogen, which improves both the taste and visual quality of the drink. In addition, we are dealing with product innovation in the form of a wort drink so far not produced in Poland by any brewery. The specific objectives will be: • diversification of Libertador, which is currently engaged in courier business; • launching a new investment for the company (initial investment); • changing the utility function of the site from mining to tourism; • creating a new machine park of the company through the purchase of modern equipment; • adaptation of degraded buildings and their restoration to public use; • support for the development of the Wałbrzych sub-region; • support for the just transition process in Lower Silesia. The project will contribute to local economic growth. Thanks to the implementation of the project, Wałbrzych will gain a modern tourist place with a combination of education and entertainment. The revitalization of the post-mining facility and the introduction of planned services will increase the interest of tourists who will visit the Wałbrzych region with even greater intensity. The project involves the employment of 6 people in the newly created Museum. The project will allow for social enrichment culturally (Museum of Brewing and Mining), but also materially (adoption of post-mining facilities) of Wałbrzych. The investment will allow the local community to be positively, ecologically and innovatively included in the heritage of Lower Silesia. The information and promotion activities of the project will include the purchase of promotional and information materials, the purchase of press announcements, the creation and maintenance of a website about the project, project marking, poster/promotional boards/information boards, electronic displays, leaflets resulting from the obligations of the Applicant.

title: Social services for residents of the Wałbrzych subregion supported by the JTF affected by the negative effects of the transition
description: The main objective of the project is to improve access to social and care services relevant to increasing the professional activity of excluded people and their families affected by the negative effects of the transition, including people whose inactivity results from the need to care for dependent persons and to counteract the social exclusion of people in vulnerable situations on the labour market by using the potential of social economy entities. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES - increasing access to social and care services and improving the quality of social life for 20 people (12K,8M) at risk of poverty or social exclusion in need of support in everyday functioning by, inter alia, increasing the availability of community-based social services, including care services, and - increasing access to social services and improving the quality of social and working life for 20 real carers (12K,8M) at risk of poverty or social exclusion through participation in the "Carer of a dependent person" course and psychological support. The implementation of services assumes the organization of a comprehensive program including care services in the place of residence for 20 UP (12K,8M), specialized care services for 20 UP (12K,8M), support for 20 actual caregivers (12K,8M) through the possibility of acquiring competences / qualifications within the course of a caregiver for dependent people and individual psychological counseling. Implementation of the tasks is planned in the period 01.01.2024r.-30.06.2025r. Increasing the comprehensiveness of support for residents of the Wałbrzych subregion covered by JTF support requiring assistance in everyday functioning will be achieved through an increase in the number of places where care services are provided at the place of residence. The implementation of the project will additionally contribute to increasing the quality of life of people in need of support in everyday functioning, including people with disabilities, through access to high-quality social services. Project type 9.1.A Prevention of exclusion from the labour market, which includes the following scope: the development of personal assistance and care services (including specialised care services) for people in need of support in their day-to-day functioning, together with accompanying support increasing the chances of independent living, provided in the local community for care services and specialised care services provided at home; support for the staff of social assistance and inclusion institutions in the field of education, including training and practical activities and exchange of experience for actual carers, including but not limited to improving their skills in caring for people in need of support in everyday functioning; and counselling, including psychological counselling and assistance in obtaining information to navigate the different support systems needed to provide quality care and relieve the burden on actual carers; d) deinstitutionalization of entities providing round-the-clock support: - residential care services and specialised care services. MAIN RESULTS Number of service places created in the local community: 20 Number of persons who obtained a qualification after leaving the programme: min.16 Number of jobseekers after leaving the programme: min.16 The project will be implemented under the European Funds for the Transformation of Mining Areas in Lower Silesia programme;Just Transition Fund;Priority 9 European Funds for the Transformation of Mining Areas in Lower Silesia; Action 9.1Social transformation;type:9.1.A Preventing exclusion from the labour market. The project complies with the Rules and Regulations and the Detailed Description of the Priorities of the European Funds for Lower Silesia Programme 2021- 2027.
