title: Replacement of the central heat source with the installation of ventilation units in Szyba Irena
description: The subject of the project is ‘Replacement of the central heat source with the installation of ventilation units in Szyba Irena’. The project will be implemented in Wałbrzych, Sobięcin district, ul. Emilii Plater 3A, 58-305 Wałbrzych. The project will be achieved by replacing the heat source – from a non-compliant coal boiler to three heat pumps in the system: a cascade of two pumps and one outside the cascade. In addition, local systems in ventilation units will be used. The entire investment is the purchase of fixed assets/supply. The main objective of the project is thermomodernization consisting in reducing the consumption of heat and energy by replacing the heat source in the historic building. The specific objectives will be: • supporting the development of the Wałbrzych subregion and the just transition of Lower Silesia included in the FEDS 2021-27 Programme and in the TPST, i.e. improving the energy efficiency of buildings, facilities and processes, combined with reducing energy consumption (heat, cold, electricity), in a way that guarantees the achievement of the objectives of reducing low emissions and decarbonisation; • Achieve a positive ecological effect. The project will contribute to the modernisation of the post-mining facility. Thermomodernization will save thermal energy at the level of 80.27%. The investment will contribute to reducing air degradation through the use of RES. The information and promotion activities of the project will include the purchase of promotional and information materials, the purchase of press announcements, the creation and maintenance of a website about the project, project marking, poster/promotional boards/information boards, electronic displays, leaflets resulting from the obligations of the Applicant.

title: The Sound Revolution: Modern Sound System for Sound Production as part of Sustainable Regional Development
description: The "Sound Revolution" project is an initiative of Sound Production Sp. z o.o., which aims to implement a modern sound system, contributing to the introduction of an innovative event sound service, and thus to strengthen the company's competitiveness. The project is closely related to the needs of our socio-economic environment, and its objectives have been defined based on an analysis of market requirements and development trends in the sector. Objectives of the project: a) Increasing the quality of sound production: A modern sound system will enable us to achieve a significantly higher level of sound quality in our productions. b) Optimization of energy consumption in the company - thanks to the implementation of innovative equipment that consumes less energy. c) Introduction of an innovative service - as a result of the implementation of the project, a new service will be created: implementation of publicity of events in array processing technology. d) Increased competitiveness: With improved sound quality and new technological capabilities, we will be able to compete at a higher level, attracting new customers and opening the door to larger projects. By implementing a modern sound system, we also want to have a positive impact on the aspects of sustainable development. These activities will become part of a long-term commitment to reducing emissions and decarbonisation, in line with the objectives of the FEDS 2021-2027 and TPST. (f) Economic activation through the creation of new jobs as a result of the project. As part of information and promotion activities, we plan to make information available on our website, presenting the benefits of introducing a modern sound system. The project is in line with the assumptions: European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021-2027 - the objective of measure 9.4 is investment support for SMEs from the manufacturing and service sectors, contributing to the expansion (diversification, modernisation) of the enterprise and increasing its competitiveness - support closely related to the goals of the transformation process of the subregion. The specific objective is to enable regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the Union’s 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral economy of the Union by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement (FST). The proposed lines of action are: grant support for investments in SMEs, grant support for investments in SMEs contributing to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and decarbonisation, the implementation of circular economy solutions, reducing the energy intensity of processes and services, investments in R&D activities and the implementation of innovations increasing the potential of Lower Silesian smart specialisations. - Territorial Just Transition Plan for the Lower Silesian Voivodeship 2021-2030 - Wałbrzych Subregion: the specific economic objective is economic activation and strengthening competitiveness by exploiting the endogenous potential of the sub-region in a way that ensures the achievement of the objectives of low emission reduction and decarbonisation. This goal assumes the activation of the economic sector in the area of green, competitive technologies, opens an opportunity for the development of innovation and diversification of economic activity and the creation of additional jobs with significant added value in industries already present in the subregion. For the economic purpose, activities of changes in products, processes that fit into the principles of circularity will be implemented. The implementation of the investment will contribute to the dynamic development of the company operating in the Wałbrzych Subregion for years. The Sound Revolution project is a step towards increasing the quality of our services, strengthening our market position and contributing to the sustainable development of our region, harmonizing the objectives of the project with the objectives of FEDS 2021-2027 and TPST.

title: Purchase of an excavator to diversify services, fundamentally change processes and innovate within EMBUD Laskowski Emil Construction and Repair Services
description: The aim of the project is to purchase 1 wheeled excavator, thanks to which EMBUD Laskowski Emil Serwis Budowlano-Remontowe will be able to introduce road works and the construction of water, sewage and rainwater networks to its offer. Buying an excavator and expanding the company's offer will allow you to: - diversification of the company's services, through the introduction of new, previously unoffered works and works, - a fundamental change in the processes of providing services, which, thanks to the purchase of an excavator, will significantly change their form, - introduction of process innovation within the company, in the form of a change in the implementation of the processes of providing services, - introduction of product innovation in the form of the provision of services not yet offered, due to the lack of appropriate equipment. In connection with the implementation of the project, indirect costs related to the purchase of the excavator, the correct implementation of the project in question, as well as the introduction of changes in the Applicant's company were also planned. The implementation of the project will allow to respond to the growing demand for road works, construction of water, sewage and rainwater networks in the Wałbrzych subregion. The purchase of the excavator will also contribute to increasing the competitiveness, capabilities and revenues of EMBUD Laskowski Emil Budowlano-Remontowe. The development of the company and the implementation of the above-mentioned services will contribute to local economic development, increase the value of real estate in the region, improve urban infrastructure or create jobs. The last benefit will be provided by the project's planned employment of 4 people: 1 excavator operator and 3 construction workers. The objective of the project is also consistent with the objectives of: - European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021-2027, whose specific objective for measure 9.4 A (Investments in SMEs) is investment support for SMEs in the manufacturing and service sector, contributing to the expansion of the enterprise and increasing its competitiveness, through, inter alia, the purchase of machinery and equipment - in the case of this project it is the purchase of an excavator, as well as the creation of jobs - in the case of this project it is the creation of 4 jobs. - the Territorial Just Transition Plan for the Lower Silesian Voivodeship 2021-2030; The Wałbrzych subregion, whose spatial objective, consistent with the objectives of this project, is to provide the inhabitants of the subregion with a high quality environment and to restore full economic and environmental value to degraded areas. As part of the project promotion, the applicant will implement information and promotion activities, in accordance with the principles of the "European Funds for Lower Silesia 2021-2027" program, such as: - documentation related to the project, as well as documents and materials intended for project participants will be marked with appropriate logos, - an information board or an information poster will be placed in visible places of the project implementation, - the Applicant's social media will include relevant information about the funding that is planned to be obtained from EU funds, - fixed assets planned for purchase, i.e. a wheeled excavator will be marked with appropriate stickers.

title: Increasing production capacity at RAPMET Sp. z o.o. thanks to an energy-efficient investment in fixed assets.
description: The subject of the project is the purchase of equipment, anti-dust and photovoltaic installations aimed at increasing the production capacity for the production of steel elements at RAPMET Sp. z o.o., while increasing the quality of workmanship of individual details, using electricity from RES and reducing dust emissions arising in the technological process, as well as reducing the noise level. After the analysis of the economic environment of the region and taking into account the planned increase in demand for high-quality, castomized (atypical and non-series) steel products both at the country level and in exports (especially to the Scandinavian countries), the following project objectives were defined: 1) Directly: - increasing production capacity in the production of steel semi-finished products or finished products, - increasing the quality of products (machine levelling of sharp edges of steel elements), - reducing dust arising during the production of steel elements, - ensuring the supply of purchased equipment with electricity from renewable sources. - reduction of electricity consumption. 2) Indirect: - increasing the competitiveness of manufactured products, - reducing CO2 emissions into the atmosphere, - increasing employment. These objectives are closely linked to the specific objectives FEDS 2021-2027 and TPST (Territorial Just Transition Plan for Lower Silesia 2021-2030; Wałbrzych Subregion), as described later in the application. The implementation of the intention requires the purchase of: - laser cutting machine (devices for laser cutting of steel elements), - deburring machine (devices for edge processing after laser cutting), - filter fan with complete installation (installation for significant reduction of dust emissions), - photovoltaic panels. The project involves the installation of purchased equipment in a new production hall, currently under construction, located in the Wałbrzych subregion. The commissioning of the new facility prepared for the assembly of machines and equipment is planned for June 2024. The most important stages of the project will be: ordering machines and equipment, preparing the place of their foundation, delivery, assembly and commissioning. The implementation of the project does not require obtaining any permits/concessions/licenses for the assembly of equipment planned for purchase. The project fits directly into the Lower Silesian Innovation Strategy 2030, meeting the requirements set for the Intelligent Specialization of Lower Silesia: 5. ‘Green Deal’ and 6. ‘INDUSTRY 4.0’. As part of the information and promotion activities, it is planned to include relevant information on the Applicant's website: www.rapmet.pl.

title: A new job in a better climate
description: Objective: To enable regions and people to mitigate the social, employment, economic and environmental impacts of the transition towards the EU 2030 targets for energy and climate and towards a climate-neutral EU economy by 2050 based on the Paris Agreement through the implementation of the Project (P). The project concerns comprehensive transformation and support programs on the labour market undertaken in the area of Mał. Zach. (referred to as: Chrzanów, Olkusz, Oświęcim, Wadowice). The project is addressed to target groups (GD): workers at risk of dismissal, intended for dismissal or made redundant for reasons not related to the worker in the sectors/sectors undergoing transformation and directly related to them; (b) economically inactive (i.e. economically inactive) living in a shared home with persons referred to in point (a) (c) interested in setting up their own DG in the area of Mał. Zach, I'm sorry. (regardless of labour market status) (d) employers in transition industries/sectors and directly related to them. Support is to be directed to people working or living or learning in the province of small. – Small Zach, I'm sorry. The support provided under the P will be tailored to the individual needs of the Project Participants (PO) through diagnosis and creation of Individual Action Plans (IPDs) and referral to diagnosed forms of support. The support offered will directly contribute to the improvement of the social situation of UP on the labour market (RP). P will be implemented respecting the principle of: equality between women and men, equal opportunities and non-discrimination, sustainable development and the DHSN, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union and the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. P will be implemented in accordance with the provisions of FEM 2021-2027 and SZOP FEM 2021-2027 and Pr. 8. European Funds for Just Transition of the Malopolska Region 8.1 Actions to improve the situation on the labour market, Project Type A. Comprehensive transformation and support programs on the labour market and the Standard of services of the project implemented under Measure 8.1 FEM for 2021-2027. Planned duration of the project: 36 months. TASKS: 1 Monitoring of the labour market in small and medium-sized voivodships, establishing relations with Employers 2 Diagnosis and identification of the needs of Project Participants (IPD) 3 Job placement/Advice/Individual and group counselling/Incentive support/Aided employment UP-Training 5 Direct-Association EP-Preparation for employment initiatives - traineeships OP – financial support for the start-up of own business together with training services in the pre-start-up phase OP – Grants for retrofitting or equipping a workplace with an employer UP – Subsidised employment 9 UP – Adaptation support for employee 10 OP- support for initiatives to improve geographical mobility capacity 11 UP– other tools 12 IM OP- Use of other European countries RESULTS: RESULTS: The main result of P will be to improve the social situation of 56 people from the target groups after leaving the project, by supporting the above-mentioned target groups in the project, including: a) L. pers. who, as a result of the implementation of support in the field of outplacement / improvement of the working environment, took up work or continued employment - 35 b) L. pers. looking for work after leaving the program -13 c) L. pers. who took up education or training after leaving the program - 8 d) L. pers. who obtained qualifications after leaving the program - 42 e) L. pers. working, including self-employed workers, after leaving the program - 47 f) L. pers. whose system has improved after leaving the program - 56

title: University's offer for energy transformation in Western Małopolska
description: The aim of the project is to prepare a comprehensive educational offer for local administration and key stakeholders in the context of the energy transformation of Western Małopolska. The objective will be achieved during the period: 1.IX.2024 – 31.VIII.2026r. by developing substantive enclosures, i.e. dashboard materials taking into account regional specialisations for qualifications selected at the diagnosis stage, in particular those operating in the Integrated Qualifications Register, and then testing and implementing the created model into practice. Based on the diagnosis*, it was decided to direct support for the group of 200os. - officials and employees of NGOs from the area of Western Małopolska. It is an area heavily dependent on coal and the mining industry. Due to the ongoing energy transition in Europe and Poland, jobs in mining and related sectors are to be finally extinguished in this region by 2049. This is linked to a process of massive societal change at many levels: education, labour market, social. The key staff to effectively conduct the process are stakeholders from the broadly understood public sector, including: public administration, employees of local government units and their organisational units (e.g. labour offices, organisational units, social assistance units, investment units), as well as employees of the so-called Social Security Offices, 3 sector, as animators and responsible for local development and at the same time supporting groups at risk of poverty and social exclusion. The demand for competences and qualifications in the project is in line with the provisions of the Territorial Just Transition Plan (TPST) for Western Małopolska (MZ), under which various activities are to be initiated to activate and support the EU regions most affected by the negative phenomena of the energy transition. One of the objectives of TPST is to: ...increasing the competences of local administration to prepare for participation in the energy transition and initiatives on climate neutrality, sustainable consumption and the circular economy... One of the most promising sectors in W. Małopolska is the creative industries and leisure time understood as production, production, exhibition, sale and production of copyrighted goods, cultural activities and the tourism industry. The qualifications selected in the project result from the diagnosis carried out and correspond to the development needs of the region in the above-mentioned scope. The competency gap diagnosed concerns in particular skills in the area of: sustainable management, use of ICT tools supporting the customer service process; effective communication; prof. service of contractors; using new technologies, including AI. Our project responds to the diagnosed needs in the area of effective implementation of changes in connection with the long-term, and just starting transformation process, which is finally to be completed in 2049. The university is based in Małopolska, borders with the MZ area and works for the development of the community-gosp. The partnership with the Malopolska Tourism Organization, org. bringing together several hundred employers from the region (companies, institutions, NGOs) will ensure the development of solutions supporting the tourism sector, which has great potential for development. Lesser Poland was visited by 10 million tourists, of which 2.65 million were foreign), a large part of which attracts the richness of the region's cultural heritage. Therefore, the developed training offer for staff implementing the transition will be used for at least several years after the end, ensuring the sustainability of the results. *Diagnosis (desk research) based on: -TPST for Western Małopolska 2022 Regional Innovation Strategy WM 2030; -Intelligent Specializations for Małopolska -WUP Kraków "Adult Learning 2021". Links to the documents confirming the diagnosis of the demand for qualifications can be found in the "Potential for implementation" section.
